description:
plan on take out or eating on the tables outside (very few seats) 

delicious, fresh wraps and combo plates. 

Tuesday and Friday are chicken schwarma days
author: Beth P.

description:
This place is great. On Tuesdays and Fridays they have Chicken Shawarma, which is my favorite. So make sure you go there during these days.
Otherwise, their lamb and falafel are good.

They are fairly priced for a San Francisco pick up restaurant.

This place does have few stools inside for a quick eat and couple of small tables outside, but given the size of the restaurant I do recommend picking up the food or delivering.
author: Jad A.

description:
Super fast, friendly, and delicious. This is a tiny place with maybe 4 seats at a counter. So don't plan on eating in! But awesome for grab & go.

The menu board doesn't show you all the options ... you'll have to grab a paper menu for that (or look on Yelp). 

They have forgotten to put the extra hummus ($1) on my boyfriend's wrap in the past. I would maybe ask for it on the side so that it's visually easy to verify that you got your extra. Otherwise you'll be halfway through your wrap wondering when you'll hit the hummus.
author: Julia C.

description: Close to work but not too close, my go to place for a falafel wrap when I get tired of meat lunches. A little something different and interesting. Freshly made falafels. Alternating-days  lamb and chicken shawarmas. On a warm day sitting outside at the small tables people watching is fun also.
author: tomohisa w.

description:
Truly Mediterranean 

I ordered the Vegetable hummus wrap that was vegan and a side of tabbouleh, also vegan. 

I ordered this through an online delivery app and it came fairly promptly. It was wrapped in foil to keep it warm and still tasted warm when it arrived. There was a lot of hummus and fresh veggies on it and it tasted quite good it was also large enough to share between two people.

That's a bully salad was packaged well and had a good portion size for the price paid however I wasn't too impressed with the taste of the tabouli salad which I have had quite a bit of times for some reason it just tasted like it was missing something maybe not enough lemon or something of that sort but it definitely didn't taste like what typical to political they taste like so that was slightly disappointing. I wish I was able to eat all of the tabouli salad but I didn't like the taste enough to be able to do that.

Lastly I don't know if it was the delivery individuals fault or the restaurant fault but we had to find silverware to be able to use because there is none in the package which was not too easy to find because we are not from the area and we're staying at a very small hotel that luckily was able to find us some.

Anyways I will definitely order the wrap again if I was in the area it was large tasty with this like crunchy on the outside of the wrap and was packaged well. However I would definitely not order the tabouli salad just because I didn't like the taste of it maybe that's just how they make their tabouli salad but I personally would not order that again

As always, go vegan ( or at least try )!
author: Peyton C.

description:
Office lunch, part two. I ordered breakfast from another place, but knew I'd want more food. Since I had $20 to play with, I decided to order a wrap from Truly Mediterranean. Our delivery order arrived via Caviar on Friday, February 9th around 12:30pm.

*Hummus Wrap: Garbanzo dip, tomatoes, parsley, onions, olive oil, and tahini sauce, served on lavash, Vegetarian ($7.15), add Tabuleh (+$1.10)
*Kefta Kabab Plate: Seasoned ground lamb and sirloin, charbroiled to perfection, served with rice, hummus, and tabouleh ($13.20)

I got the hummus wrap, but a coworker was nice enough to share his kebab plate. The wrap was actually huge! A good amount of hummus filling. Though it was a little thinner than I prefer. Kinda runny with all the ingredients mixed together. And messy to eat. Definitely a knife and fork situation. I had added tabbouleh, but unfortunately, I never got it. Good thing I had the plate since it came with tabbouleh. I love the freshness it adds to Mediterranean food. The tried the kofta which was okay. A bit dry, but the hummus helped with that when I ate them together.

Decent Mediterranean food. Though I'm bummed they forgot my tabbouleh. A waste of $1+. Not sure if it was Caviar or the restaurant's fault, but at least I had that back up plate. Glad I tried this spot, but I've had better.
author: Elena N.

description: The best chicken wrap I have ever had!!! The wrap comes with lavash bread, sumac (dried grape), onions roasted tomatoes, spicy sauce and with loaded chicken shawarma!! They are so generous on their portions! The meat itself is amazing, I think it's the best shawarma I've had thus far. This place is truly Mediterranean! :)
author: Shabnam N.

description:
I don't always write a yelp review right after I go somewhere but I can't control myself with this one. Holy sh*t Truly Mediterranean's vegan falafel is one of the best things I've had in YEARS!! They are massive and I ate the entire thing in minutes, I couldn't stop! 

The staff is friendly and the entire ordering process is super simple and quick. I highly recommend Truly Mediterranean, I'm honestly not sure the last time I was so happy about something I ate! 10/10.
author: Kelly F.

description: The lamb shawarma is the most delicious I've ever tasted. This place in the Mission is a tiny outfit that primarily does to go orders.  There are a couple of bar stools to sit and eat, if they're available.  Often times, they're occupied.  The food here have wonderful spices and seasonings, which makes the food so addicting delicious.  Staff is friendly enough and they take credit cards.  Prices are fairly priced.
author: Mabe S.

description:
A friend who loves Mediterranean food  recommended this place. 

Ambience - You shouldn't go to this place looking for that

Food - Is Divine, the falafels are really flavorful even if you buy them as individual pieces without the sauce

I would recommend this place for anyone who wants to try or loves mediterranean food
author: Amar P.

description: TRULY AWFUL. This place has the WORST customer service. The cashier was completely rude when they had run out of the item I had ordered through GrubHub. I hope the owner begins to hire better staff to run this terrible place.
author: Jesse B.

description: Discovered this hole in wall place during a recent trip to SF , was finger licking food , tried the chicken kabab  n falafel plate , very unique(was green inside) crispy n tasty , to top it off had the baklava ..ohhh man sent me to cloud 9 ..salute to this place..
author: Yogesh A.

description:
Omg! Yum!! Truly Mediterranean is delicious! I tried the lamb combo plate ($12.99) and everything was delicious! The lamb was very tender and juicy, the grilled onions and bell peppers were great, but I especially liked the hummus and tabouleh. This was my first time trying tabouleh and found it very delicious and refreshing, especially with the lime flavor in it. The combo plate also comes with tahini and hot sauce. It was all so good!

I also tried the lamb shawerma ($9.99) with added eggplant. The shawerma was huge!! And very delicious! Portions here are a very good size. The owners let us try the falafel on the house and it was delicious as well. It was coated with tahini sauce and a bit of hot sauce. It was really good!

Truly Mediterranean is one of the best hole-in-the-wall restaurants I've tried. And one of the best Mediterranean restaurants I've tried. This place is pretty small and does not offer much seating, but it also was not crowded. Ordering to-go might be the best option. They also use Door Dash incase you want delivery. I would definitely recommend this place for some good Mediterranean food. And make sure to come hungry as portions are large.
author: Jean S.

description: The most legit Mediterranean place in SF. The shawarma with tabbouleh are my absolute favorites. The food is fresh and rich in flavor. Ideal place for take out and eating in the Mission Dolores Park nearby. I've been there twice and will keep coming back!
author: Maciej R.

description:
Ordered the  Mediterranean Combo Plate. It was above average in flavor. Good portions. The pita was soft with good chew. TM takes pride in their food. The hot sauce that comes with it, is money.
I can't think of what I would change or make suggestions.
I give the food 4.5 stars. Did not evaluate the service and dining room, as I ordered through food delivery. High marks for the dish i ordered. Good vegetarian option!
author: John B.

description: Awesome catering for my son's first birthday.  So may people complimented us on the food and the price was very affordable.  The service was also great as we were able to place our order a few days beforehand and received it seamlessly.  I will definitely be ordering from Truly Mediterranean again!
author: Erin G.

description:
I tried this again with a few friends, and got bit again - food was not good at all, could barely finish it. I got the Chicken shawarma, and my friends got a mediterranean combo plate, but neither of us liked it.
The place is also a hole in the wall, so there's not a lot of place to stand while you're waiting for your order.
author: Arjan N.

description:
Really good wraps and generous portions. I ordered the lamb shawarma and was very flavorful. My first visit but certainly I'd come back to try more dishes.
The place is very casual and not for dates or sit in but great for take out or dining on your own.
author: John F.

description:
I've ordered from here a number of times.  Twice they really messed up my order, I suppose delivered mine to someone else and someone's elses order to me.  

The food is generally good.  The chicken shwarma plate, however, is pretty gross, just a few minced pieces of leftover chicken and some potato or something on a bunch of rice.  Basically, just a carb bomb.

The one thing that really bugs me is everything is SUPER GREASY, it looks like they drizzle a few tablespoons of olive oil over their hummus and baba ganoush.  The worst is the falaffel, it is super greasy - it is literally dripping with grease.  They need to learn how to deep fry something, their oil temperature is too low (maybe dropping in too many). If they'd raise the heat, they could fry them without making them grease bombs (that greasy bag are the falafels, if you grab one falafel and squeeze a spoonful of grease will drip out! so gross- LOL)
author: Peter S.

description:
Just had third takeout from this new restaurant in Mission Bay/Potrero/SOMA. The food is delicious and the staff/chefs very friendly and professional.

Highly recommend!!
author: Gary O.

description:
BEST FALAFEL IN TOWN!!! Grab one to go if you are near Dolores Park! 

This is a hole-in-the-wall so most people get food to-go. The few guys who work inside are all very nice and helped me with my order since I wasn't familiar with the menu. I tried their lamb shawarma with eggplants and it was AMAZING. The veggies have a nice crunch and the meat is well seasoned. Very refreshing taste.

Since we were new, they also gave us 2 warm falafel to try. :) they did not disappoint us!

Very good pricing and large portion size. The only downside is the limited space and no bathroom.
author: Wendy F.

description:
Simply the best falafel I've ever had in my life. WOW! This place is a gem. Super inexpensive, quick, and delicious. I was recently in Israel a couple months back and this Mediterranean food is better than in Israel! 

The falafel are bright green on the inside, moist. The outside is just the right amount of crunch. I could eat 100 of those bad boys. They will serve you a side of them covered in some white sauce and hot sauce-to die for. 

We will definitely be returning when we are on this side of town. Hell, we might make special trips into the city just to go here. It's worth all of the "circling for parking" in the world. Look no further-you've found the best Mediterranean food restaurant in the Bay Area.
author: Steve S.

description:
Hole in the wall with amazing falafel balls!

One of the many restaurants down the street from the 16th bart station, so as usual I would never drive over here (parking is terrible). 

This place is tiny, like it can probably only hold 5-6 people tiny. Expect to grab and go unless you don't mind sitting alongside the wall with people waiting behind you for their food. (It's way too cramped for me!)

I always grab the falafels because they're big, delicious, and come with great sauces (a red spicy one and a white sauce). They're also really worth it for the price! My boyfriend loves the wraps, but they only offer specific meats on certain days! Make sure you check the menu before you head on in. ADD EGGPLANT - it is soooo delicious and it just upgrades the wrap to the next level LOL.

The dessert, Pistachio Baklava, deserves its own personal section. Definitely pricey for a small block of goodness (almost as much as an order of falafel balls). But it's so good, like a delicious sweet pistachio in between flakey layers of crunchy crepe. I always have to get it even though it's so small and pricey.
author: Melanie T.

description:
Super yummy.

I had the combo plate. Their falafel is delicious. I wish I had some right now. I wish I could have the entire plate again right now. Everything was delicious.

Staff was nice.

There is a tiny bar against the wall with about 5 stools to sit and eat. Definitely not a regular restaurant. More like hole-in-the-wall status.

It's down the street from four-barrel.

I'll be back.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Decent spot for Mediterranean fare, whether servings of falafel or wraps full of chicken or lamb shawarma. Prices might look just a tad spendy given the portions, but the wraps can sometimes be deceivingly small, as you're at the luck of the draw in terms of getting a nice helping of meat inside.

It's a small, hole in the wall space with little space that's conducive to dining, so it's better suited to grab-and-go customers. Service is quite fast, and on a nice West Bay day, you can easily enjoy your nosh outside at Dolores Park or anywhere else you're heading in the neighborhood. It's also conveniently located mere steps away from BART.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Second time here and I made it on a Friday, which means chicken day. But not to be confused with my favorite served every other day but Tuesday and Friday...Lamb Shawarma. Just thinking about it makes my mouth water! 
This is a cool little joint near Delores Park, so after the family is done playing, we walk over. Super small, maybe 4 stools and a long counter. The kitchen takes up the other side of the counter. The guys are always super nice, their quick and they do it smiling.
My favorite is the shawarma but they also offer a few other things like a mixed combo plate, dolmas, falafel and a killer burger! The basmati rice is perfect with the meat and all the accoutrements that make the flavor really stand out. Large chunks of feta...yum! 
Alright, enough, It's late and their only open for 20 more minutes and I won't make it in time. Heading there tomorrow to satisfy my craving, lol! 
Thanks Truly Mediterranean for truly being so good!
author: Maea B.

description: Tourists on a tight budget (but with an insider tip from my resident epicurean daughter, a germaphobe whose instincts I trust) we drove past this tiny hole-in-the-wall place at first. So glad we found parking and went in!! Amazing middle-eastern food, kabobs, falafel, lamb on a spit-- a favorite for locals, this is super reasonably-priced, deLicious food!!
author: Margaret C.

description:
Hands down the best shawarma in the Bay Area, especially their lamb shawarma.  Its seasoned to perfection and their special tahini sauce is absolutely full of flavor and pairs very well the wrap.  The seasoned onions is my favorite and a must in shawarma.  I've been to many shawarma restaurants in the past and none have include it in their wrap nor were as good as this one! Even Anthony Bourdain is a fan!

While we waited for our wraps, we were given free samples of their delicious falafel, fresh out of the fryer. The falafel was so delicious and the best I have ever had...so crisp on the outside and soft & moist in the inside.  Excellent customer service too.  

If I lived closer, I would be stopping by a few times a week, maybe even DAILY!
author: Nari I.

description: Amazing falafel. Like seriously the best I've ever had. Not much seating but seriously, get the felafel.
author: Topher C.

description: So gooooood. I have been coming to this place for years, and just picked up some dinner there after not having been for a long time. I ordered the combo plate (vegetarian) which gives you a nice portion of everything (baba, falafel, hummus, pita, cucumber salad, tabouli salad, dolmas, feta, and then a yummy hot sauce!) The flavors are all so fresh and really complement one another. Definitely holds true to it's name! A must try to Mediterranean food lovers!
author: Dana T.

description: Always on the look out for a great dive that has food that knocks your socks off, an this place delivers. Had the lamb shawarma and shared plates of falafel and dolma. I ordered my sharwama on the spicy side and was pleased with my order. Well toasted pita bread covering a decent amount of lamb with all the fixin's; each bite was excellent. The falafel were perfection, crispy on the outside, soft and flavorful inside. They come smothered in a tahini sauce. that is delicious on its own. The dolma could have had just a little more lemony flavor, but I'm willing to let that one go. Staff was friendly and chatty; and service is top-notch fast. A must try for anyone with a hankering for decent Lebanese street food.
author: Umar G.

description: My absolute favorite falafel and shawarma on this planet. I do have a lot of others to try, especially if I'm ever lucky enough to travel to the Middle East, but until then,  Hope to be back in the bay soon!! Xx Been going to Truly Med since 1998? 2000? Or even earlier?  Drool. Wish I was there now. Was just talking falafel and had to see if they are still there. Whew! #respect!
author: Axel G.

description:
This place is my not-so-secret favorite for years.  Shawarmas are awesome, juicy flavor-filled, Lamb great, chicken even better!  Seriously the best hummous anywhere.

  I could go on and on about all my favorites, but this review is about their catering.  I just got married and spent weeks trying menus and meals from hotels, caterers, Cliff House, etc. etc.  Everything was a whopping "meh" at best and running $70-90 a head plus extras... Exhausted we stopped for lunch at TruMed and why not serve what we love...
For less than $20 per person (and we had tons left) we dined on Lamb Shawarma, Chicken kabobs, hummous, falafels, tahini, tabouleh, pita, rice, salads, and.....because they were a few minutes late, they threw in a tray of baklava!  That was great, too!  Everything except dolmas are made in house, prices a very, very fair, portions huge, everything is delicious!  What more can you ask for?  Maybe more tables outside?
author: Sidhartha G.

description:
Nice Mediterranean place! Don't expect a fancy place, however, expect welcoming people offering you samples of falafel  it buys your heart. 
I had falafel wrap! Premium falafel 
Their combo plate looks very yummy and good too. 
This is the place to get awesome Turkish-Mediterranean food.
author: Anuta B.

description: The employees are really sweet. Gave us free falafel. The shawerma is HUGE and is a good price for the size. Only 2 small tables to sit on and not the best area but it is very "SF".
author: Hana T.

description:
Absolutely amazing Shawarma sandwich and falafel sandwich.
The staff is really friendly and the service is fast! 
Try the dessert! Harisa! It's amazing!!
author: Omar S.

description: This is some of the best Mediterranean food that has since coming up to the Bay. I ordered the Kefta Kabob wrap spicy with some feta cheese (extra charge). Honestly, it probably didn't even need it considering the generous amounts of applied tahini. Oh man what a sloppy, delicious mess that turned out to be. For those less inclined to get down and dirty with your food, order the plate and save yourself a few napkins. I also ordered a side of the tabboleh. It's a bit less "grassy," more savory, and especially delicious. I'll be back again!
author: Travis V.

description: I absolutely LOVE this spot!! The food is delicious and authentic - I'm Lebanese so can vouch for Middle Eastern food :) everything is prepared fresh and is so delicious and flavorful. The staff is friendly, warm, and generous, and their kindness and smiles are an added bonus when I go to get my favorite meal. Couldn't recommend Truly Mediterranean enough. Excited to try their larger location in Mission Bay soon!
author: Hiba A.

description:
4.5 stars actually.

Legit authentic lamb shawarma wrap.  You know it's the real deal when they use a lavash wrap rather than pita bread.  I love Zaytoon for shawarma, but for a very clean (not super oily meat), flavorful, and well-dressed (not too saucy) wrap, this is my spot.

Great bang for your buck...a 10 inches, crispy lavash, and a ton of meat for $10.  Win!
author: Mon T.

description:
I'm always looking for good middle Eastern food. This place is pretty famous in terms of longevity. The shawarma is amazing. I always add hummus to it which gives another great flavor. 

It's very difficult to find parking in this area, but this is sf. The wrap was a decent size and filled my up pretty good. I also had a couple of falafel which were not bad

This place is great.
author: Abu N.

description:
I haven't come in here for an actual meal, but I walked by, had a sample of their tabbouleh - and can't stop thinking about it since. TRULY MED, I'm coming for you!! 

(and then I'll update this.)
author: Tiba G.

description:
The food was delicious but this is just a hole in the wall on the street. 
So if you're looking for quality sit down service, this isnt it. 
But if you're looking for an inexpensive spot to pick up good walking food, this could be for you.
The chicken shwarma was lovely.
author: Mitch B.

description: Excellent kebab roll, hummus, falafel and baklava. I love love love their food. Great service and friendly staff. Not the best place to eat at though because its small and can get pretty crowded because they are popular.
author: S S.

description:
Tuesdays in the Mission mean Taco Tuesdays (obviously) and Truly Mediterranean chicken shwarma (less obviously). Truly Med's famous chicken is only available on Tuesdays and Fridays, building hype as expected per basic supply-demand economics. 

Truly Med is a hole-in-the-wall, but the open kitchen in the small space allows you to see that their cooking methods are in fact truly Mediterranean. You can see shwarma carved from chunks of meat from a spit, a row of falafels encircling a large pan for made-to-order frying, and a grill where you can see them toast your wraps resulting in schmexy grill marks.

1) Lamb shwarma wrap ($10): While there is most anticipation for their chicken, there was a posted Zagat article introducing the lamb shwarma. I got it spicy according to the owner's suggestion, but the tabasco sauce seemed to dominate and overpower everything else. There was a surprisingly generous amount of meat, and the ample yogurty garlic sauce kept it nice and moist. Overall the wrap was a bold statement--densely filled with meat and drenched in a sharp sauce. Personally I would have liked it better balanced with more onions, but it was quite satisfying.

2) Chicken shwarma wrap ($10): This time I asked for non-spicy, and I liked it better because you could better taste the complexities sans tabasco. The chicken was succulent and umami, with a strong chicken-y essence reminiscent of chicken broth. The chicken-ness synergized with the garlicky peppery sauce and onions very well; the flavors and textures were on point.

3) Falafel: This piqued my interest, and I tried one while waiting for my wrap on the grill. Although it seems you can never really go wrong with falafel, Truly Med does make remarkably tasty ones. I think fava beans are a major constituent, since the cross-section is green and it tastes distinct from chickpea falafel. It seems that a lot of thought was put into the creation of this falafel, with its blend of herbs and spices for more dimension and the topping of tahini sauce for additional flavor and prophylaxis against being too dry as falafel often is. The coarse grainy texture makes it taste especially homemade. Falafel essentially always makes happy, but it's safe to say that this is one of the best falafel I've ever had.

Prices range a bit higher than your typical wrap place, but it's worthwhile for the quality. The owner is also very friendly with helpful suggestions and even gave me the falafel for free when I asked to order one. 

Truly Mediterranean Tuesdays... doesn't have as nice of a ring to it, but it should definitely be on your radar P:
author: Edna C.

description: Been going here for 15 years. Best falafel and sharamas in the bay. Hands down. Ingredients are always fresh. There halva is the best too.
author: Glenn W.

description: Tried the eggplant shawerma the mediterranean combo plate and both were delicious!! Good for vegetarian~
author: Yennie L.

description: CHICKEN SHAWARMA - delicious. I've had delicious shawarma in Jerusalem and Paris. This one is up there.
author: Jose F.

description: Best falafels in the city! Try the super falafel. The textures of the grilled eggplant and fried potatoes in the wrap are fantastic. The cucumbers and onions are also super fresh. Add the hot sauce for a little extra spice. I guarantee you will get hooked!
author: Fatima H.

description:
If you are heading to Truly Mediterranean expecting a sit-down restaurant experience, don't both: this place is small and more like a hole-in-the-wall dining establishment.  However, they do serve great versions of your Mediterranean standards including falafel and shawarma.

Given the limited seating, you may want to get your food to go (though there's a narrow bar and some limited table seating outside if you'd like to eat your food in house).  I've tried both the falafel and lamb shawarma wraps, and I thought both were quite satisfying.  I will have to go there on a day when they serve the chicken shawarma to round out my experience.  Service is prompt, though it can take moderately longer if you are ordering a kabob.
author: Keith H.

description: We've ordered catering from TM a few times (for lunch) and my whole office seems to love them. The different meat kebabs were delish and I loved the falafel and salads platter! I am definitely going to continue ordering from them :)
author: Gabriela S.

description: My experience at Trüly has been a delight! The meat is savory and super, super fresh. The cost is more than reasonable. Owners and employees give such a warm welcome and if you want some help with what to order, they will take care of you! Their passion for food and serving is evident! I can't say enough about this establishment. From cleanliness to service to the cuisine...spectacular.
author: Evelyne M.

description: My go-to Mediterranean restaurant never disappoints. Get the Lamb shawarma, add fries, tahiti and spicy sauce. The portions are huge, and the meat is juicy, you get the most bang for your buck here. Winner.
author: Lance T.

description:
Always good! These guys are friendly, they remember how I like my wrap and are really fast with service. The food is quality and the price is affordable!

Call ahead and they'll have it ready for you to pick up! Yum
author: Deedee C.

description:
Falafel wrap with XXX (extra, extra, extra) hot sauce. 

My favorite falafel in SF since closing of location on Haight.
author: Alex T.

description:
Crispy falafel, yummy baba ganoush
It's a fast food place.. perfect for a quick bite ! I took a falafel salad combo and it was big enough to share it with a friend.
author: Chetana K.

description:
Wraps had juicy flavorful meat mixed with creamy tahini! The grilled wrap gave it some warm crunch.

Falafel might be the best in town. It was hot and crispy without being dry. Sesame gives its a more distinct taste.
author: Jason C.

description: This is my first review for takeout. I have had the Mediterranean plate three times and I felt the need to spread the word. Fresh, delicious, and the baba ganoush is finger licking good. It is how you will eat the bits in the corner that your fork cannot reach.
author: Julia K.

description:
I've been trying to find a go-to Falafel spot in the city and tried this place. I have to say, I'm very impressed! 

My friend and I were in awe at the flavor palette of the falafel! It's the kind that has a crunchy, sesame seed packed exterior, with a slightly crumbly, green colored interior. Savory, crunchy, rich deliciousness!  It didn't feel too heavy or too fried either - a hard balance for falafel to maintain! 

I'm SO pleased to say that the falafel plate is vegan friendly, if you omit the Schwarma. It is a lot of food though, so be prepared to take a doggy dish home with ya. 

Also, just a heads up, this little spot in the mission is more of a grab-and-go situation than anything. They have some outdoor seating out front, but TBH it's not the most ideal spot to dine. The tables are fine and the neighborhood is cool - but it is a busy street and attracts a rowdy crowd. 


I'd recommend taking the food to go!
author: Jackie K.

description: Chicken Shawarma?! Upgraaaaaade! After the new ownership and idk what else! That chicken shawarma has improoooooooooooved! I can eat the chicken shawarma here now! Of course lamb and beef is my go to! Tuesday and Friday (or Idk which two days of the week) they only have chicken the rest of the days lamb and beef all the way!
author: Mahmoud A.

description: As close to a shawarma you would get in the Middle East as possible. No other shawarma in the Bay compares. The folks there are very welcoming and I will definitely put this on my go-to eatery list! The falafels are little balls of happiness!
author: Noor M.

description:
Here's how the restaurant website describes its self ...

"Truly Mediterranean, established Sept 1992, has become one of the leading Middle Eastern cuisine restaurants nation-wide."

That's like me saying ... "Since I bought my Schwinn, a Speedo, and a shower cap, I have become one of the leading tri-athletes nation-wide."

OK ... back to reality.

It's a decent shawarma shop.  In the US where falafel is more popular than shawarma, I'll tag this as an okay falafel and shawarma shop  Not a restaurant, just a hole-in-the-wall you would find on any mideast city corner.

Falafel and shawarma sandwiches are substantial.  Ask for extra tahini sauce otherwise it could be kinda dry.  Prices first look high but you get quite a large portion.

Customer interaction is interesting to watch.  Would make a good psych thesis.  One owner is gregarious and makes friendly eye-contact.  The other, standing right next to him, wears a frown and looks ready to pack it in.  Like so much of our universe ... protons and electrons neutralizing each other.

Luck of the draw ... who takes your order ... Mr Gregarious or Mr. Don't-Bug-Me.  Mixed-in with this yin and yang is the glue that keeps the production line moving ... the hardworking Latino cooks.  Get it to go ... there's really no place inside to eat without interruption.
author: J B.

description:
Cool area with lots going on around it. Theater, bars... a lively bunch of people around here.

Had some baklava and another dessert next to the baklava. Don't know what its called but it was awesome. I think the two pieces were $6 total. The baklava was a bit sweet. North beach gyros makes it a bit better but they are more expensive. 

The other dessert was awesome. Crunchy, not overly sweet. I wanted another. See photo.

The restaurant was small and the kitchen visible from the street and dining area. Very cool place.Will be back.
author: Stefan T.

description:
Fact:  If you were to ever spy on my food orders via delivery apps you'd see Truly Mediterranean on their repeatedly. 

I'm addicted to the freshness of their Combo Platter. It's enough food to feed two and can be brought to Dolores for a picnic. Though I usually eat it for one because I'm GLUTTONOUS as hell. 

Their Lamb Wraps have huge chunks of meat. Like literally, huge chucks!   Accompanied by a bunch of other veggie goodness.
author: Peter N.

description: It would be really great if they didn't accidentally get a chunk of meat in my vegetarian meal. :(
author: Stacey J.

description: Food tastes bad. The sauces have a chemical smell. Chicken bland. The owner picked our shawarma up with his bare hands from the grill and gave it to us. Please pick a nicer place!!
author: Monica F.

description: I would recommend this place Truly Mediterranean. The Lamb Shawarma is a delicious and the Pistachio Baklava is a yummy. The staff is friendly and helpful. The Lamb Shawarma Wrap is pricy but it's worth-it.
author: R R.

description:
I was raised blocks away and grew up ordering late-night takeout with my mom from this place. They'd always give us surprise baklava, and my broke little family of two ate well for less than $15. 

Even at 12 I remember craving the smoky and tender eggplant. Light falafel with substance and hearty crunch to the exterior were my favorites. Even still, having been to Egypt, Israel, Lebanon, and Palestine. 

Splurging on an order of their creamy hummus is still a secret little pleasure. 

The Mission isn't even worth talking about anymore. My family and I were pushed out 10 years ago, but we still visit for deluxe falafel. The employees are friendly as ever and the prices are... fair.
author: Jolene H.

description:
This place is full of creepy perverts it's disgusting that they get to even serve food to people. 

As soon as my friend and I walked in, the workers made us feel extremely uncomfortable. 

The employees looked at each other and to two customers while smirking. They were laughing and staring while we waited for our food. It made my friend who's a girl so uncomfortable that we left as soon as we got our order. They kept it up until we left making sure to look at her on the way out.

If you don't want your wife and daughters being stared at like a piece of meat do not come here.

Food wise the Shwarma meat was super dry.

We will never go there again.
author: Paul C.

description: It's a very small Mediterranean shop. I love their lamb shawarma it's delicious. I would definitely recommend their hummus and flafel
author: Sumbal A.

description: Thai is my favorite Mediterranean spot. I always get the combo plate and they give you a nice chunk of feta!! Also falafel is good as well last time I went they gave me a free one. It's pretty small though, and there's hardly  any room to walk so definitely not a sit down place
author: Cecilia H.

description: I recently ordered giant party platters along with chicken and lamb skewers. The veg platters were delicious, but unfortunately the meat was kind of dry and over cooked. Also, the order arrived 50min late despite giving them a full day's notice to prepare on time and take into account random SF traffic.
author: Jean L.

description: A great snacking and late night food spot. Convenient locations and gets a heathy inflow of people at night.
author: Hemant J.

description: Amazing falafels and chicken shawarma wraps! If your in the mood for something healthy or even vegetarian stop by truly Mediterranean! The falafel deluxe with eggplant is so bomb as well as the falafels with spicy sauce are to die for! I never feel guilty eating here as it feels you up quick especially the veggie wraps I can never finish a while wrap so I always save half for later. Call for pick up since parking is tough here or walk down and order to go. Indoor dining space is limited so great to order and on you go. Walk down to Dolores park or enjoy the food from the comfort of your home. The guys here are very friendly and always make sure you leave happy with a little falafel sample. Doesn't get better to snack while you wait!
author: Ella P.

description:
My boyfriend wanted Mediterranean and I wanted sushi. Can you tell who won the fight? 

This restaurant is tiny and unsuspecting, but not bad overall. Their menu is simple and it's easy to narrow down to what you may want. Prices are decent and if anything, I say take the food to go because it's cramped inside here. There are a few tables outside to eat if that works for you.

My boyfriend and I both opted for their lamb falafel, his spicy and mine not which was probably my mistake because my falafel ended up being really dry. Another issue I had was that they slice their tomatoes but don't cut it up into smaller pieces and spread them out evenly so on some bites I ended up just getting straight tomatoes. My boyfriend said his had a really good amount of spice. 

Overall, come back? Possibly? Unsure... The staff was really welcoming, though.
author: Venus L.

description:
3.5 but I am interested enough to come back so I'll round up!

I was starving and just randomly found Truly Mediterranean and it happened to be a Tuesday - Chicken Shawarma Night! I popped on and got baklava, chicken shawarma and a side of eggplant.

Baklava - O M G.....this was soooo good. Baklava is 5 stars!!!!

Eggplant - I love eggplant and this was just good ol simple eggplant

Chicken Shawarma - This was supposed to be the star of the night, but the chicken was dry :( I did like how there were plenty of onions and the large tomato pieces in the wrap, but I will have to get another protein next time I am there. The flavors were minimal, but packed a punch. 

I will definitely come back and try the lamb as well as eat my fill of baklava :)
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Awesome hole in the wall place with delicious affordable food, great portion size, and super friendly and attentive staff. I ordered takeout this week and when they could not accommodate my lamb request gave me 12 free falafel.

Recommended!
author: Gabe S.

description: Best falafel ever. If you are in SF, you owe it to yourself to try it! Like there soups and meats too.
author: G S.

description: I always pass this place on my way to/from work and wondered how it was. I came in yesterday to take the dive. I had the chicken shwarma plate. It was quite good and plenty of volume. The guy behind the counter, who I'm assuming is the owner, is very friendly and customer focused. He even threw in some flatbread for me. There's always a line when I pass this place in the evening so that must say something.
author: Kenson K.

description: Great food and portions. Very authentic Medit. food. Everyone loved the chicken schwerma.
author: Dan S.

description:
The food was good but catering service was awful. I called both the day before and the day of my office lunch to confirm our order for 30 people (but did not make any changes to the order) and apparently the employees do not communicate with each other ("it wasn't in the catering notes").    

The delivery was 25 minutes late, was missing an entire platter (approximately 1/4 of the entire order) and was not delivered until over an hour after it should've been delivered when most people were "done" eating. The manager insisted that I still pay for the entire order, even for the items that did not arrive.  Instead, he offered to include the missing platter on my next order.  I told him that was unacceptable as we were halfway through a lunch without enough food and I didn't need a discount on a future order but rather needed the food that was paid for.  People were still hungry and some had not eaten any food, which was aggravated by the fact the meat was improperly packaged. 
They had told me that they typically package the individually-priced meat skewers in individual containers over a bed of cucumber salad and I received multiple confirmations that the meat would be packaged this way.  Instead, they dumped all the meat pieces into giant tins and I had to ration out the servings instead. 

Despite several phone calls to arrange the replacement delivery, almost half our falafel order was missing (18 pieces of falafel were not delivered) and we were never reimbursed.  All my interactions with Truly Mediterranean and the delivery person were cordial but a more accurate name for them might be Truly Incompetent.  I wouldn't risk organizing a delivered workplace lunch with Truly Mediterranean again.  

Last but not least, the prices advertised for their platters on their website are inaccurate.  They also charge a $15 delivery fee but you're better off picking up the food yourself even if it costs more.
author: Christine K.

description: Shawarma deluxe!!!!! One of my all-time FAV munches,..."a little bit spicy for me". Falafel deluxe (deluxe = fried potatoes and egg plant) will do if you don't eat meat. My veggie friends and I love them. Tuesdays and Fridays they have chicken instead of lamb. Wife loves that. Would give 5 stars if eating space were larger and if they offered chicken and lamb everyday.
author: Richard M.

description: I think this is one of the best Mediterranean joints in the Bay Area. They are a small hole in the wall. The prices are decent. Their shawarma is awesome and the sauce they put in the wraps is finger licking good.
author: Gautam P.

description: One of the best shawarma wraps I've ever had!  Full of flavor and spice... ask for it spicy!  The staff is Wonderful full of love and smiles, especially Omar, very kind and makes you feel right at home!  Truly a hidden gem in the bay!
author: Sarah A.

description: I ALWAYS stop here if I'm in the area.  The lamb or chicken ( only Fridays?) shawameras are awesome.  The tomatoes are underneath the vertical rotisserie and really enhance the flavor.  The tiziki sauce is great and there a huge amount meat fresh off the rotisserie, one could just salivate as the cook is sawing the meat off.  After making your shawamera, the cook will grill both side of the lavash so the shawamera is nice and hot.  Downside there is no parking, 5-6 bar spots for eating but honestly it is WORTH IT.  Best way is on foot, otherwise have two people, one to park or circle and one to order or just be brave and flaunt the SF parking laws for a ~5 minutes.
author: Andrew C.

description: I got a lamb kabob wrap and I must say that i was impressed. for $10 I got a large mediterranean wrap. The lamb was grilled perfectly and they were generous with the ingredients. Everything tasted fresh and very well put-together. The staff was helpful when I couldn't decide what I wanted to get upon arriving there. They were very polite and friendly, which is something I really appreciated. I will be coming back here the next time I am in the area and want some good mediterranean food.
author: Lynn T.

description: So fkn good ya love there falafels and shawarrama wraps are bomb I like to get them spicy they also have the best hummus hands down
author: Maged M.

description: My friend showed me this spot and I will forever thank her because the food is amazing!! I always order the deluxe falafel wrap spicy and add feta cheese, try it you will die with love :D
author: Francesca D.

description: Chicken Shawarma sandwich was very tasty. You can tell the Chicken was fresh. The service was very quick. Ahmed is a super cool dude. Definitely the spot to grab some quick yet filling food when in the city and craving Mediterranean food.
author: Bashir A.

description: Food is fresh. The menu is somewhat limited however. I came in on a Friday for lunch and they didn't have any lamb only chicken. The combo plate had no meat. Charged me 5 dollars for meat on the side; ended up being 17 dollars. Meat was ordinary, nothing special about it. I will say that the combo plate had a good portion, albeit a bit too expensive. Yelp rates their pricing at $ but it's closer to $$$. Area for dining is small, about a foot and a half for the bench table and stools make it extremely tight. There is no bathroom. They did not give me a fork so you have to ask, they did not offer water either. Cleanliness is about 4/10. Square footage for whole dining area is about 50sqft. Lighting is natural through windows. Parking is bad in this area. Apartment if you order online you still have to wait for your food to be made. Credit cards are accepted here. Traffic is medium during lunchtime. Good for a one time shot, but not date or group material.
author: Alex C.

description:
I "truly" recommend this place very highly!  

Last year, they catered our holiday party with large platters:  Hummus, Baba Gannouj, Tabouleh, Cucumber, Dolma, Feta Cheese, Pita Bread.  The feedback was so positive, they'll be delivering to our holiday party again this year.  It can be challenging to meet 50 people's very different dietary preferences, but this meets all those needs!

I'm only sorry I have to wait until the end of this week to enjoy this fresh and outstanding food (at a great price)!

I'm excited about their expansion to Potrero Hill soon too!
author: J. D.

description: Not to sure what the rave is about, I personally thought the food was super dry. Customer service is not friendly. It was okay.
author: Anessa K.

description:
Great fresh falafel! but kind eh to the wrap

This is a tiny shop that you can order individual falafel balls to go or get a shawarma or combo plate with lamb. I got the the deluxe falafel wrap and while the falafel was quite good, the overall experience was so-so. Maybe it would have been better with lamb...

Anyways, these shawarmas are close to the size of mission burritos and will definitely leave you just beyond the verge of uncomfortably full. The deluxe falafel is the standard plus eggplant and fries (think California burrito). I would say there's no need to go deluxe though the fries do add to different textures. I'm pretty sure mine was missing the eggplant but I didn't feel like saying anything since I was in a rush to just eat and leave. There's a little counter opposite from the food prep area to eat though it's awkward since the wall is a huge mirror so you can watch yourself stuff your face and have tahini sauce drip down your hand...

I'm not sure if I'll come back, but the lamb could be worth a try? The falafel was very moist and not rock hard like I've had elsewhere, but I could compare more easily to other places if I tried the meat.
author: Liza X.

description:
Truly Mediterrean has what could quite possibly be the best falafel I've ever had. Not only was it not dry at all, it also came out in a good size and makes you crave more.

The lamb shawarma also had a lot of meat and was seasoned just right. It takes a while to get your order (it's a small establishment), but it's worth it once you get your order.
author: Casey S.

description: WOW the lamb wrap was good! Great bang for your buck, and I'm really excited to go back and try the chicken and falafel (and everything else, let's be honest). I went around 10 pm on a Thursday night and the counters/stools were full and I still had to wait in line. Can't imagine going during a popular meal time but I definitely think it's worth the wait!
author: Jenny L.

description: Got the chicken kebab. The chicken was dry and the ratios were way off. Needed more chicken for the amount of cucumber and tomatoes they put in the wrap. The tomatoes were also very lazily cut.
author: Emmalynn A.

description:
Shared the Mediterranean combo with one other person. Combo includes 2 small falafels, 2 small dolmas, tabbouleh, cucumber salad, a bit of feta cheese, 2 6-inch pitas, hummus, and babaganoush. Includes tahini and hot sauce. We also got a side of lamb for $3.50.

- What stood out: Falafel is delicious. One of the best I've ever had. Babaganoush was creamy and fresh.
- Disappointment: Lamb was dry with not much taste. It may have been sitting out for a while, as it wasn't fresh off the grill.  

I would come back though. Give the lamb a 2nd spin and try their lamb schwarma, as it seems to be popular. I'll be sure to get their falafels, as well.

The staff is friendly, and it's a good place for a quick bite or take out. Limited counter seating and only 2 tables outside though.
author: Joanna L.

description: They have not disappointed yet. Good food for a great price. Falafel and shawarma are both solid and the hummus is top quality
author: Rishi G.

description:
We tried this place after a friend suggested it. Since we live 90 miles alway, we thought it would be great to try it since we were in the area. 

Since being introduced to it we have already visited it multiple times and the service is always warm and welcoming. We came here once with a party of 10 and they were patient and friendly with us. One person in our party asked for a food request that was not on their menu and they accommodated to us without hesitation. 

We typically make individual orders of falafel and shawarmas, but they also have food plates. The food does not come out as fast as subway or Chipotle, but when it does it is guaranteed to be fresh, warm, and packed with different flavors and textures. The have canned drinks, bottled waters, and a wide variety of kombucha drinks (which are my absolute favorite).

Although the place is very small we always find seating. I do wish the place was bigger but in all honesty the small size gives this place some charm and character. 

I gave Truly Mediterranean a 5 star review because the service and food has been on point during each visit.
author: Cari M.

description: Come here all the time for the falafel and shwarma wraps. The food is great- tasty, nice portions. The guys who work here are nice too.
author: K W.

description: Best schwarma place in the city hands down! Always go for spicy
author: Jackson P.

description: Best falafel Shawarma I've ever had. A must "to go" place in Bay Area. They don't have seating, so keep in mind before making dinner plans there. I took my lunch to Dolores park which is a mile away.
author: Ashish K.

description: Great food and price for downtown SF. The food took long to cook and the menu was confusing- ie I had to ask about the chicken kebab plate since it was not listed on the main menu.
author: Andrew K.

description: This place is consistently great and so is their service. I highly recommend trying the falafel and their pita is great, too. I order online and my order is always ready when I get there. The staff is always very friendly and their menu has some great offerings.
author: Ken K.

description: The falafel regular was really good. Order it mildly spicy (the guy will ask you) because it really adds to the whole wrap. The falafels inside were moist and flavorful. And the sauce. The sauce was delicious. Great little place to get some hearty food. Also the people working there are nice!
author: Anya L.

description: The veggie combo plate!!!! Dolmas, falafel, tabouli, hummus, baba ganoush, pickled onions, and cucumber salad! .. and pita! The falafels were green and made with fava beans. I love green falafels more than chickpea ones. Both are good but i favor the fava. The prices are lower than most other places in the city. Loved that I got a boatload of food for a good price!
author: Lena P.

description: Ordered food last night and food Quality has gone down the drain. I remember old north beach location years ago and it was one of the best falafel and shwerma. Chicken was actually old and had rotten smell had to throw away entire thing. Lamb kebabs were like cheweing gum & extremely dry. Only positive thing was falafel. Having bad quality of meat or poultry is a concerning.
author: Steve S.

description: I've been coming here for over 18 years and they never disappoint. My shewarma standards are high because of this Place. I have yet to try a shewarma with as much flavor and consistency as Truly Mediterranean!
author: chunx M.

description:
Catered for an event. Food was wonderful! Ordered the large platter which served about 10-15 people. There was a nice variety of dips, salads, and lots of falafel. 

Highly recommend; I'll definitely be using them for future meetings:)
author: Marisa C.

description:
Good food. Try their full platter. 
I am not a vegetarian but when I went to this place to eat their delicious food, I would say I LOVED IT!!!
author: Vipul S.

description: I am posting this review with sorrow and regret about the changes at Truly Med. For years, I've been a regular here, considered this the best Mediterranean in the city, and great late night eats. Though lately, it seems as if there've been small changes to the food. For example, the lamb seasoning is not as robust; the pita is a different consistency and no longer tastes homemade; portions seem smaller; hummus less garlicky; and the tabouleh less fresh.
author: Joel A.

description: It's true, the falafel here is AMAZINGLY GOOD. Best falafel wrap I've ever had, seriously!
author: Camille E.

description: I've been on the hunt for the Bay Area's best falafel & it looks like I finally found it! Fresh & flavorful! Everything is made right in front of you & you can't find better quality food for the price anywhere else! I highly recommend this place for all falafel lovers!
author: Cat M.

description:
FOREWARNING!!!  This is not a sit down restaurant.  Food is a take out restaurant.  I would definitely put this in the fast food category since you get the food really quickly.  I had the lamb Shawarma (on the receipt it was spelled "Shawerma"),  and it was pretty awesome.  

For the uninformed Shawarma or Shawurma is a Levantine Arab meat preparation, where lamb, chicken, turkey, beef, or veal are placed on a spit (commonly a vertical spit in restaurants), and may be grilled for as long as a day. Shavings are cut off the block of meat for serving, and the remainder of the block of meat is kept heated on the rotating spit. Shawarma can be served on a plate (generally with accompaniments), or as a sandwich or wrap.  Shawarma is usually eaten with tabbouleh, fattoush, taboon bread, tomato, and cucumber. Toppings include tahini, hummus, pickled turnips, and amba.

I ordered the spicy version in a wrap and the lamb was definitely cooked on a spit (to the right when you walk through the entrance).
author: Bevin H.

description:
Ooo, we just found ourselves a go to Mediterranean stop to up for a quick and delicious meal.

We came to truly Mediterranean on a nice Autumn Saturday evening around 7pm after visiting body manipulations.

I love:
° the lamb shawarma plate
° the speediness
° quality
° variety
° extra meat for $3.5
° accepts CARD!!!


We'll be back for more to pick up some wraps or again, settle for the delicious lamb shawarma.
I also notice that many who frequented the spot have been previous customers, so I'd like to say they maintain a strong consumer basis.

I'll be back!
author: Bern M.

description: This review is based upon only one menu item, lamb shawarma.  The staff was friendly, and the service was fast.  Why only 1 star? The meat was terrible!  It was tough, chewy and full of gristle. It barely tasted like lamb. It was not a pleasant experience.  I used to patronize this restaurant 15 years ago, when my work brought me to the area on a regular basis.  I almost always ordered lamb shawarma. I don't recall it being so bad; but my palate has definitely become more refined with the passage of time.  I will never go back!
author: Kent S.

description: If you're ever in need of a quick bite near the Roxie Theater, this is one of the best options.  I love their lamb shawerma where the meat is so tender as you can see when they slice it off the rotating stick and taste it in your gyro with a crisp pita wrap.  More importantly, the service is friendly, helpful, and fast.  Thus, I'd come back in a heart beat for any of the tasty Mediterranean options!
author: Jenny L.

description: Never fails to deliver. They only serve lamb tues and thurs though..who cares, the chicken shawarma is still a good option. Falafels and hummus are excellent. I usually get their dinners, love the yellow rice with it, yogurt, spicy sauce, tabbuleh, yum! Food always a heap of serving which I always manage to finish off. Friendly people inside, food always fresh. Glad to see them grow old as a mission staple.
author: Shu K.

description: I had the lamb plate.  I'm pretty picky as this is comfort food for me;  it was all delicious, but a bit overcooked for me.  I'll be back for more!
author: kathy O.

description: Delicious falafels; I love the babaganouj. Their shawarma is spot on, too. Excellent customer service. Super Duper nice
author: Jamie P.

description:
Falafel was really good. Great crunch and texture and flavor packed. Must use the side sauce and hot sauce.

Chicken shawarma was alright though.
author: Chelsea L.

description:
Wonderful food,  wonderful people. Everything on the menu is great.
The falafels are fresh and perfect.
author: Julia G.

description: Holy crapballs Batman, that was AMAZING!! By far, my new favorite shawarma place anywhere!!
author: Kenny E.

description: I ordered two vegan falafel wraps from this place with uber eats. I received two steak wraps. Unacceptable.
author: Ryan M.

description: Best falafel wrap in the entire city if you ask me. Also, one of the best bang for your buck places out there.
author: Sara C.

description: Amazing falafel. Great food and fun experience here! Not many places to sit so make sure you have a place to go eat if you're looking for a place to chat with friends. Otherwise, highly recommend for a quick bite.
author: Shelby L.

description: Hit this place around 10pm last night for a late meal.  Loved it!  Ordered the spicy lamb shawarma wrap and it was boooomb.  90% meat.  Their Tahini sauce is really good and the vegetables tasted fresh.  10 dollars and some change.  The guy working there is really nice as well.  Will definitely be coming back again when Im in the area.
author: Yuhan Z.

description:
Okay, so my friend and I were on the hunt for some good Mediterranean food since we arrived in SF and this was our second choice eatery since the first place we were trying to go to was closed. But plan B turned out to be a great alternative! 

This place is TINYY~ While there are a few tables outside, there is barely any room inside. This is definitely mainly a to-go food establishment.. 

We shared the chicken shawarma- it's like a huge forearm's length size burrito. It was so delicious and so satisfying. The meat however wasn't as piping hot as I'd have liked; they look like they put it on the grill until it's warm. Their spicy sauce is good.

The owner gave us complimentary falafel.. which were fresh and great! The greek yogurt  sauce was nice and creamy. 

I tried the baklava and it was soo good. Flaky, and not overly sweet, with pistachio crumbles inside.

Overall awesome hole in the wall, I'm glad we tried this place out!
author: Christine K.

description: I have been going here for the past 10 years, in the SF and the Concord location. It is as good as it gets. the Lam Shawawarma with the pita bread they use is out of this world. Go check it out if you are in the area!
author: Joe B.

description: It really helps to be located next to Roxie,  so convenient.   Dash in and dash back in line for documentary about climate change with dicaprio.  Had the wonderful falafel deluxe, difference is the added eggplant  (why are they called eggplant?) And french fries inside.  It's a two meal portion size. Hummus inside was great, mildly spicy. Eating in the rain in line, what more can one ask for, a seat perhaps.
author: Helen L.

description:
Stopped by today and picked up a lamb shawarma and Mediterranean combo plate. Both were fantastic and the falafels...mmm.

Very friendly staff and they take pride in their food. I would definitely recommend.
author: Rich L.

description:
This is just great food at a great price brought to you by some real hard working men and women. The combo platter is a vegetarian's dream come true. They give you a lot of really great food.
The baba is insane! I have never tasted it so good, it is actually better than the hummus, which says a lot. 

Hey guys, can I just buy a jar of your red sauce? Wowsers good.
author: Winter M.

description:
Best. Falafel. In. Town.

It'd been awhile since I'd eaten food from Truly Mediterranean, for no clear reason other than I'd forgotten about it. Gave it another go yesterday and am pleased to say I will definitely be back.

Firstly, the place is very small, with two outside tables and a small counter with about 4 stools inside as far as seating goes. Highly recommend getting your food to go (and with Dolores Park so close by, you're not exactly hard pressed for a locale to eat it). 

Yesterday I ordered the regular falafel wrap (the deluxe one comes with potato and eggplant, for $1.75 more). It was a little over $8, very large for your typical wrap, and contained the most enormous and green falafel I've ever seen. Typically when I think falafel, I think of a ball about the size of a baby's fist. This falafel was closer to the size of MY fist, and had such great flavor, not to mention a bright green color on the inside, indicating freshness and a homemade quality. The wrap also came with cucumber yogurt sauce and tahini. Very simple ingredients but such a pleasure to consume. Very delicious.

I can hardly wait to try the lamb shawarma that seems to be so popular here.
author: Megan D.

description:
I dropped by Truly Mediterranean in hopes of securing a delicious chicken shawarma. Sadly, it was a Monday, and they are apparently only available on Tuesdays and Fridays. :(

I ended up getting a chicken kebab sandwich instead, which was enormous and fresh but not quite what I had been looking for. While it was pretty good, I thought the balance of flavors was a little off.

They deserve four stars nonetheless because the staff is so friendly, and the food is a great value. The guy cooking up my kebab also gave me a little paper boat of free falafels, and they were amazing. Totally coming back to try a falafel wrap next time.
author: Kelly R.

description: This place is awesome! When we lived in the neighborhood it was our go-to for delicious wraps. Haven't been in a while, but decided to order from them for a dinner party we just hosted. They were super helpful over the phone when I placed the order. The food was hot and ready right when I got there. The guys running the shop were so attentive and nice. And the food! Delicious. Everyone raved about it. We ordered baba ghanoush, hummus, falafel, chicken kebabs, beef/lamb sausage kebabs, and pita. Everything was amazing! I don't know how they make their hummus, but I've never had one so creamy and delicious. The falafel was moist and crispy. 5 stars all around. Thank you Truly Med!!
author: Jen H.

description: Falafel deluxe is a bit expensive but gigantic -- enough for lunch for two-- and very good, my favorite from among the options in the neighborhood
author: Janet S.

description:
Great middle eastern spot! I grew up with middle eastern food and rarely eat it in restaurants because I'm super picky, but this food is food and cheap. For $10, I got a whole to-go plate of chicken shawarma, hummus, tabouli, rice, pita and sauces. If you want something subbed in your plate (baba ganoush, eggplants, salad) just ask. The seasoned rice is really good and the vegetables in the tabouli are nice and fresh. I think the chicken shawarma wasn't as good as the lamb shawarma though, I will stick to the lamb next time. The chicken was kind of dry. The pita also isn't great, but pita is never good in this country so I don't expect much. 

This spot is quick, easy, healthy and fresh - highly recommended! Not much room to sit here, better to get take out.
author: Lauren G.

description: The best falafel and shawrmah in the west coast, its the real deal ,i go out of my way every time im in San Francisco
author: Sam S.

description:
Chicken only on tuesdays and fridays! I wish I did my research before coming here. So sad cause I really want that lamb shawerma.

No restrooms. How can a restaurant not have restrooms?! How can you let customers eat without washing their hands?!

The only seating is inside (bar-like) and outside (next to a bus stop and flying pigeons).

But that falafel is bomb.
author: Inez J.

description:
great food great service.
got the mediterranean platter and was so satisfied. enough food for two... thanks!
author: Annie C.

description: I wonder how current any of these reviews are, that helped this place garner a 4 star rating? Ive been coming here for years and have seen the portions shrink , the prices rise  and the quality go down. Tonight was the worst. I have not been in there in like a year- all new faces , unhappy, scared, stressed looking faces,(new ownership maybe?). The chicken shawarma was a loosely filled log of dryish meat, tomatoes and a fairly good, spicy sauce all wrapped up in foil for ELEVEN EFFING DOLLARS. Maybe if it was 2am and I was really drunk it would have filled the gullet,  but I was sober and it sucked. Why didn't I get a beautiful burrito instead, at half the price. Live and learn.
author: J. T.

description:
Falafel: hella good
Chicken shawarma wrap: hella good
Will I come back: yup

Tiny place, excellent service, parking is horrible (it's Frisco, what do you expect?), but the food is so good. I recommend this place!
author: Denise A.

description: Walking around the Vslencia/16 area and I decided I wanted Mediterranean.  It's quick & delicious. I had the chicken shawarma only available Tuesday & Friday.
author: Manny Y.

description: I have to admit that I've never actually been to this restaurant (I've only ordered off UberEats) but it's by far the best falafel I've had in the Bay Area. It is perfectly soft and well-seasoned on the inside and crunchy on the outside. I love that there's sesame seeds on the outside. I've also had the Mediterranean plate, which comes with a good variety of food including falafel, Baba ganoush, hummus, pita bread, and salad. Note that it only comes with two falafel so order the side of falafel to round it out. You'll get a TON of falafel for only $6. The falafel sandwich is delicious and much bigger than I expected. The wrap itself is perfectly crisped and it comes not just with falafel and garnishes but also with fries inside (genius). Definitely recommend and can't wait to try other dishes.
author: Sally C.

description: So mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm.  But seriously...mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm.  Longtime mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm.  Shawarma mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm.  Lamb mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm.
author: Gre P.

description: This is some of the best Mediterranean food I have ever had and hands down best falafel. The staff is great and kind. Order the combo plate for a ton of food for less than $10
author: McKenna G.

description:
Love this place!

The lamb shawarma is a big hot meaty juicy mess.  The chicken isn't bad and falafel is great.  The combo plate comes with falafel, cucumber, hummus, baba ghannoush, tabouleh, dolmas, feta, onions, tahini, hot sauce, and pita for about $11.  Good any-time meal.  Limited seating.  Good location and good for takeout.
author: D B.

description: The hummus is so good, it really should be illegal after 10pm on the weekends, which is pretty much when I go there.
author: Anya P.

description: Really great take out food. Reasonably priced and generous portions. Personal favorite is the Mediterranean platter.
author: Austin R.

description:
I've heard great things about the falafel here and was happy to finally try this place out.  Now, I'm quite the falafel fiend, and embarrassingly enough, I even dropped a falafel once onto the ground and still ate it :- / To make matters worse, it defo wasn't worth it as it was a sub par falafel.

Anyway, I digress, I ordered the deluxe falafel wrap, deluxe meaning it included potatoes and baba ganoush. 

The good news is that the falafel itself was quite tasty -- crispy, meaty and moist on the inside.  My only complaint was it was just a smidge under seasoned.   

My gripe is that the baba ganoush, which typically I adore, was rather stringy and bland, and I wish I didn't have it at all in my wrap.  Very disappointing.  

Finally, the wrap was supposed to include potatoes but there were only two small potato wedges.

Service was quick and pleasant so I definitely appreciated that.  I'll be going back, just not so sure I'll order the deluxe, the regular might be a better bet!
author: Susan Y.

description:
Had the lamb shawarma. It was awesome. Had it one time with no hot sauce and it wasn't as awesome, but still great for the price. (I don't take spice very well, but I would still get a bit of the hot sauce because it adds a nice zing).

I came in, I ordered, *2 minutes later* I got my order, I conquered.

Baklava was also awesome.
author: Vicky E.

description:
Best lamb shawarma in SF.

LOADS of meat, made well, tasty, flavorful, and damn filling. 

The only negative IMO is that it was too crispy.  I actually ended up peeling off the crispy pieces b/c they kept breaking off onto the table while I was taking eating.
author: Alfonzo J.

description: I have been going to truly med for over 10 years and I have never been disappointed. They make great food from great ingredients. They are friendly and polite and quick. There is no question they have the best Mediterranean food in the city (that I have tried). My favorite is the feta sandwich with eggplant:)
author: Momo A.

description: It's a small space but it has seats. I got the falafel deluxe because it has eggplants. However, I the flavour of the eggplants were buried underneath the flavour of everything else. The wrap was piping hot when it was served. The falafel were hot and tasty. There was a good amount of diced cucumbers. Even though I ordered it spicy, I couldn't taste a single bit of hot sauce. Overall, the wrap was huge.
author: James S.

description: I've only written a couple Yelp reviews but I felt compelled to write this one. Was very disappointed with this place. I ordered the lamb shwarma which they were out of so I differed to the chicken shwarma. They used cold chicken that they put aside instead of cutting it off fresh, then began to wrap it up in a ripped flat bread with nothing else inside. I asked if they could add in some of the toppings from the toppings bar which is usually included. They did and then charged me $3 extra without mentioning it would be extra charge upfront. Even with the salad the wrap was very dry and bland, and didn't taste fresh. I ended up throwing it away, and my friends usually call me a garbage pale because I'll eat anything so that's saying something.
author: Jeremy L.

description:
We got there pretty late and as they were leaving they gave us free falafel balls! These guys were extremely chill and were extremely hospitable. 10/10 will definitely come back.

Also the food was amazing :)
author: Amaresh S.

description: Amazing food best customer service ever, I come all the way from east bay to have their shawarma the owner wanted us to try spicy falafel so he did a free small sandwich for my daughter a service that u dont find any where
author: Sam D.

description:
Delicious falafel! I love their falafel wrap and the chicken shawarma is quite good (avail Tuesdays and Fridays, I believe) 

Service is always super friendly.  Great hole in the wall place!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I've been coming to this place on an off for years.  The lamb shawarma has always been on point and delicious. 

I rolled in last night right before closing, at like 9:53.  I asked if I could still order and they obliged.  I happened to be holding two dozen roses.  A friend of mine left them at the bar for her 30th B-day so on my way to BART I was trying to hand them out to anyone that wanted them.

I asked if any of the workers wanted a rose and one of them replied yes and asked how much.  I told them they were free and which colors he wanted, red or yellow.  He asked for one of each.  A few moments later I asked him if they were for his wife and he said they were.  I gave him the whole bunch and told them to give them to her.  As I was going to pay he said not to worry about it and comped it.

I ate that shawarma in the 16th street BART station as I waited for my train.  I have never had a more delicious lamb filled shawarma in my life.  The sauce erupted like a geyser of flavor poring forth from a delicious core of delight.  It was blissful.

The man who made the shawarma is named Ali.  He changed my life.
author: Zack M.

description: The name speaks for itself. Authentic place, delicious food, friendly service. Feels like some place outside of US. Maybe the best falafel in SF
author: Edward M.

description:
I have to admit I don't get the love for this place. Jamie W. and I came here and realized as soon as we walked in that this is targeted to the budget-conscious hipster, preferably skinny ones since space is at a premium in this closet of a place. It reminds me of any number of places you would find around a college campus except that the prices have been very much Mission-ized. You can tell it has a devoted following because people came in and ordered what they wanted without a moment's thought.

Since I had to peruse the overhead menu (see menu), I felt the heavy impatient sighs behind me as well as the dead stare of the servers who gave me severe small-mouth. OK OK, relax... Given my flexitarian desires, I went for the $9.50 Mediterranean Combo Plate which sounded heavenly - falafel, hummus, babaganoush, tabouleh, diced cucumber salad, dolmas, feta cheese, seasoned onions, tahini and pita bread (see photo). It was all there in a takeout tray ready to devour, and for the most part, it was solid.

The falafel balls were probably the best feature especially when I dipped them into the hummus. The dolmas and the cucumber salad, on the other hand, tasted like they were in the fridge a bit too long, and the babganoush was quite oily. Jamie went for their specialty, the $7.15 Falafel Wrap, which he deemed decent but nothing outstanding (see photo). Eating at the counter was something of a joke since we were constantly elbowed and battered by handbags. Good times.

FOOD - 3 stars...decent enough Mediterranean food but nothing that stood out to us
AMBIANCE - 2 stars...like dining in an elevator where people are coming in and out at every floor
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...efficient but on the surly side
TOTAL - 3 stars...lackluster and claustrophobic, not my favorite Mediterranean combination
author: Ed U.

description: Had their chicken shawarma the other day, and it was a hefty wrap. I asked for spicy, but it just wasn't spicy enough for me. I would go back here to eat lunch when I'm jn the area though. My friend who is more in tune with mediterranean food said that they put too much yogurt on it, which caused it to drip, so that's a bit of a downer. Nonetheless, can't wait to go back.
author: Randy L.

description:
Great Mediterranean food for SF (which is lacking in this area). I'm from San Diego where for some reason there are a million amazing Greek restaurants. I like this spot though. They have a good vegetarian plates and chicken and lamb shawarma wraps. They also have really yummy falafel and you can get it plain or in s wrap as well. The wrap comes with a hot sauce option that isn't very hot so I always get it.

Warning - these wraps are huge. Definitely big enough for two hungry people to share. They can cut it in half for you so you can easily enjoy it. They don't have any seating really, just a little table outside so most people take the wraps over to Dolores park if it's a nice day.

Great neighborhood spot to get some fresh, healthy, Mediterranean food. It's also very quick to pick items up all of the time and the service is always wonderful.
author: Juliet S.

description: This place has amazing regal shawerma and falafel!! Absolutely to die for and soo worth a stop in! They were featured on Anthony Bourdain too!! Love this place! Craftly and artistically made and not too expensive!! Love!
author: Roro C.

description:
Pretty standard shawarma and falafel, the kind you can find in just about any kabob place in strip malls across the country.

The falafel wrap was huge -- a lot of food for $6.85 -- but it was only pretty good in the world of falafel.
author: Charles S.

description:
Great, fast service.  We split a lamb wrap and asked the cool to make it how he would like it. amazing, lamb was out of this world.  The gentleman at the register ran us for two, we didn't notice since we had a drink and and asked the cook to make it his way, assumed it was extra stuff. After we left the cashier chased us down 16th to give us our change back and apologized for charging us double. Thought we ordered two. 

Will be back!
author: Aaron H.

description: Incredible! Found this place on the way back to Bart and decided to stop in. Very friendly staff and excellent food. The chicken kebab was outstanding. The prices were great and so was the quality of food. I will definitely be back to try everything else on their menu. Excellent place!!
author: Antonio S.

description:
Awesome falafel I try to eat there when I can the prices are very reasonable and the food is great.
If you are looking for Mediterranean food. This is the place to go.
author: Sammy K.

description:
The falafels this place hooks you up with are tender lil' masses of goodness that are crunchy on the outside, steaming and flavorful on the inside, with just the right amount of graininess. 

The feta gets 5 stars. So fresh and creamy!

The salads are fresh and beautiful, seriously beautiful lil' veggie gardens on your plate.

The hummus isn't as creamy as I'd like.

The owner is a sweetheart, and randomly hands you free fresh falafels when you least expect it. 

A must, and our go-to for mediterranean food.
author: Gabriela W.

description: Don't know where to start but OH MY GOD!!! This place is HEAVEN!!! Literally the best wraps and combos. Had the Kufta combo and the falafel deluxe and let me tell you I've been around the world and this is by far my favorite spot for middle eastern food. I will be living here eventually! Thanks for the great fresh delicious food.
author: Bryan M.

description:
Amaaaaaaaaaazing Falafel... I know what falafel is and by far i'm in love with the Falafel Deluxe... No way I will walk by this place even if im not hungry and not grab a falafel sandwich. 

Good job guys, pls keep it up :)
author: Tareq M.

description: Probably the best Mediterranean burrito I have ever had! If you are ever close by... come try it out!!! It's delicious!!!
author: Chris M.

description:
Dragged here by a friend who insists it's the best in the city. After being sold by the previous owner, he's skeptical the consistency will stay the same but took me there nonetheless. 

I had the lamb shawarma wrap since that's usually my go to. I also added eggplant and potato for who knows why, but it looked delicious. Overall, it was some good lamb and would definitely be back if in the area.
author: Leina K.

description: Best falafel in the USA. The lamb shawarma was awesome!
author: S Z.
