description: I ordered uber eats from this place many times. The food here is great! I usually order the chicken kabab and was never disappointed. The food was good every time i ordered.
author: Sai S.

description: I love everything I've ever eaten here!  It's fresh and delicious with huge portions.  And the staff here is always super friendly.  Both chicken and lamb shwarma are equally good. The Mediterranean combo plate is enough for 2 people. The prices are very fair for the amount and quality you get.  I've tried other greek/Mediterranean places in town, and always wish I was eating here instead.   And the extra roasted eggplant added to dishes...So tasty!
author: Sarah K.

description:
This little hole-in-the-wall is "truly" wonderful.  The Falafel wraps are out of this world with fresh cucumbers and tahini sauce smothered all around.  Your mouth will never be dry. The falafels are on constant rotation there so you're always bound to get some piping hot balls in your meal.

Don't expect much of a smile because you probably wont get one but service is always friendly and appreciated. If you're feeling a bit adventurous go for the garlic mint yogurt... yum!
author: Kevin J.

description:
What's a guy gotta do to get a decent super falafel around here?  

Back in the day, I would walk to Haight Street and get a super falafel from Ali Baba's Cave (RIP--that location only).  Ali Baba's Cave "changed"--heavy scare quotes mine and intentional as all hell--into Al-Fanoose (RIP), but the super falafel didn't change.  Al-Fanoose closed.  I was sad.

I went to King of Falafil/Falafel, and I love that place, but its super falafel isn't as good as Ali Baba's Cave's/Al-Fanoose's was, plus it's in no way convenient for me to stop there on the way home from work, unless I intentionally get off BART too early, take a 38R, and walk UP A HILL and IN THE OPPOSITE DIRECTION from my place.

I went to the original Ali Baba's Cave a couple of times after that, but it's just not that convenient either, despite how flat the Mission generally is.  Then I remembered long-forgotten Truly Med.

Yes, Truly Med of the days when plain-wrap mechanic's garages had design studios hidden in them but before the days of said hidden design studios advertising their existence as design studios and, thus, blowing their cover and jacking up their and the nearby rents and pushing out mom-and-pop stores and poor people of color because what San Francisco needs is more white people who make too much money and don't pay enough taxes or attention to the rich history of where they now live, let alone to their surroundings, right?

Yes, I walked into Truly Mediterranean and ordered a super falafel, and you know what the guy said?

"A what?"

Me:  "A super falafel."

Him:  "We only have one size of falafel.  It's big."

"No, a super falafel, with eggplant and potatoes in it."

"Oh, a falafel deluxe?"

"Sure.  A falafel deluxe."

The falafel deluxe is good.  Almost as good as the old super falafel.  The hummus is really good.  Sadly, I also know that they deliver.

What's a guy gotta do to get a decent super falafel around here?  Much more than he used to, apparently.
author: John S.

description:
Amazing food. Juicy and tasty lamb. The sauce is flavorful. Yes, I am talking about the Lamb Shawarma. I love love their Lamb Shawarma. Need I say more? 

The service is great, the people are kind, the food is great, the price is a steal, and it's always a treat to stop by just and grab a great meal. Best Middle Eastern food thus far and I've been to the Middle East.
author: Sandra W.

description:
Roasting meats hit all your senses as soon as you step in.  
The sauces used in the lamb wrap was not typical and only have had it here.  Purple and red colored.  The sauces were important because the meat was a bit dried out.  Not as loaded with meat has some places especially given the price of 10 each but contents could have some variance which can't be held against them.
author: Fanshu B.

description: Back in the bay, Christmas evening- we decide to split a lamb shawerma, because that is what you do in while in the mission! Yummmmm. Its good to ge back! We missed the bay!
author: Erin S.

description:
Whoa these wraps are massive. Consuming just one of these wraps it looked as though I was going to hit my daily calorie intake on this one sitting. But yeah we probably shouldn't have ordered that side of hummus.

I have the deluxe and it was pretty satisfying. I did make an internal note to opt put of the eggplant next time (it was way smooshy and I didn't enjoy it) and request for non-spicy. Not because I can't handle spicy but because I didn't really care for the wrap to be as spicy as it was. But I was pleasantly surprised that my wrap had fries. Does this make the wrap not as "truly Mediterranean" as their name suggests? I don't know but I also don't care - it was good! 

Warning: it can get quite messy. The cubed cucumbers, they tend to fall out easily and there was a bit of excess dripping from my wrap; probably from the cucumber juice. 

Service was quick and swift. I ordered ahead and was told 10 minutes and they were good on their word.
author: Esther A.

description:
All I can say is that this place is amazing. We've been here a couple of times and I made sure that I get to visit the place every time I am in town. This place located at the very heart of Mission, place of food, art, music and basically anything that will keep you coming back. Mission is one of the places I like to visit when there's an available parking in the area. Lol! Yes, tight street parking and some road sign were  more of a suggestion really. 

I found Truly Meditteranean when I was in search of what to bring back home to my husband when I first visit San Francisco. I know he wouldn't ask for anything else other than I bring him some good food. I know that he can't say no to shawarma. With  reputation when it comes to food I know I was on the right track. The place is small mainly for take-out but they have a stool for sitting down for people who don't mind smelling like a lamb like I do. If you know what you want or don't, you can simply ask the guy gentleman there and you won't be sorry. Instinctively, I ordered the lamb shawarma. He asked if we're a resident of the area. I said my family lives here but I am from Des Moines, IA. He was a little surprise but I'll bet he didn't where is that. Yes, most of the people I know would ask me where I live and will always be a surprise of my answer. Anyway, I told him that if my husband was here, he would definitely be a regular. The roaster keeps me entertained in this place, well aside from the people. There's nothing better than watching a rotisserie grill roaster with a juicy lamb being sliced into smaller pieces. The place is always busy as the usual but they really make every order in a timely manner so you won't be waiting there for too long. Again, there's not much parking in the area, so someone typically drops me off there and pick-up after 10-15 minute. For first timers, finding this place might be a little tricky. The place is right by the bus stop on a busy road. By any chance you get lost, just follow to smell, it'll lead you right to their doorstep. The one time that we came here, the guy actually gave us a sample coz I was curious about the falafel and told him I didn't like it. Theirs was nothing like anything that I've tried.  We also tried their baklava which is probably one of my favorite. It's the right amount of sugar that I need for that day. The lamb shawarma is just like how I like it. All the condiments that the put on it perfectly compliments that distinctive taste of lamb. Lamb meat taste is something earthy taste that I like especially the one that they use. That taste that one will truly love or hate.  

I love coming back in this place! I would spend a lot in this place. Every time we come here, people are always nice, smiling and very welcoming. For me, this is one of the best places I've been to get a traditional shawarma. San Francisco is known to always make everything taste better, very cheap or cost an arm and a leg kind of dining. From anything small, the most extraordinary, outrageous, modern and the traditional cooking made better. I think Truly Meditteranean falls under this category which is affordable which do not compromise the taste at all. Now that we've moved in the area, I can be certain that I'll be a regular here. I highly recommend Truly Meditteranean!
author: Marvic R.

description: This place has the best Lamb and Chicken Shawrama! Their is always fresh, and have they fresh Falafel.
author: Moe A.

description: This place is fast, delicious and large portions. I got the chicken Schwarma and the Kefta kabob. Both were great.
author: Melissa S.

description:
Amazingly delicious!! I have dreams about their shawarma, best I've ever tried. I live in the Richmond District and will happily drive to the other side of the city just for their food. This place is a must try!!

But it is very small, more of a to go spot than a restaurant.
author: Brittany K.

description: One of the most amazing "hole-in-the-walls" in the mission. Absolute amazing food and even more amazing service. A true gem. The baba ganoush is unreal.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Food (5/5): Their falafel wrap is my favorite thing I've eaten in SF so far. The falafel itself is moist on the inside, crispy on the outside, and super fresh. The creaminess of the tahini complements the crunch of the cucumbers and tomatoes, and the lavash is perfectly toasted. The lamb shawarma wrap is also really good, too, although it's too much meat for me. My bf loves it though!

Service (5/5): The people making the wraps are super friendly, and they get your food to you quickly. 

Value (5/5): For less than $10, you'll be stuffed. Half of a wrap is usually enough to satisfy me (and I can save the other half for a late night snack), but the food is so good that it's hard to stop halfway.
author: Abby S.

description: I had the lamb kebab. The aroma of the roasting lamb on the rack will keep you hungry. :) The wrap was nice and crunchy, with some good spicy sauce and vegetables to go with it. It gets soggy quickly though.
author: Toni T.

description: Best Falafels in the Bay Area ! You have got to try it ! They also carry really delicious lamb sharawma. Sorry about the spelling ! The hummus and tahini sauce it awesome! Order ahead online or by phone for no wait! I always leave happy and full!
author: Louise T.

description:
I eat here once a week and get the combo platter. By far, my favorite falafel in the city!  This falafel is not dry, crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside. Perfection! 

The shawarma wraps are huge and tasty too. We always talk about how crunchy and good the pita is. They toast it...
author: Anna V.

description:
FINALLY tried this place and omg their food is amazing. 

The lamb shawarma wrap really hits the spot if you have the cravings for mediterranean food. Their lamb shawarma is succulent and flavorful, while the wrap locks in all the juices from the meats and veggies, making every bite just as blissful as the next. If you want to upgrade to delux, you get the eggplant and potatoes added with your wrap. 

We also ordered the lamb shawarma plate (lamb + rice + taboule + hummus + potato + tomato/onions). It was good, but if I had to choose between the plate and wrap, 9/10 I'll go with the wrap... and maybe some extra hummus on the side. 

They stay open relatively late during the week (10pm). If you plan on picking food up, I'd recommend having someone go with you so they can jump out of the car and get it, as opposed to you circling the block infinity times looking for parking. 

Note: some of their dishes are only served on certain days, so check on that beforehand and plan accordingly!
author: Andrew E.

description: $10 for a good size lamb shawerma wrapped in that lavash bread, warm off the grill! Had a hefty amount of meat, which it should for that price, and its a steal considering its in San Francisco! Little to no wait on a Saturday night around 9. It's just a tiny place with a few stools for seating against the wall for a quick bite. Didn't try the baklava, but wonder if it's house made since it costs $2 a piece.
author: Malika H.

description:
This food is perfect. Fresh, crafted with pride from a core staff. The meats are cooked with well balanced flavors and go well with their homemade tahini.

It is a small restaurant with little room to enjoy your meal sitting down with a group. Take it to go, or relax right outside or in a table top bar and it's okay.

5 stars for quality and taste of food and clear pride that goes into each meal.
author: Naser N.

description: A Truly Mediterranean is truly an amazing Falafel/Shawerma/Kebab (Mediterranean food) eatery, providing wonderful service from their kind employees. They were helpful to our many questions and provided the best options to eat. Overall great food and great service, exactly what you want from a place to eat.
author: Nicolai S.

description:
One of my many favorite spots to have a shawerma! Very big, couldn't even finish it. They have different choices from lamb, beef, chicken and falafel. One thing I like about this place is that it's owned by middle eastern ppl. When you wanna have a great tasting shawerma make sure they are middle eastern like these guys! 
If there's a any downspots, that would be the place is really small so you can't have a sit down dinner with a big party. Sometimes finding somewhere to park can be a problem. Other than that can't complain.
author: Sinat A.

description:
Great falafel and chicken shawarma! Even better if you combo it up.. It does exist! I happened to stumble upon it asking for a chicken shawarma and two pieces of falafel (thought I mean't on the side).. but they stuck it in the wrap.. and it was delicious!

I'm from Houston, where mediterranean food was typically Lebanese (at least the places I went) and used pita.. So lavash is new to me.. and I'm pretty happy to find a place where the lavash has a little bit of crispiness to it, and doesn't fall apart in my hands --- this is a nuclear cleanup when it happens.. So this is one of my goto places for a good healthy quick bite...

The staff is very friendly and always seem to just want to help out.. Very chill vibe. Check it out...
author: James S.

description: Great lavash wraps. Flavorful, toasted to perfection and just well done. Place is small. There is a bar with a few chairs and 2 tables outside to and eat. Definitely a dive- but a great tasting one. If you are in the area and you want a great falafel or a shawarma- stop in satisfy your craving.
author: Stefano P.

description:
I will avoid going to The Mission when I'm home. The traffic sucks, there's a ton of noise, but if I want the best shaweerma in California, I'm hitting Truly Mediterranean. 

The lamb is amazing. Hell, I can eat four in one sitting! Granted, you have to roll me down the street, but I won't complain about over eating here. 

Please open one up in Orange County, all our shaweerma in So. Cal. are beef, dry and crap. We need a Truly Mediterranean STAT!
author: R.C. S.

description:
This small hole in the wall is been here forever.  The staff are very nice people.  Lamb shawarma is amazing.  The best falafel in the city.  Lavash is nicely toasted and fresh what can you ask for more?
I was going for the restaurants across the street near by but I guess next time I'll be switching to here for some decent food.  The Mission is changing but for this place I hope never change.
author: Mar H.

description:
Great falafel here! The lamb shawarma is good too but as a Lebanese it's very different from what I'm used to but it's still a delicious lamb sandwich! Very generous portions. 

The service is what makes the place even special. The guys there are very friendly and will help you if you don't know what to get. Try their deserts, they're great too!
author: Tamara S.

description:
Truly Mediterranean is "truly" a great spot for late night eats. Whether you are out with friend(s) or like me, working the swing shift, "truly" one of the authentic Mediterranean spots in the area. 

For my evening lunch, I had the Falafel Deluxe wrap. For $8.25, I get six halves of fresh falafel balls with grilled vegetables, eggplants and a tangy tzatziki white sauce blanketed in a grilled lavash flatbread. Size-wise, this treat could be "truly" mistaken to my usual burrito with the same bulky size. With every key ingredients combine in one, I actually enjoyed this treat. The unique treat is something different.

"Truly" this is a great spot on 16th Street for late night eats. 

Btw, "Truly" is my "word of the day"!

Like many of you "truly" give a crap!
author: Matt G.

description:
I really like their Shawarmas... and prefer the Lamb over the Chicken. 

Tip: Add hummus and/or feta to make it even yummier!!!
author: TuUyen L.

description:
5 star for lamb shawarma and baklava, pistachio and walnut.
5 star for friendly service.
Too bad there are no comfortable seating or we would like to visit often.  I am addicted to the baklava so we would drove by and just get those yummy honey treats.
author: Bella A.

description: First time eating here this past Saturday the 24th. Food was amazing. They made my wife a chicken shawarma and it was to die for, and my Lamb shawarma was also delicious. Can't wait to go back, next time with an empty stomach so I can also have some of their homemade baklava, and hummus!
author: Jae B.

description: The best lamb kebab that you can have in your life l swear they don't have the coolest place but they manage to compensate with the food quality
author: James D.

description:
so yummy! and one of the rare cheap city places worth your time that take plastic. 

I got the lamb schwarma, and it was perfect city walk and eat food. Good size, nice flavor, tender meat, just the right amount of sauce, and expertly wrapped! I will definitely come 
back :)
author: Caddy M.

description: Quintessential hole in the wall mediterranean food in SF. The actual restaurant was tiny and old, but the food and service more than make up for it. The Falafel was huge and cheap, and offered solid flavor. The smell was a little off putting, but the flavor made up for it. It was so much food that I had my Girlfriend finish it and she loved it as well.
author: Joshua S.

description:
DID THE MEDITERRANEAN JUST COME OUT TO ME????  If I could, I'd give this place, 10 Stars!!!!

I can't believe this place.  I went for the first time about a week ago, and instantly, it is now a regular.  The lamb shawarma IS Amazing.  Falafel chickpea is also THE MOST authentic I've ever had.  Service is also amazing!  I love the people who work here!  They are friendly and so kind....  really sweet family run business.

For the lamb Shawarma, my favorite is to add extra tomatoes.    I went twice in a row within a couple weeks, and also tried it with eggplant.  They are both equally good.  For eggplant fans, the texture is cooked just right, and cooked real tender.  It's realllllly filling.

With extra tomatoes, the juices of the tomatoes burst and create a very messy meal where you'll need napkins - lots of them.  But i actually think it's the way to go!  SOOOOOO GOOD!

I think extras are only as extra buck.

The difference between here and anywhere I've tried - is the marinade of the meat.  It's so thoroughly flavored, and cooked just right, grilled - and I love the wrap grilled as well!  BY FAR, the BEST mediterranean place I've been to, and I wish they had tons of locations.  Parking is not easy, but it's a great place if you want to take it to go and you have a friend waiting in a car.

they close real late at night, so it's a great place any time!
author: J. W.

description:
Best Shawarma without having to go back to the middle east! 
He really stuffs the thing, make sure u get the deluxe shawarma for all the extra toppings. 

Wait can be a bit long, esp. for something as simple as shawarma. Call ahead if you are in a rush
author: Yosof R.

description: In love with the lamb. Just wish this place was bigger to fit all the happy customers. They are very fast too thank you i always come by when im in the city.
author: Tara J.

description:
I'll preface this review with a little story. BF was relentless in his rendition of the orbit commercial (in which a giant falafel comes in the elevator between two people:  "We built this city...... Falafel!") on our way to Truly Mediterranean. Originally, I was going to get the lamb shwarma but after all that, I figured what the heck.. Falafel!

And I went for it.. the falafel Deluxe. Boy, it was humongo! A slab of their spicy sauce, diced cucumbers, giant slices of eggplant, thick cuts of fried potatoes and crunchy falafel all rolled into a toasted lavash. It was scrumptious! But next time, I'm going to skip the deluxe and just order the regular because the eggplant and potatoes didn't do much for me. And did I mention it's humongous? 
The lamb shwarma was also very flavorful but lacked veggie crunchiness, I'll ask them to add cucumbers next time.
author: Jamie M.

description: This place has been my go to spot for falafel wraps since kindergarten. Everything is fresh made in front of you. Their falafel wraps used to be the only thing I would order until recently.  My mom and I have been sharing their lamb shawarma lately and it's amazing! Delicious  thin slices of layer upon layer of lamb, juicy and perfectly seasoned. I'm always sceptical about ordering shawarma meat because it's usually some ground meats mixed together (which I believe is called Doner meat and not shawarma). Truly Mediterranean does it right! I'm hoping to grab some lunch here today :).
author: Terese V.

description: Food is good, but nothing special. The falafels I had were a bit to greasy. And the shawarma wrap, was had all the flavor in one end of the wrap, first half was dry and not too enjoyable, but when I was about to give up boom flavor, juices, yuuuum. It would be great if gets better served
author: Natalia E.

description:
No lie: I loved this Chicken Shawerma as much as I enjoyed my dinner at French Laundry a few months earlier.  I'm not even gonna  calculate how many Chicken Shawerma's I could get (a lifetime's, perhaps?) for the price of that single meal.  

Peruse the simple menu posted on the wall, order while standing in line, wait at the bar stools, then take your hot, delicious Middle Eastern sandwich somewhere lovely to enjoy it, as sitting in one of the 2 tables out front will only give you a front row seat to the passing craziness of humanity (?) that is 16th Street.

Before sending you on your way with your bagful (under $20 for 2 dinner-sized sandwiches + 2 waters), they roast that baby on the grill, sealing in warmth and goodness from the outside in.  

The Chicken Shawerma was perfect.  The Falafel Deluxe, a lavash-enrobed falafel with roasted eggplant and potatoes, a wee bit less perfect (too many potatoes).  Next time, extra eggplant and no potatoes.

And there will be a next time, most def'.
author: Tracey A.

description:
FOUND MY NEW SHAWARMA SPOT!!!!!!!!!!!!
I love the atmosphere, the people that work there and especially their SHAWARMASSSS!! And their falafel and their hummus!! Soooooo goooood!!!!
author: M M.

description:
I did not have high hopes for Truly Mediterranean, but it surpassed my expectations. The wraps at Truly Mediterranean had all of the flavor I love neatly wrapped up in a transportable package

In a very lamb-y mood, I ordered the Lamb Shawerma and Lamb Kabab (both with extra hot sauce.) The lamb shawerma had thin slices of lamb and beef with broiled tomatoes, onions, and tahini sauce. The lamb kabab was charbroiled marinated cubes of lamb leg with tomatoes, onions, salad, and tahini sauce. Although the two sound exactly the same, they were distinguishable. For all of the spicy food lovers out there, the hot sauce here is not a joke; it is spicy. I also ordered a falafel and two dolma, which were all delicious. Truly Mediterranean is quick, inexpensive place to grab a very filling and very spicy lunch.

What I recommend:
-- Lamb Kabab with extra hot sauce
author: Andrew W.

description:
I stopped by this place because I heard so much about the lamb shawerma. Oh man, it was definitely worth the trip.

The place is small (4 seats?) so you're better off taking your food to go. The service is okay. They have a pretty standard menu. I found that there was always someone ordering something. It was never dead while I was there (I ate in).

The lamb shawerma I ordered didn't take long to get to me. It was a pretty decent size and it smelled amazing. After the first bite, I was in LOVE. It was by far the best lamb shawerma I've ever had anywhere. While I was eating, I overheard some other guy who was talking to a group of people telling them that he drives from San Jose just to order a bunch of these lamb shawermas for the week. I think that's a sign.

Anyway, I approve of this place. I plan on going back to try other things on their menu but I'm definitely a fan of their lamb shawerma. Must try!
author: Sofia R.

description: The.  Bomb.  Nuff said.  Short menu means the top quality ingredients are always fresh.  Great recipes and the *perfect* Shawarma.
author: Timothy D.

description:
**3.5**

Lamb shawerma here is good, but not amazing. I've had better, even compared to some of the other places in the peninsula. 

I came here with a Groupon, and would only come back with one. 

Also, they put too much garlic in their tabbouleh. Wasn't a pleasant experience burping/digesting the wrap.
author: Diana K.

description: hella good idk why the chicken so yummy but damn i'd come here everyday and eat lamb, chicken, falafel. it doesn't matter i'm nomming on that. also there are 2 very nice gentlemen that work there, one i believed is named Leon and was the cashier last time i came, and 1 was joseph who i chatted up as he made my lamb shawarma. would one back every weekend and feed my kids this stuff it's so good. cheers 10/5
author: Leon F.

description: I have an addiction. To this place. It's an average of once a week that I come here. I'll come up with any excuse to come to this place and bring family and friends. My hubby and I always split a lamb shawarma and combo plate which is the right amount of food variety for our liking. Guys behind the counter are always friendly and often hook us up with fresh falafel while we wait for our order. The place used to have outdoor seating but had to get rid of the tables since it interrupted flow of sidewalk traffic. Inside, it's very narrow and there are about 6 seats at the counter if you want to eat here. Otherwise, looks like you're taking your food to-go. Lamb isn't available everyday so make sure you call ahead if that's what you're craving.
author: Emma G.

description: Tried it twice and never again. Falafel and chicken sandwiches were mediocre (edible if you're very hungry). If you never tried authentic middle eastern food, you'd probably think it's OK here. The servers were rude too.
author: Ahmad A.

description:
Truly Mediterranean is the local joint for kabobs and shawarma in the Mission. It's neither authentic or as fatty as I'd like it to be (in fact, it actually tastes healthy), but it'd suffice for those random cravings for Mediterranean food. 

The only complaint I have is the way they toast their wraps and make the outside crispy. I don't know how I feel about that.
author: Don L.

description:
Yummy kofte kebab platter. Lots of food for a fair price. It comes with rice, tabbouleh, and hummus and l added baba. The kofte was really good and it came with 3 fairly large pieces. I also enjoyed the hummus, tahini, and hot sauce quite a bit with the kofte. 

4:5 stars because I would have liked to have gotten a pita or lavash to eat all that baba and hummus and I thought the sides (other than the hummus) could have been better seasoned overall. Would definitely go back- I want to try the shawarma and falafel.
author: Sam L.

description:
The lamb shawerma is ON point. I've had a lot of lamb shawerma and this is amazing. If I wasn't on a diet, I'd come here much more regularly. I'm used to sub-par shawermas where I taste more wrap than anything else. Here it's not the case. It also helps that the meat is juicy and flavorful. The falafels are insanely delicious. Moist and seasoned well. 

One time I came in it was a little late, and I asked for some falafels. I'm not sure who exactly helped me, but when I asked for tahini sauce, the guy took my order back, added more falafels, and gave me generous amounts of tahini and hot sauce. I'm very resilient to hot sauce, and this hot sauce did me in. To the owner of this place: you're doing it good man.
author: Peter K.

description: The food here was absolutely delicious. We ordered the lamb shawarma wrap and the kofta wrap. They also gave us falafel to try while we waited for our food.
author: Sandra S.

description: Great take out option in the mission. They give huge portions of you're getting the plate option. Spicy sauce is seriously spicy but so good! Recommend calling ahead since the wait could get a bit long.
author: Nelson S.

description:
7x7 100 Best Things To Eat In SF Before You Die 2013

#97 Lamb Shawerma from Truly Mediterranean

It was pretty serendipitous that I ended up at Truly Mediterranean. The bar Dalva is literally a few buildings down so when my friend wanted to get food we stumbled right into Truly Mediterranean. 

I was super eager to try their Lamb Shawerma after smelling the amazing aroma in the air plus seeing all that glistening meat ready to be devoured! 

First plus, the wrap was served piping hot. Most places serve it lukewarm at best so this definitely set them apart right off the bat. Secondly, the lamb was a true stand out. It was tender, had a great earthy flavor that was balanced well with the uses of various herbs and spices. Lastly, the portions were quite generous and filling. 

The spicy sauce is quite good but it can be a little overwhelming so if you really want to taste the dish I would opt out of adding the hot sauce.

Overall Thoughts

Great Lamb Shawerma that is well worth coming back for time and time again
author: Eddie W.

description: The falafel's at this place are fire! Small, simple, menu done incredibly well! Doesn't seem like you can go wrong here! Fast service too, even on busy weekend nights.
author: David F.

description:
I love this place!

Falafel are fresh - moist inside, nice and crunchy outside. The lavash wrap is perfectly thin, filled with hearty veggies and falafels. I don't usually like tahini sauce and it's pretty great here.

I also got the mediterranean platter to split with friends - great feta, excellent hummus,  and an all around great and filling plate for a day in the park.

Can't wait to come back on a Tuesday/Friday and try their chicken shwarma.

Delish.
author: Alexandra K.

description:
On the first stop of last weekend's Yapsie Pupcrawl, the day was kicked off at Truly Mediterranean for some lamb and veggie wraps. The wraps were delish and my favorite was definitely the lamb. The vegetarian was full of eggplant and other goodness and satisfied even my palette!

This was just a quick nibble on the tour so we didn't get to stay long but you can bet that I will be back! Best of all are the tables outside so you can share your wrap with your pup and do some people watching. It makes for a great afternoon!

Food: 8/10

Service: 8/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 7/10
author: Joe M.

description:
I will support any establishment that can cook up a good lamb kabob. Once you have reached that point, you have achieved Mediterranean greatness. Unfortunately, this place has a long way to go.

I really wanted to like Truly Mediterranean, the epitome of a Mission hole in the wall. With raving friend reviews and 700+ more from others, I expected greatness.

I came in on a beautiful Saturday afternoon and ordered the lamb kabob wrap. Lamb cubes, tomato, onions, pepper, parsley, salad, and tahini on lavash. It takes about 15 min to grill the lamb evenly and thoroughly, which I will give them credit for. The thing that bothered me is that the lamb wasn't marinated at all. You could see from the moment they put it on the grill that it's just pure lamb meat and veggies, without any seasoning or preparation. The ingredients in the wrap didn't really help the lack of flavor. 

Plus they throw tahini sauce in here like crazy, so your whole wrap begins dripping halfway in. Not impressed at all. There are much better small legit Mediterranean shops that will cook up lamb kabob that you can smell from a mile away.
author: Dmitriy S.

description: We found this place on accident walking back from some bar hopping. Amazing falafel. Some of the best I ever had. I'm mainly surprised at how inexpensive it is. 2 for a $1! The baklava is great as well. Definitely excited to have this place near us.
author: Danny C.

description:
Thank you, Foodspotting for turning me & my husband onto Truly Mediterranean.  It's such a hole-in-the-wall that it would be so easy to pass by.  Try Truly Mediterranean and you'll be glad you did.

As soon as you walk in, you immediately see the lamb & beef roasting on the spit.  Yum!  They have a pretty simple menu but sometimes simple = good.

The Lamb Schawerma is delicious.  The lavash bread had these great looking grill marks - it was crispy on the outside yet still still a bit soft & chewy.  It is so full of great tasting lamb & beef...but I wish there were a little more tomatoes, onions or tahini sauce to break up the meaty flavor.  Nonetheless, it was still really good.

This will be a place that we'll definitely be returning to.
author: Rose A.

description: The best falafel in SF. Also, if you don't want to get a sandwich, getting hummus and falafel on the side ends up being more food for the same price.
author: Amin S.

description:
Ok - everyone else already told you so I won't bother with gory details, but...the lamb shawerma is very good.  Wasn't a huge fan of the potatoes you can add for a measly buck.  They could have  been fab if they had been crunchy.  Instead, limp and flavorless - but the shawerma otherwise was a winner!

And the counter where you can sit and eat?  Now that leaves a lot to be desired.  The stools are too close to the counter and you can't move them because they are bolted to the floor.  Very un-ergonomic.
author: Lxs S.

description:
yummy lamb schwarma!   Tuesday and Friday = only chicken.

let me start that it kinda took me a while to find this place because of how small and hidden it was. 

quick and easy lunch wrap. they fill this wrap with so much lamb that I didn't think I could eat it in one setting.. but of course that one bite got me and I just wanted to finish the whole thing.  lamb wrap with onions, spicy sauce and tahini sauce. get it spicy!!! it really adds a kick!  this wrap was so good and satisfying!  also the lamb doesn't have the "gamy" taste one would expect.

only thing was that it was $9+?!  kinda sad about the price, but had to try it to see the hype. I'm not sure I can come back here all the time but it's a great place to try schwarma if one hasn't.
author: Josie L.

description: Loved the falafel deluxe per my cousin's recommendation on our Mission jaunt. Wish I was staying longer to try more food here! Customer service was great, too.
author: Sunashine K.

description: Came here with my husband and three boys on Labor day. Food galore, delicious food at that. The falafel was light and crisp. We ordered a dozen. The meal portions were extremely generous. I would definitely recommend this place to a friend. I wish we had a place like this in Sacramento!
author: Heather S.

description: Ordered the chicken kabob with hummus and feta - they charged me for the feta but didn't put a single bit of cheese on there.  The chicken was ok, some pieces were chewy.  The hummus was decent. Would not reorder.
author: Dave R.

description:
Overhyped. Meat was cooked alright. Not well spiced. Lavash was store bought. 

Pass.
author: Vighnesh R.

description: Love the staff here and the dive vibe. The falafel is very authentic. One of my favorite Mediterranean spots in the city.
author: Parker W.

description: Hands down the best falafel I've had so far. First time trying this place, it was so delicious and fresh. The falafel itself has that fresh taste, and that natural green color. I absolutely loved it. Definitely recommend it! I had the falafel wrap (spicy).
author: Leah L.

description:
Babe got me a Chicken Shawema (Friday special I believe) and it was my first time trying Mediterranean.

Usually I don't like burritos since I hate beans,  so when I saw it I was discouraged to eat it, lol. But he told me it wasn't a burrito so I took a massive bite out of it since I was hungry. It was pretty damn good in my opinion. Since this IS my first time trying mediterranean food I don't have anything else to compare it to. But to me it just proves you can't judge a book by its cover. 

I definitely wouldn't mind grabbing this again, and trying more Mediterranean food. Especially when it was featured in the food channel and it had me drooling.
author: Harriet W.

description:
Wow second time here and I wasn't disappointed.  Consistency of their tastiness is amazing. as delicious as before the lamb is just juicy on its on but is enhanced with their hot sauce. I added feta this time and it was on point. 

Plus the staff is just the nicest bunch so helpful. And extremely efficient
author: Chenea P.

description: I've only ever had their food delivered from Caviar, but the food is good tasting, reasonably priced, decent quality Middle Eastern food. Pictured here is the combo plate, chicken kebab, and kefte kabob split between two plates. Use my link for $20 off your first Caviar order: https://bnc.lt/l/7KJ0G4E2EM.
author: Monique L.

description: I have to update my review, because now that I've moved near truly I've found it to be amazingly consistent. It is consistent in deliciousness and in super friendly staff. The lamb and chicken shawarma plates are great, with abundant portions. I wish they had a dining room, but carry-out makes them fast and easy.
author: Peter W.

description:
More like a take out place. 
Very nice hummus. Falafel were also pretty good. 
Overall nice food.
author: Mayur D.

description:
I like terms of endearment. 

"Sweetie" is one of 'em.  Somehow, that coming from an older gentleman with a kind smile and welcoming vibe doesn't come across as pervy.

That set the mood for me at Truly Mediterranean. Definitely hole in a wall: few counter stools to the side; near the entrance, the shawerma slowly turning on its end, getting roasted by fire; map of the Mediterranean on one wall and menu on the opposite one.

Take note that if you come here on a Tuesday or Friday, you'll be disappointed to find that the lamb shawerma isn't on the rotation (but the chicken is) But you really come here because of the LAMB SHAWERMA, so plan accordingly.

The lamb shawerma was wrapped in a large lavash bread, filled with meaty, well seasoned lamb (NOT gamey at all), parsley, onions,tomatoes and tahini sauce. It was so good and filling it had me saying "my habibi!" (aka:baby) with every delicious bite. 

My only beef? $8 for this thing. A tad pricey, but that's why your honey pays for lunch.
author: Janice C.

description: I'm a fan of this spot - except for the fact that their Pita and Lafa are store bought and stale. If they want to be authentic they need to invest in the bread. Also, it says on the store front that the pita is home made which is blatantly false.
author: Jeremy K.

description:
Pretty good, pretty fast, pretty cheap, pretty consistent.
Ugly parking.
author: El B.

description: This place is super tiny but we got food to go that day. We got the lamb kebab wrap. It is definitely packed with a good amount of meat, cucumbers and sauce. I split that and a Mediterranean plate with my bf. We couldn't finish the combination. The falafels were definitely crispy and delicious, even after it sat in the car for a solid 30 min to get home. Their hummus is really good too! They give you plenty of their salad, cucumbers, goat cheese (or is it feta) and onions. I had the mediterranean plate leftovers the next day and it was still really good. The pita bread they give you on the side is pretty substantial, we got 3 half pita breads.
author: Jessica H.

description: This hole in the wall serves up some tasty food; you can smell the deliciousness while walking down 16th. Definitely step inside and order whatever calls most to you. We tried a few items on the menu and all of what we ordered was fantastic. There are perhaps eight seats along a bar that sits against the opposite wall to the ordering station. That said, this place seems to cater mostly to grab-and-go's. The wraps are perfect for that and can be eaten on the go, but be sure to grab napkins because they are juicy with awesome tahini sauce. Also the guys who serve the food are super nice!!!
author: Gaya G.

description:
Average food - also I second the other comments about the employees. You stand in this very small spot and you almost feel like you are an annoyance to them.

Cops seem to like it here.  They pull right up to the bus stop in front of this place. I guess if the bus happens to come too bad, right? Far more important that SF's Finest have their falafel in comfort.
author: George S.

description:
Stop #3 on our trip was for lunch finally. We wanted something quick and easy to bring to Delores Park and falafel was the name of the game on this day.

The friend we are staying with has never steered me wrong on food and he told us that this was the real deal. It is kind of a dive, but I mean that in the best possible way. I knew it was going to be good as soon as I walked in the door and saw the spike of lamb rotating right up front.

I ordered the basic falafel along with a drink. This is a good sized meal for  $7.75. It is messy, but falafel usually is. Perfect for a park meal. It all was made to go and tasted very fresh. I hoovered down the entire thing and was quite satisfied.
author: Dan H.

description:
I haven't been to San Fran in over 15 years and was excited that this place was still open. And just as good as I remember. This is a definite stop every time I visit. 
Delicious, healthy, fast and fresh mediterranean food.
author: Jodi C.

description:
Falafel!  Really outstanding in the lavash wrap.  Ask for it spicy, yum!

Tried the shawerma too, it was good but the cumin/coriander seasoning was a little heavier-handed than with the falafel.    

If you like falafel, this is worth checking out.  Great quick pick-me-up while cruising the Mission.
author: Bob K.

description: Well it's affordable, the best falafel I've ever had, the shawarma is amazing, it's in a really central location, it's open late... it's pretty much the best. I don't often get mediterranean because I think 95% of places that make it are average and the food is underwhelming but this place is the best. Get the falafel with potato and eggplant. Also that baklava. Seriously.
author: Geoff G.

description: The wraps are solid and not ridiculously priced. Nothing extraordinary here, definitely still delicious
author: Derrick W.

description: The lam shawarma (spicy) is delicious and super spicy too so be warned! It was a lot of food too so they're not skimpy on portion size. I loved how the yogurt cooled down the spices, and the lamb was tender and not dry. Loved it, will definitely be back for another
author: Christian R.

description: This place has the best falafel hands down. It's really yummy and moist compared to other places where it's dry af and over fried. They also have really good shawarma. I'll be stopping by again whenever I'm in town.
author: H R.

description:
Best Mediterranean food of my life. What they do is... art.

After too many double IPAs next door at Gestalt, Truly is there for you. Holy cow, I'm still thinking about that falafel deluxe. She's the one that got away, guys. They win awards for their falafel. They have perfected it. The roasted eggplant in the falafel deluxe really adds a nice touch, though what really does it for me is that after it's all wrapped up, they throw it on a grill so that it's crispy and perfect.

Take it to Dolores and think about how great life is until you're done eating it.

Mediterranean food is now ruined for me. Nothing will ever be able to compare to Truly.
author: K M.

description:
i've been going here for over 20 years whenever i'm in SF

luv the shwarmas :)
author: Dredge K.

description:
Best shawarma I've had in SF. Beats oasis. 
Ask to make it deluxe (adds egg plant and potato wedges)
author: Rustom B.

description: Great delivery. Nothing terribly special, but ordering in is super easy with this place.
author: Lauren C.

description:
After hearing all the accolades about the lamb shawerma here, I decided to saunter on in late Friday night. To my disappointment, I discovered that only chicken shawerma is served on Fridays. Thats ok I thought, chicken is harder to muck up versus lamb right? I mean chicken is one of the easier meats to cook.. can't be too hard to make it juicy unless it was cooked hours ago and was just sitting around in a cold metal bin.. Too bad the chicken was in fact sitting in one of those metal bins. 

My shawerma was incredibly dry, room temperature, and bland.. the only thing saving it from my cutting the innards of mouth open were the tomatoes and barely there shawerma sauce. The guys working the counter also didn't want to be there - customer service wasn't obviously on their minds. For $10 and crappy service, I expect to have a decent takeaway meal, especially with so many options nearby in the Mission. How is this place still around?
author: Henry W.

description:
I have had too few good experiences here.  Usually the service is so poor I would rather go some place a bit more friendly--Zaytoon.  

I have had one problem after another.  Recently I was just going in to get hummus-- I know it is a tricky and high service item to order.  I was trying to order when the service person asked the person behind for their order.  I then thought I would ask the cashier and she simply laughed and said that I had to get back in line.  The cashier laughing and smirking was the final straw.

I have had experiences of phoning in an order and the order is completely wrong.  I ordered chicken and got lamb.  I didn't want to walk all the way back as I had gotten home.  I am not sure how chicken and lamb can be confused and it was the same cashier.

I'll not go back--there are other choices.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description:
I live down the street from this place and it's steadily becoming more of a regular stop than Pancho Villa or Arnells.  I work on the go so it's important for me to be able to get decent food that isn't a mess to eat and that doesn't leave me feeling bloated or tired for the rest of the day.

Enter the falafel wrap; your run of the mill, most basic of basic item.  How does Truly Mediterranean do it better?  Well the falafels are put into the lavash bread and then just ever so slightly smushed.  Why is this great?  You ever eat an entire falafel  in one bite? yeah probably not so the slightly flattened, perfectly proportioned falafel is much better.  Not to mention they put in the perfect amount of sauce and everything is so perfectly packaged that it's difficult to tear apart that aluminum foil.

But really, the thing that seals the deal for me is that they can add french fries to your wrap.  Move aside california burrito...

The people working behind the counter are also super friendly and watching them work is like watching... well, there's nothing quite like watching a cook make perfect falafels individually over a hundred times.
author: Bobby Y.

description: Best Mediterranean to-go food in San Francisco.  It doesn't look like much from the outside, but you owe it to yourself to try this place if you're in the Mission.  My girlfriend and I typically split the Lamb Shawerma and Mediterranean Combo Plate, it's the perfect mix of flavors and textures for two people.  Very authentic and juicy, plus the owner is super friendly and the food is prepared quickly.  Don't bother with the other Mediterranean restaurants on Valencia, come here!
author: Bud L.

description:
Stopped here today for a lamb shawerma, not expecting too much.  Boy, was I pleasantly surprised!  Everyone here is so nice and helpful.  I can't  do raw tomatoes, so I asked for them left off... the counter man very nicely offered my choice of something else to replace them!  So.... I took the hummus.  GOOD CHOICE!  I also saw one of the guys pulling out freshly made falafel.  They looked SO GOOD I wished I'd ordered a few to take away.  Next time for sure.... Mmmm a 'doggy bag' of falafel to munch throughout the afternoon!  I'm drooling.  And that hummus... definitely will need to see if I can get a take out container to bring home next time!!

It's more a Levant restaurant, so don't go there thinking it's Greek.  And yes, the shawerma are on toasted lavash.  I thought the lavash was relatively light and flaky, unlike at some other Med restaurants I've tried in the city.  

The owners could make a slam dunk if they also owned a little Med/Mid-East grocery right next door :-)  Speaking of... I definitely need a good rec for a Greek/Mid-East grocer.  Why is it so hard to find decent dolmas, fresh baklava, and all those luscious spices in SF?

This place is great for a quick bite, whether a midday pick-me-up or a drunken night out snack.  If you find yourself in the Mission and jonesing for some good Middle-Eastern food, stop in.  You'll be glad you did.

Prices were very reasonable, and I was pleasantly surprised that the posted prices INCLUDED the sales tax!  And the portion is spot on.  Actually, I was pleasantly surprised that there was so much lamb inside!  C'mon let's face it... when you order lamb shawerma, you wanna taste the LAMB.  And this place delivers, in spades.  

Truly Med, you have a new fan, and I can't wait to go back!  Fortunately, it's right near the 16th/Mission BART station, so it's convenient to get to, coming from the East Bay (or even walking up from work in downtown SF, then catch the BART home from there).

Now I can't wait to go back to have the falafel... and more of that AMAZING hummus!  Not too garlicky, and with bright citrus notes.  It was great on the shawerma, and it'll be great on falafel, salad, pita, fingers.... whatever is handy!  I'm usually a dyed-in-the-wool tzatziki fan (and always will be), but the tahini and hummus together were delicious.
author: Scott T.

description: Omg best place if  you love falafel. ... every time I'm in the area I stop by ... try the deluxe falafel is the best sooooo yummy
author: Nestor G.

description: Delicious! Falafel sandwich comes in a flat bread wrap, not a pita, so servings are HUGE. Tahini/tzatziki = amazing. Great service too - came in with a ton of confused family members and they were very accommodating of our general clusterfuckery.
author: Amrutha D.

description: Fresh, delicious, not expensive! We shared the Mediterranean sample plate. Loved our meal here, it was perfect on a hot day. We will be back!
author: Brandi Lei L.

description:
The Lamb Shawarma ($9.30) is on the 7x7 top 100 list, and after about 2 years, I've finally paid a visit. I've been spoiled by some amazing shawarma in my life, and was disappointed that the meat tasted dry, but I give props to them for the big Mediterranean flavors and the nice spicy sauce. Wish they didn't put so much onions in.

I personally think Zaytoon's chicken shawarma is more juicy and flavorful.
author: Jess C.

description: TM is a little sliver of a restaurant. It's definitely a grab and go place, considering there's only a few stools to sit at. Lamb shawarma wrap is my favorite, with a side of baklava. And the people are always nice.
author: Mardis B.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to go for a little Mediterranean food. It's a tiny little place with a counter and not much else, but truly a gem in the Mission.

I typically order the Mediterranean Combo Plate which comes with a Falafel, hummus, baba, tabouleh, cucumber salad, dolmas, feta cheese, seasoned onions, tahini sauce, and pita bread. I order this almost everytime I'm here, because I love it. 

I also like the Chicken Shawerma, but you have to be lucky enough to come on a Tuesday or Friday, because those are the only days they have chicken. 

What I love about this place is while we are hanging out at Killowatt watching the game, we pop over and get the plate to go. It's a perfect appetizer for a group of hungry Giants fans.
author: Rebekah T.

description: Hole in the wall shawarma/falafel place on 16th street. They have some bar stools that face a window inside and some cheap backyard tables outside. The lamb shawarma costs $9.30 exactly and takes about 5-7 minutes to make. It definitely hit the spot but I do think $9 for a sandwich is OD, also the workers use their hands on everything, no gloves.
author: Daanyaal K.

description: Solid food. Tiny location, friendly staff.
author: Mark W.

description: I've feasted on falafel wraps from all over the world. The best wraps are produced by street vendors in the Middle East, but you can get delicious falafel sandwiches all over Europe and of course in the United States. We both ordered the basic wrap, which proved to be a lot of chopped cucumber (like, a LOT of chopped cucumber) along with about four falafel balls. Inedible. We ended up throwing them out.
author: Tyffanee S.

description: Ordered food for delivery on a busy day. Food arrived as expected with no problems at all. Some of the best Mediterranean I've had in San Francisco - the shawarma is excellent. They have a small menu, but that probably means fresher ingredients overall.
author: Anna M.

description: This small perfect restaurant deserve more than that wow this is the best shawarma in town fresh made and real meat . Made local ...I just advice everyone to try tanks for the best service ( diverse people ) :) see you next time soon thanks a lot
author: Rahim B.

description: This place used to be much better. I remember coming here 5+ years ago and it would always hit the spot. Plus the chicken shawerma only seems to be offered twice a week now. I'm not sure what happened but I probably won't be coming back.
author: Mahmoud A.

description: They cater us for lunch and I have to say - this place is the best.  The meats are fresh and so flavorful.  The falafel is AMAZING and the taboule is definitely a party in your mouth.  They are so reliable and communication with them is so easy and fast.  We always look forward to the food when they cater our office.  Not trying this place is a disservice to yourself.  GO and get in a car - and head on over to this place.
author: Erika S.

description:
Fantastic falafel balls and sandwiches makes this a place vegetarians must visit. 

For us omnivores, check out the lamb shawarma roll and the kafta kabob will knock your socks off.
author: Anand A.

description: I like their chicken wrap. I go to cafe every friday for chicken wrap. I strongly advise to taste it.
author: Biloliddin B.

description: Hand down the best falafel and lamb schwerma in the city! Ingredients are fresh and since it's a busy place the food is always fresh. It's a small place which adds to the cozy and friendly vibe of the restaurant. It's great to grab a quick and yummy bite that will leave you full and satisfied before or after bar hopping in the Mission.
author: Christine H.

description: The lamb shawarma was amazing. It was a very big and filling. The falafel is also very flavorful. Highly recommend going to this place to get your Mediterranean fix!
author: Omar Q.

description:
We ordered the lamb shawarma and falafel deluxe, both with the 'hot' sauce option. My girlfriend isn't a huge fan of 'hot' food, but she felt this sauce gave both a very subtle, but nice, level of heat, so don't be scared off by it. The falafel sandwich was rich and nutty with sesame aspects. They also use fava beans in their falafel, in addition to chickpeas, which added more complexity. The 'deluxe' falafel has eggplant and potatoes added, which makes it very rich and filling. The lamb was very good, too with nice seasoning and not too fatty. 

All in all, we we're very happy and it was reasonably priced. Very much of a takeout place. Only complaint was they didn't have pickled hot peppers, which I felt was missing as a foil to the richness of both sandwiches.
author: Daniel S.

description:
Been eating here for 17 years.  Love it!

My go to is the lamb/beef sherwamaa with feta/hot sauce and nooooo onions.

Try it!
author: Vincent C.

description: Ridiculously insanely delicious wraps.I have no other words to express how mental the lamb shawarma is.End of story.
author: Roshomon P.

description:
The best lamb shawerma for it's value. It's humongous! You can split one with two people and still both be satisfyingly full. Ask for extra hot sauce. The hot sauce goes so well with the shawerma. You just want to smother it all over and take a fat bite of that mediterranean burrito. My mouth is watering just writing about this right now. 

7x7 big eats 2011 contender, and well deserved. Haven't found one like this in south bay yet.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Super small place, they only have a counter with a few seats so probably best if you got you food togo and ate it while you walk around the mission, which is exactly what I did and it was pleasant. 

The food was good but not extra spectacular, I would come back again and try something else. I added a star because they were really friendly and helped me re wrap my food because I opened it wrong. WHOOPS
author: Khanh L.

description: These guys have falafel and shawerma science down. Best on the planet. If you like hot sauce you will be in heaven if not you will be in hell. You can still appreciate the place without the hot sauce but not as much. Just go for it. Food at its finest.
author: H K.

description: They don't skimp on ingredients. It's all good. Ordered the classic combo and ground lamb plate. Baklava Is the best I've had in a while. I hope they don't go downhill when they get too popular or a son/daughter inherits the place and cuts corners. But for now, it beats le met.
author: Michael L.

description: Truly Mediocre. I had the lamb shawarma and walked away wondering why the reviews are so high. I have been blown away by many of the amazing cuisines this city has to offer; however, it seems good mediterranean options are lacking. 3 stars instead of 2 because the staff was friendly and the food was fast.
author: Mike W.

description: I am writing this review only to counter all the pretentious little groupon users and people demanding a bathroom from what is clearly a take out establishment that happens to have a couple tables. Its like blaming a restaurant for parking difficulty in the city. Can you say mo-ron? A bad groupon deal could sink a business that was close to the margins. Shame SF is so expensive that the millennials can only survive on groupon deals, but it does not stop them from acting like they own the city and demand ViP treatment. The staff/owner has always been friendly to me and the shawarma is solid here.
author: Jim J.

description: Truly Mediterranean is a slice of heaven here in San Francisco! As an Arab I'm extremely picky about my Mediterranean food and this place holds up to all my ridiculous high standards. My favorite is the falafel sandwich with extra pickles on the side. There is an art to perfecting falafel which the chefs have managed to master. A must try!
author: Samia B.

description:
Eh, im getting tired of seeing "A+++ excellent so daymm great" reviews for everything in san francisco. Especially in the ethnic cuisine category.

Well, this place was actually decent. Walked in on a Friday and got a chicken shawarma. Wasn't anywhere near authentic (I've wolfed down many a shawarma in the middle east) , but cooked well and packed a punch due to the spicy sauce. 

Still looking for that place that knows what real Lebanese food tastes like...
author: Vin A.

description: So Happy, the falafel is just as wonderful as I remember. Haven't been here in years, because of parking & traffic issues. However I will be back soon with a driver. Great service, fast and easy. Also got a Mediterranean combo plate for dinner, it looks so yummy.
author: Tracy L.

description:
If you love Mediterranean Food, and I mean a real deal, authentic, home cooked Mediterranean food, then this is a place you should definitely check out. 
They have one of the best falafels I have ever tasted IN MY LIFE. Crispy and golden brown on the outside, nice and tender in the inside. Full of flavor, not bland like I had in some other places. You can tell they cook with love and really do a great job. I have been raving about this place to all  my friends and family. Whenever I hear someone mention anything about falafel or hummus or anything of this sort, I butt in-Hey, have you heard of Truly Mediterranean? Their food is Da Bomb!!!!
Seriously, This review was long overdue. Thank you for your amazing food. I wish other business owners could learn from you.
Business owners are very very very very very very very nice people. 
Go and give this place a try, you will not be disappointed!!
author: jamila u.

description: These guysare always so nice! And the food is so delicious! I recommend the lamb Swarma and the falafel deluxe. Also the carrot juice is really sweet.
author: Gene L.

description:
LAMB SHWARMA WITH EXTRA HOTSAUCE!!!

Fallafels are too legit as well.

I crave Truly Mediterraneon 24/7.... i had it twice last Saturday.
author: Anne-Mary P.

description: I always forget to mention something about this store: they the best Mediterranean middle eastern food in all over San Francisco and maybe the Bay Area... I like their lamb shawarma... Simply it's the best...
author: Tarek M.

description: Came here a lot when I lived in the city years ago (they used to be on Haigt). After moving to LA, whenever I'm in town j stop by. My wife evens comes here and grabs a couple schwarmas to go and bring back on the plane. 100% worth it. Falafel is great but the lamb is to die for. They don't have it every day, so call to check (I think they have it every day but Tuesday and Friday).  I've yet to find a place in LA that can come close. Simply wrapping the schwarmas in a lavosh is brilliant!  Like a burrito.  Absolutely fantastic. Don't trust a review that says otherwise.
author: Jim S.

description:
I've only gotten the lamb shawarma, and my girlfriend orders the super falafel. We both agree that this is going to be one of our go to spots for eats. The guys behind the counter are super friendly, and they make it to order right in front of you.

I just can't harp enough on how satisfied I am after I eat here. I'm a creature of habit sometimes, and its an amazing sense of consistent excellence that allows me to order the same lamb shawarma with an orangina and be fully prepared for the same quality food every time. Not only that, the whole process is called to order with a smile and "what can I get you?".

Please do visit this place, and if you order go ahead and try not to bump the folks sitting at the counter. Keep it live, Truly Med.
author: Justin L.

description: Pretty solid falafel wrap. The deluxe one is particularly filling, as they pad it with potatoes and eggplant on top of the usual. Spicy sauce is not so spicy. On a whim I gave their 'garlic mint yogurt' drink a try. It's...unique...ok who am I kidding, that is a pretty brave combination to be masquerading as a mere "drink". This savory thing is garlicky no doubt, but the mint is noticeably there as well. Would I get it again? Probably not, but if you instead imagine it as a sauce to go with your meal, it actually goes pretty darned well with the falafel. Just make sure you have some in your mouth already when you take a swig. (And make sure you're not on a date. :)
author: Linus W.

description: My wife, kids (ages 19, 15, 15), and me love their falafels and schwarmas. Never a disappointment. Parking can be a hassle, but worth it.
author: Tomas A.

description: Excellent chicken shawarma,excellent lamb. Just try anything and everything on the menu.
author: Ionut G.

description:
best falafel in town. Green inside like they should be, moist and delicious!!
nice cite seating out front with bar like seats inside. great if you can get a chair but not so good if you have a big group. hummus was yummy with fresh or of oil on top
author: K R.

description: Great food and happy service. When I got my lentil soup, they added lemon juice which was an amazing touch. I told them I was so impressed, I'd write this review in gratitude. Great sherwamas and lentil soup!
author: Justin A.

description: LoVE!!!  This place is now on my top list for chicken shawarma wraps. Their falafel is amazing as well. Great spot for an quick bite or take out. Everyone that works there is supper nice and they seem to know everyone that walks in. Neighborhood gem fer sure ;)
author: Christie S.

description: Such amazing food! Very original and affordable! The owner and staff are all very friendly and welcoming and I love coming back here!
author: S M.

description: Best Mediterranean in the city! I've tried falafel many times and never understood what people liked about it. After having some here, I'm in love! They fry it fresh on the spot and it is absolutely DELICIOUS. The wraps and hummus are also good.
author: Jake H.

description: My friend told me I HAD to stop here when I got in the city and so I did, first stop actually and it was meh. I know this place gets amazing reviews but I expected better. I had the lamb shawarma and don't get me wrong it was good but not mind blown, however, I did get one falafel ball to try and that was amazing, it tasted like it was homemade by my parents. When I'm in the city again, id give them another chance and try the falafel.
author: Margo D.

description: I had the Falafel and the combo sampler plate. Neither was that good. Hummus was bland, falafel was actually somewhat bitter in a few bites. I got a groupon but they wouldn't accept it although I had just purchased it that day. I would not come back here even with a groupon.
author: Dayton J.

description:
#97 on the 2011 7x7 List: Lamb Shawarma
#89 on the 2009 7x7 List: Lamb Shawarma

-Tasty?  Heck yeah - i should say "hella tasty" since i'm up here.  The toasted wrap with all that juicy lamb and delicious sauce inside - makes this the best lunch/$8 spent all week especially for stuff on this list.

-Service:  the guy toasting the shawarma is proactive and nice.   He saw that J and I were going to share the shawarma so he took our rolled-up lunch back, halved it, and re-packaged it in a portable way with foil so that we could hold it easily and walk/eat if we wanted to.  

-Ambiance:  Hole-in-a-wall.  It's mostly a take-out place.  There's counter space if you want to eat in, but it'll fit a maximum of 3 people sitting and one person standing

-Worth the trip/try?  Yes.  One tasty lamb shawarma for lunch and you're happily set for the rest of the afternoon!
author: Winnie L.

description: Most authentic shawerma I've ever had. Always delicious and service awesome. Hummus and tabouleh salad are a must.
author: S R.

description: A huge thank you to Truly Med for making our staff party a major success.  Tarin took my order and was super helpful and friendly.  And the food!  I'm new to SF from NYC,  but I've traveled extensively throughout the Middle East and can tell you that Truly Med's food is superb.  Everything was fresh and delicious and the platters were beautifully put together.  Falafel?  Crisply on the outside, crumbly on the inside, not greasy at all- perfection!  Stuffed grape leaves- perfection!  Thank you, guys.
author: Justine D.

description:
Portions are huge and the meat in the shawarmas is really tasty and authentic. 
Best Mediterranean place in the Mission.
author: Brooke F.

description:
Always satisfies the craving and super consistent.
Never mind blowing, but always good enough...
author: Crumbs C.

description: Its small place and super fast :) once you enter the place, nice friendly chief welcome you and get your order, by the time you are making your payment they prepare your food right away. It's pretty clean and super friendly service. Highly re commend to any one.
author: bahri d.

description:
I know this is a mission staple....and I have nothing bad to say, it's clear they have a following.  Prices are very fair, I think I paid $2.50 for 6 falafels.  

My only warning is, the felafels are SPICY.  It took me off guard actually.  I would have enjoyed it a lot more if it didn't pack so much heat.  Perhaps the person that made it was heavy handed with the hot spices that day because I've never had a falafels quite like that.  Just in case, buy a bottle of water.

PS I just noticed the owner write me a little note, I appreciate that and feel that his sincerity and suggestion earns another star, and you bet I'll be back!

Thank you.
author: Zin M.

description: We've been going there for Shawerma for years and lately their quality and portions has been going downhill. Saw a Groupon deal and decided to give them another chance since we haven't gone in a while. To our surprise, they stopped honoring the groupons well before their expiration date. They wouldn't even take it at face value, the amount that we actually paid!!! Needless to say, we will not be patronizing a business that is conducted in such a dishonest manner.
author: Andy C.

description:
Disclaimer: i got drunk after visiting here, so details are a little foggy and it is going on 2 weeks since i went.

So after a couple of drinks at Elixir, we decide to stumble down 16th. We can't really figure out what to eat and someone says "Doner" (they probably said something else and all I heard was Doner) and then my interest is peaked. I bust out the phone and risk running down the remaining 2% of battery I have to navigate us to some shawarmas. Lucky for us, we were 70 feet away from Truly Med. 

The ladies got the falafel wraps, Seb got the chicken wrap and I the lamb. The three of them said it tasted delish but that their food was dripping all over the place. I don't personally see a problem with this. In fact I think it is the way drunk food should be. My lamb shawarma was drippy too but I know how to eat and not make a mess and growing up, burritos were my favorite food item. So I know to not unwrap the bottom because then all the juice spills on your pants. (truly unprofessional)

The lamb was so good, I wanted to take it into the alley. 

I also ordered a side of hummus and pita bread. the table thought the hummus was perfect. it had the right amount of garlic. i'm sure it was not made in house but still credit for picking a good brand instead of something that helps your profit margin. 

I'm sorry for my friends in the Bay Area and my gf because whenever I got up there and hang in the Mission, we're going to have to eat Doners from Truly Med. every single meal.
author: Alex F.

description: So, whenever I had a jones for a falafel, I'd wander in here take a look the menu and realize that everything was way over-priced and walk across the street for a burrito. I bought a Groupon to give them a try at a price that's reasonable. They refuse to honor Groupons that they issued just a few months ago. You make a deal with Groupon, sell it to hundreds of customers who take the time to make a purchase and come into your establishment and then are turned away? Truly Deceptive. YOU made the deal, YOU chose how many Groupons to issue and at which price, YOU need to honor these when customers come in with their purchased vouchers. Who the heck to you think you are, and why on earth would we ever come back to support your business!?
author: Teo C.

description:
Bought a Groupon and tried to use it today. The location has a sign that says they no longer accept Groupons even though it had not expired.  Truly Mediterranean staff say they no longer have a deal with Groupon.  So if you bought one of their Groupons, you are basically out of luck and on your own to get a refund.  Truly terrible customer service.

Update: Groupon confirmed they did not cancel the deal.
author: Susan C.

description: Haven't been by in quite a few years, until today. Good to see that my favorite felafel place is still on top of their game. Ordered a basic felafel and a few dolmas on the side. Delicious.
author: K. C.

description: Ordered their large party platter for our party and the entire experience was great.  From ordering the food with Omar to the quality of food, reliability even with a short notice, and of course their pleasant service.
author: Shima N.

description: True to the name. Mashallah the tahini is ridiculous I had the lamb shawerma and it was too good tastes just like what one used to getting from back home and even better than some of those places. Still need to try the chicken shawerma (Tuesday/fri only) but I'm sure it'll impress just the same. Fresh, well worth the price, good sized sandwhich, I will definitely be back again
author: Naji S.

description: Love their service. Have always gotten pick up from here and they've always been on point and haven't disappointed in food.
author: Wildeflower M.

description: Very tasty!  Best mediterranean food in SF, IMOHO - the falafels are craveable!!!
author: Amanda H.

description:
I got delivery by grubhub.Took about 
20 mins.The only compliant I have is
I did'nt receive a receipt.I have'nt
eating here in few years.So I was'nt
sure what to expect.

I placed my order online.I ordered
the SHAWERMA(lamb & beef),CHICKEN
SHAWERMA and FALAFEL REGULAR.

After I place my order.About 2mins.
later I received a call from the
restaurant,informing me that they do 
not serve the SHAWERMA on friday.I 
forgot about that.(Thank you for the
call!) So I replaced it with a LAMB
KABAB.

Everytying arrived nice and warm.
1 star for getting my order right.
1 star for warm food.The prices have
went up sense the last time I've been
here.But that's everywere in S.F.

The food smelled great.I have to say 
this place still hold's up.I love the
tahini sauce,seasoned onions and the
cool crunch of the cucumbers.The chicken
was tender and juicy.

I'm a meat and potatoes man.So this is
the first TIME I've had the FALAFEL WRAP.And
and I have to say it was pretty damn good!
The falafels were delicious!(will order this 
again).

The LAMB KABAB was good to(but I wish they 
would sell the SHAWERMA on friday.that would 
be my only compliant)2 nice tender sausage
KABABS.

I would say the prices are o.k.The wraps are
about 8ins long and about 3ins thick.They
are big wraps, so you get your money's worth.

I split all 3 wraps with a friend and she also
thought they were pretty good.Good job TRULY
MEDITERRANEAN.Next time I have to get my SHAWERMA on!

First time I've giving a 4.5 review.Nice,Fresh,
clean,Yummy food.
author: John S.

description:
Seriously, Truly Mediterranean has the best falafel ever. Just as good as home made. Get some falafel on the side (they'll put some yogurt sauce on it that's fab as well) no matter what you're ordering. I could just eat a tray of their falafel.

Unfortunately they were not serving lamb shawerma on Tuesday so had to settle for the chicken. Bad idea to eat this after the falafel. The chicken was dry and bland and the shawerma just tasted like, onion, tomato and sauce. Very disappointing after the heavenly falafel.
author: Jean K.

description: The Food is the Best..Always fresh. The lamb shawarma is by far my favorite. Second favorite is the Falafel Deluxe. The staff is friendly and they are very fast. My only wish is that there was more seating but don't let that stop you from giving them a try. You can always take-out..
author: Jay B.

description: I shared a falafel sandwich with my girlfriend and we both agree, BEST ARABIC FOOD IN SAN FRANCISCO!! Seriously amazing. I also had the tabooli which was perfectly dressed and very finely chopped. Highly recommended!!
author: Rhonda E.

description: The best falafel I have ever eaten, and this includes Israel, Jordan, Egypt and Turkey. Very reasonable prices, fresh baklava, great friendly service. A true local gem. Nothing fancy - just great home-like comfort mid eastern food that won't make a hole in your pocket.
author: Arkady I.

description:
This hole in the wall has been handing out my A-rab chicken fix for years. Great flavors, funny and efficient service, good quality ingredients; all at a very reasonable price.
Big portions too!
author: Josh K.

description:
The best fast food Mediterranean in SF.

However, I stated in my previous 5-star review that I love everything about Truly Med except their steadily increasing prices.  Well I just went back again last week to discover that their prices have once again increased and now a lamb kebab wrap costs $9.30, including tax (stupid economy).  Fortunately they have not sacrificed quality or quantity, but I feel I must subtract one star for price alone.  I feel like an old fart saying I still remember when this item used to cost $7.45, then $8.65, which was still reasonable.  I just have a difficult time forking over almost 10 bucks for a burrito.  Sorry Truly Med, I've been a faithful customer for 6 years and will return for your wonderful food and service, but not as frequently as before.
author: Beatrice W.

description: Really solid fresh Mediterranean. Love that they toast the lavash bread for the shwaerma.
author: Ted H.

description: Great shawarmas!
author: Peter K.

description: Ordered a spicy lamb schawerma. It was decently spicy, perfect amount of heat for me actually. The lamb was very flavorful. All in all, my meal was very satisfying. The price is a little high for what you get but not ridiculously high. It was $10 for my meal. The employees are very kind as well, so overall great experience!
author: Alisa A.

description:
The best falafel wrap I've had. I'm definitely glad I decided on this place rather than a burrito place.

Great wrap, great price, fantastic people. Definitely coming here again when I'm in the city.
author: June K.

description: This my goto place for lamb or chicken schwarmas - they only have one or the other on a given day. Get spicy to add some flavor, but the meat and onion combination is great. Falafel is served wrapped in lavash, similarly to the schwarmas, and satisfies my vegetarian spouse. This place is really just take out. For under ten bucks, you get a whole, satisfying meal. Been going there since the 90s and have always been satisfied.
author: Michael R.

description: I got the chicken shwarma wrap. It was overwhelmingly bland. Not disgusting, but just flavorless. I did like that the wrap was grilled, so there was some toasty crunch to the wrap. But the filling was so blah. The actual wrap was pretty big, but I couldn't even finish half because it felt like I was eating flavorless chicken.
author: Rose S.

description: Was in the area and craving Mediterranean, glad I ended up here! The staff were....not the nicest. But the food was AMAZING! Seriously, the best falafel's I've ever had!
