author: Amanda C.

description: My boyfriend and I don't really crave Mediterranean food, so when he mentioned that he wanted a lamb shawarma, I knew his craving was real. As I was driving, he mentioned Truly Mediterranean and I knew I had to go since I've heard so many good things about it from fellow Yelpers! Parking can be difficult since it's near the Mission, so plan ahead if you're driving like we were. Fortunately, since it was just after lunch hours, we were able to snag a spot around the block. We walked in and both commented to each other about how amazing the place smelled and how small it was (less than 10 chairs) and waited behind 2 people. After the 2 people got their orders, we ordered a chicken shawarma and my boyfriend got the chicken kebab, which the friendly employee mentioned that it was going to take about 10-15 minutes. Honestly, it felt like 30 minutes and kept thinking that orders on the grill we ours, but were disappointed to see that they weren't. When we finally sunk our teeth in the chicken shawarma, I was amazed at how delicious the flavorful meat was combined with all the vegetables and tahini. I literally told my boyfriend that it was the best shawarma I've ever had! It was also my first time trying a falafel and it did not disappoint! I'll be back
author: Joyce E.

description: This is my to-go place for my falafel fix. I love their falafels! Their made fresh to order and when they put them in their lavish bread to make a wrap, it's a party in my mouth. Their chicken wraps and their vegetarian plates are really good too. The owner is a sweetheart!
author: Laura T.

description:
A small hole in the wall with a couple of bar stools.

I wanted to try their chicken shawarma, but it was only available on Tues and Fri. So then I decided to order a spicy falafel regular. The wrap was a pretty good size with just enough ingredients and tahini sauce so that I wouldn't make a mess on my pants. 

Definitely would go back next time to try the shawarmas.
author: Kevin C.

description:
I love the lamb shawarma wrap and the chicken wrap is also pretty good. It's mostly meat so I don't feel ripped off. The tomatoes and onions accompany the lamb well. You get some onions in almost every bite. Not much seating (both indoors and out) but I eat this wrap like a slob so I can't be in public anyways. I usually get to-go orders and add half dozen falafel that I don't finish and instead save for later. The falafel here is probably my favorite among all the mediterranean spots around mission.

Old Jerusalem is still a great spot for mediterranean food and is absolutely worth checking out, but the lamb wrap here is such a beast in terms of the amount of meat. Just make sure you warm up your jaw before digging in.
author: Henry T.

description: The baba ganoush and lamb shwerma are really good ---- but where this restaurant shines is the falafel.  It's always fresh, crunchy and tasty.   I suspect that one would have to go to the Middle East to get comparable falafel.
author: Dan C.

description:
I recommend sharing.

I stopped by this little place for lunch and me and my friend should've shared, but because we were starved we decided to get our own even though i ate less than half of this thing. 

I got the Chicken shawerma since they didn't have lamb that day. They are very generous with the portions here. It looked like a torpedo. I added feta to it and hot sauce. so GOOD! I want more!
author: Phuong K.

description: A mission favorite. The combo platter blew away my expectations, I highly recommend it. Friends raved about the wraps as well. Added bonus: one of the only places I have seen that received a score of 100 from the health inspectors
author: Blake W.

description: Are you posters for real???  We tried this place due to the high amount of good reviews and wow what a total waste of time driving over there.  Unless you've never ventured out of the neighborhood and experienced other mediterranean places, this is barely edible.  Honestly, this is not even close to being good and the price of the combo plate which some people took pictures you can see there is limited value there.  This place is more like after the bars let out and you need something to fill the stomach.  Sorry......
author: Cdub S.

description: Rude, absolutely rude.  I literally stood at the counter with no less than 4 employees working behind the counter and not one of them even greeted me, made eye contact, acknowledged my existence or welcomed me in the slightest way into the restaurant.  I have ate here 5+ times and never had a problem with their average food.  After this experience I will never go back.  There are several other Mediterranean restaurants in the neighborhood that will appreciate me and my business.  Unreal.  I grew up working in a gas station.  I worked in the service industry for 15+ years myself and not once have I treated a customer this way.  Again, UNREAL!
author: Michael M.

description:
Ordered a deluxe falafel to go.  No potatoes, please!

Would you like hummus instead?

Why, yes, thank you.....

Delicious!

And the pistachio baklava was excellent.......
author: Foodlover B.

description: I had it for the first time earlier today, by far the best falafel I've had in California. It's fresh, crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside like it should be. The tahini & hot sauce were amazing. It's one of the places I would have specifically drove to if I was in the Middle East. Can't wait to be back again tomorrow for a Sunday breakfast to try more of their items.
author: Evelyn Z.

description:
I love a good falafel wrap. Also love good, friendy service. Truly Mediterranean has both.

When I was there, I went for the gold and got the falafel deluxe. Like falafel wraps with similar names, this one came with eggplant and potatoes stuff into the wrapped (along with the normal trimmings.) While it's not the best falafel I've had in San Francisco (that award still goes to Sunrise), I did find that the falafel deluxe at Truly is extremely hearty. I usually can eat a wrap no problem, but I actually had to save the last quarter portion for later.

There's not a ton of room to eat here, but if it wasn't a chilly night, I probably would have preferred to eat outside somewhere anyway.

Get hot sauce.
author: Jon T.

description: Omg so excellent!!!! The lamb is to die for. Went over here on a break from prenatal yoga training for lunch. Mmmmm!!!! Definitely recommended.
author: Bailey m.

description:
A friend recently posted an article from "The Atlantic" on my facebook wall that outlined the history of yelp. Apparently the first review ever was of this very place posted back in 2004. I had wanted to go to this place for awhile to try the Dolma Wrap but this little piece of Yelp history increased my interest even more. 

The dolma wrap is constructed from grape leaves crushed onto a lavash and added salad. It's super tasty and well priced. Truly Mediterranean holdin' down the fort with tasty food for Yelpers since the start.
author: Stephen S.

description:
A little pricey for a fast food joint.  A dive of a small hole in the wall, but I don't know if you can find a fresher and tastier falafel or shawarma in town.  Excellent if you are on the go, and are looking for fast, tasty and authentic.

Double on the spicy sauce on the falafel...way to go.
author: Joe S.

description: Chicken Shawarma was absolutely delicious, but I thought the size was not right. It was too skinny and I was left still hungry.
author: Lisa T.

description: My neighborhood go-to spot for shawerma fix.  I have yet to discover a better tasting (imo) lamb shawerma in the city.  This place is tiny with several elevated stools along a small counter and a couple of tables outside.  Definitely not for groups or long conversations; more like...order to-go and take it to a dive bar and enjoy...
author: Leland H.

description:
I thought I knew the meaning of hole in the wall, then I went to this place--where the phrase is very literal. You can barely fit a line in there (it's better for take out--though we sat outside). But omg, so worth it--I've only had Greek a few times, so I got their little falafel combo box, with tabouli and many other fine things in it. Can you say fresh in my mouth?! I liked taking the tabouli and cucumber and some of the little spicy red sauce and making a pita wrap out of it. Worked! Also: props for having Virgil's Root Beer in there (the only root beer worth drinking, imho).

We walked down here from the Castro, but it's more a Mission joint. Much more a lunch than dinner place. Definitely worth a check--next time I will probably get a schwarma (what they're mainly known for), or some more of that yummy falafel!
author: Andy L.

description: Realllly good falafel wrap. Inexpensive, quick, spicy if you want it, and good salads + toppings. Highly recommend if you're looking for quick bite.
author: Sarah B.

description: Best shawarma in town, the lamb always tastes just right. I love that they can add fried potatoes and eggplants into any wrap. The falafel deluxe is just as good. Made with the crispest yet softest falafel. I continue to come here for the food obviously but the staff just warms my heart. They are so so so friendly. They always give complimentary falafel to patrons that are waiting if the wait seems longer than usual. The owner and his son, the cooks and the nicest African lady that rings me up sometimes. Everyone looks genuinely happy to work there and that is refreshing. Always consistent, never fails.
author: Tibyan H.

description: The chicken plate is so good, you get a big portion of meat/rice/hummus and your choice of tabouleh or a cucumber and tomato salad. The guys who work here are super nice, they gave me a free falafel while I waited for my chicken to cook
author: AV P.

description: My husband was craving a falafel sandwich, and we came across this place. Being from the Middle East I can say that their falafel was on point. From the tahini sauce they put to the bread, I would say that it is almost as good as eating it overseas. We got our sandwiches in less than 10 mins, and really no complaints. The sandwich was reasonably priced.
author: Hanan Q.

description:
These wraps are incredible - so incredible that when I first had them 2 years ago, I've never been satisfied with any other Mediterranean food since. The chicken and lamb kebab wraps are both tasty, nice big chunks of meat in their wonderfully spicy sauce and crunchy cucumbers. Only ask for onions if you can handle it - they put a LOT in - and to top it all off, they grill the lavash to ensure a hot, solid wrap to contain the juicy deliciousness in. All items are made to order, so expect a bit of a wait.

But I'm giving them 4 stars, and here's why: when I came 2 years ago Truly Med was somewhere around $8 for a wrap. It's a big wrap, so I figured $8 was decent. However, they're now (as of June 2011) up to $9.30 for a wrap! At that price I can be getting something better than street food. I know the restaurant's gotta survive but I do too! I'd consider going to Truly Med only as a rewarding splurge nowadays rather than going to them for a busy-night dinner. If they up their prices any further, I may no longer want to return at all...let's hope that day never comes :(
author: Clarice W.

description: Worst delivery experience ever. DO NOT USE GRUB HUB TO ORDER FROM HERE!!!!  Why the hell would it take 4 hours? I have no idea what the food tastes like. What a fucking joke.
author: B R.

description: Nomz amazing food. Don't come during pride. The lamb shawarma is phenomenal. Everything here is delicious. Highly recommended
author: Travis M.

description: We eat here once a week! Truly amazing and delicious. They are fast and super friendly bunch!
author: Lookass V.

description:
Mediterranean/Middle Eastern/Greek food is in my top 5 most favorite eats (but you guys probably already knew that.) Please excuse my ignorant, non-PC ass; I lump these cuisines together cuz I don't know no bettah. 

Confession time: I do not dine out alone. Ever. It's part insecurity, part discomfort (brought on by said insecurity), so I took my edibles to-go instead of taking up one of their five counter seats. 

TM's chicken kabab wrap is humongous. I ate it for lunch as soon as I got home that afternoon, as a snack after I finished my errands for the day (mainly packing for my Paris trip), and the remainder as a late dinner. I have to say--the lavash held up nicely & didn't get super soggy as the day wore on. 

The spicy sauce worked deliciously well with the rest of the filling. Loved how the heat is slowly extinguished by the corresponding cooling taste of tahini & cucumbers. 

4.5 stars for a yummy, under $10 lunch (which lasted til dinner.)
author: Fancypants X.

description: Delicious, spicy, fast and friendly. The spicy sauce is truly spicy, the baklava is delightful, and don't forget that they only offer chicken OR lamb on any given day (not both).
author: Sylvan C.

description: I'm not going to lie, I found about this place because of 7x7. I ordered the lamb shawarma as recommended. It's the size of a PBR tall boy, and is mostly meat with a few wedges of tomato. Pretty ridiculous. The lamb was tender and well seasoned. I wish I got extra hot sauce in it though. Completely worth the $10.
author: Huey N.

description:
Who knew this little place could be so divine?? OMG - the lamb/beef shawarma is to die for! So delish I went back 2x in a week! The meat was flavorful, fresh & soft - not dry or overdone in any way. The tomatoes were well seasoned. Hummus sauce added the perfect seasoning. I skipped the onions - can't smooch with stinky breath - lol! If you like it hot, they will also spread red spiciness onto the fresh lavosh bread. After wrapping the super burrito sized shawarma, it's placed on the grill before being handed over to you. Yeah it may be a couple bucks more than other joints but well worth it. Huge, hot & fresh. Not greasy & tough. 

Tip: this is a take away place with 6 stools at the counter & 2 small tables for 4 people outside. Uh, keep in mind SF is COOOLD - so if you plan to eat there be sure you're bundled up!
author: Kim S.

description: There's a reason this place gets such good reviews. The other afternoon I was in there to make an order. Three businessmen were in front of me, one of them obviously from SF, the other two obviously not. The one who lived here had taken these out-of-towners to this little hole-in-the-wall on 16th because he knew it was the best place to go for great gyros -- and he was right.
author: Edward K.

description:
Not an impressive culinary experience.  I had a falafel wrap with eggplant - ordered extra spicy.   The falafel tasted old and the lavash wrap was dry and flaky.  The eggplant was good and they delivered on the spice. 

Things to note: location is convenient.  It's walking distance from 16th street bart and on your way to Dolores Park. I would recommend this as a place where you take your food to go and eat somewhere else.  Inside, Truly Mediterranean has a couple stools along the wall opposite the counter where you order food.  But really, the place is tiny and unless you are also tiny, it's unlilkely you can comfortably sit on any of those stools.  There's also the option to eat outside; they have  two tables set up out front.  That's where we sat, but in retrospect, we shouldn't have.  We didn't stay more than 20 minutes and over that time period three different people came up to us asking for food or money - less than a peaceful dining experience. 

Maybe it was the fact that it was 7:30 pm on a Sunday night and that's why the food was less than tasty.  If I'm in the area and don't have time to explore any of the Mission's culinary havens, I guess...maybe...I would start to consider giving Truly Mediterranean a second try.
author: Kimya P.

description: Fearfully and wonderfully made. We had the Mediterranean Combo & Falafel deluxe. Quite yummy !
author: Hilda D.

description:
In my journey to try as many items on 7x7's "100 things to eat before you die", I am starting with the lesser expensive items. 

The Lamb Shawarma wrap is really as good as everyone makes it out to be.  It's made in a hole-in-the-wall and it even resembles a carne asada burrito but there's something about the sauce and the skin that really set it apart.  They grill the meat, then wrap it up, and grill the wrap to make it warm and crispy.  The meat is lean and flavorful.  They stuff some big tomato slices in it as well.

Spicy or non-spicy?  Your choice but it doesn't make that big of a difference.  The spicy tasted regular to me.

I suggest grabbing this to go and walking down the street to Dolores Park's "movie in the park" during a warm summer night.  Then treat yourself to some Bi-Rite afterwards and I've officially planned your date night.
author: Shannon L.

description: The lamb shawarma meat was overcooked and mushy the last time I was here.  This meat is actually not pure lamb, but a combination of lamb and beef - which is fine with me.  I guess its hard to predict demand as the meat cooks on the spit, so they cook it, slice it off as its ready, and cook it again on a flat grill.  Then its stored in an oven.  Just too much cooking!  The best lamb shawarma I've had was when its still crispy fresh off the spit, maybe grilled a bit.  Mush sucks!
author: Richard R.

description:
Just don't come on a Tuesday!

Playing tourist in my hometown is always fun and on a recent Mission ramble we arrived at Truly Mediterranean craving lamb shawarma.  Unfortunately Tuesday they have chicken shawarma instead.  Since I was in the mood for a little lamby, I tried the Kefta Kebab.  We were advised at the time of ordering that it would take 10 minutes so we split a falafel to hold us over.   Holy Falafel was that good.  Crispy outside and moist soft parsley filled inside.  The best falafel I have ever had!  And only 45 cents!  When the Kefta arrived it was worth the wait. The Kefta was gigantic, a spicy combo of lamb and beef sausage wrapped with tomato, cucumber and tahini sauce in a pita wrap.    More than enough to satisfy this hungry window shopper.  My only constructive criticism is the tahini sauce could have been a little saltier.

Now i just will have to come back on a non-Tuesday or Friday to get the lamb shawarma.
author: Nicole R.

description: I had read so many great things about Truly Mediterranean that it's sometimes tough to live up to the hype but they did a pretty good job.  The lamb shawarma is pretty good as it has good flavor although I have had better ones elsewhere in the city.
author: Blake B.

description: great food, great service. Had combo plate and lamb shawerma split between two people. We were full for the rest of the day. Food was delicious! Highly recommend. Got the deal through Groupon and was very satisfied.
author: Olga N.

description:
I usually am here for my Chicken Shawarma wraps, and this is one of the best in the area ! I have also had their Chicken Kebab rolls which are equally fantastic. Make sure you order it spicy (unless you're a spice-wimp) as their red spicy spread works magic on the rolls.

My personal preference is to throw in another 50c or a dollar for the extras of french-fries and roasted aubergines to be included in my wrap. The thick wrap with the warm succulent chicken, cold crunchy salad, mouth-watering hot spicy spread, the signature tahini spread, and the simple yet unmistakable flavors of the french fries and grilled eggplant work their own blend of magic on your taste-palate as they tug, tease, and grab your tastebuds, and yank them every which way none of which were displeasurable in the least bit!

I have also had the pleasure of digging into their fresh-off-the-wok falafel. The crunchy grainy texture of the outer layer smeared in the goodness of decadent hummus-and-extra-virgin-olive-oil, with the moist green fragrant body are sure to, I would wager, send you into raptures and do a small hop-skip-step-jump on the sidewalks of the mission; just make sure you don't make a fool of yourself. 

Scratch that --- you're in the mission, anything goes ! :-)
author: Umesh T.

description: I ordered the lamb shawerma and an extra ginger brew. The shawerma was good, but it wasn't great. The best part of it was the texture. I requested for my shawerma to be spicy, and it was quite bland. Also, my extra ginger brew wasn't that gingery. What was weird, is that it looked like the bottle was opened before, it it had a different label, because for some reason, my friends has the green bottles, and my bottle was brown, and it had the same labels, even though it didn't taste the same. Their bottles were very gingery and mine was not. Also, the label on my bottle was peeling off and you could see the glue that was overlapping. Ummm, gross and embarrassing because I was so thirsty, I didn't notice until the drink was practically finished. Not fun having your friends laugh at you while you drink the "generic, what could have been boot-leg" ginger beer.
author: Rosie M.

description: Been coming here for years. Tiny little place you can easily miss, but it has the best shawarmas in town. A little like the soup nazzi feel when you walk in, there is an air of indifference, but everyone is actually quite friendly and I'm sure they get their share of riff raff, being on 16th street. Lamb is my favorite, but they have chicken as well two days a week.  I can never remember what days are what, but not important cause they have awesome falafel wraps as a back up. Get extra hot sauce or grilled eggplant in your wrap. There are about 5 seats at a counter or take it Togo.
author: Matt A.

description:
A fellow Yelper recently reviewed this place with a glowing 5 star review. Being the falafel fiend that I am, I just had to try it out. After going outta my way for lunch while also trying to find parking, I thought to myself, this better be the best darn falafel wrap ever!

Unfortunately it wasn't. Not by a longshot. The falafel itself was actually quite good. A nice crunchy outside with a moist nuclear green inside. The hot sauce gets an honoable mention for having a nice flavor without overpowering the wrap. That's where the positive part ends. The lavash bread was way too dry. I like my wrap toasted but this was more day old than toasted. There wasn't enough hummus or tahini to make up for it. I ordered the "deluxe" which comes with potatoes & eggplant. This choice actually made it worse. The potatoes were dry and flavorless. Taco Bell makes better crispy potatoes. I saved the eggplant for last since it was the worst offender in the wrap. Slimy, slimy, slimy! The worst part was the taste. Difficult to describe but if I didn't pluck 'em out, we would be talking about a 1 star review here. If this is the first time somebody ate eggplant they would probably never eat it again. It was terrible!

Even being greeted warmly by the pretty cashier again wouldn't be enough to tempt me to return. There are just way too many great falafel places out there (including Zaytoon right down the street) to come back. My search for the perfect falafel wrap continues...
author: John B.

description: Best lamb shawarma available in the Bay Area. Can customize by requesting their spicy sauce, eggplant, or thickly cut French fries. Kefta kebab sandwich is also good- comes with a cucumber salad in the sandwich. Not a fan of the chicken shawarma, it's too bland for my liking. Will return for lamb shawarma though!
author: Zara A.

description: I'm eating a lamb Schwarma (ok I know I totally spelled that wrong and I'm too lazy to check it lol) right now with a small side of hummus with pita, which is a very good size for the price (around 4 bucks). Shawarma (roughly 8 bucks) is delicious with tender seasoned lamb, onions, spicy sauce/paste, and I'm guessing a yogurt sauce. They toast it and the pita up on the grill. The wrap could use cucumber but otherwise no complaints. First time here, next time I'll ask to add cucumbers :) awesome find, I definitely recommend it.
author: Courtney T.

description: This place has gone downhill fast.  The main issue here is cleanliness.  I ordered my ten dollar falafel and the man was handling food with a band aid on.  No gloves.  Absolutely disgusting.  Take note here.
author: Zach H.

description:
I had never eaten here until last weekend.  I'm not sure how long Truly Mediterranean has been where it is but it seems like a while and I feel like it's one of those place I could have chance entered a million times but I just never happened to.

...Just cause it's a falafel place... and falafel places are like burrito places you don't know already -- easy to pass by.

But they make the BEST FALAFEL, hands down, that I have ever eaten.  I like falafels fine enough but I don't dream about them - to me they're just quick filling up food.  But now I have new appreciation for this certain falafel.  It's full of the right things and good care and quality and before they hand you the chubby pocket package - they goddamn grill it too to make it crispy and extra delicious.
author: Dizzy L.

description: The lamb shwarma is one of the best things I have ever eaten in my life. Get it with hot sauce.
author: Dan N.

description:
Classless and crass workers. 

I used to love this place but I've heard the old owners sold it and I saw that the other night. The place was full as usual and I went in to pick up an order to go, about $80 worth of food. While I waited for my order I heard one of the guys working in the kitchen barking and saying "who brought the dog to work". After watching for some time (because I was waiting for my food) I realized they were rating women as they came in the door. If they didn't think you were attractive, they barked like a dog, if they liked you, they hooted and hollered. 

As far as the food goes the chicken shawarma was just ok, the meat was dry and that's hard to do with dark meat. The combo plate was good and they still have great hummus and hot sauce. Falafel tasted good but was neon green on the inside, almost like there was food coloring added but more likely too much parsley. Tasted good, but off putting. 

Because of the barking rating system, I'll started going somewhere else for shawarma instead of this place. Too bad.
author: M B.

description:
This place is a San Francisco gem.

I've lived in San Francisco for twenty five years, and I'm a middle eastern food junkie.  Its one of those diets I could live on.

That said, this is, THE, best felafel and shawerma(spelling?) in San Francisco!

I love little hole in the wall places with good, inexpensive food.  This place is a gem.  Its not as inexpensive as it was, but its still a terrific value for what you get.  One of their felafel or shawermas is a meal for a large, seriously hungry guy, or two meals for the average 5'4' woman.

Oh man is this good food.  I don't live anywhere nearby any longer.  But this place is like a pilgrimage for me now.  If I am anywhere in the vicinity of this place, I'll stop and get two to go.  Because I get in trouble if my girlfriend finds out I went there and I don't bring some for her.

If you want better felafel than this you need to go to L'as du Fallafel in the Marais in Paris.
author: Michael C.

description:
Hole in the wall near Pancho Villa

Overall - Good
Food - Good
Decor - Poor
Service - Fair
Value - Very Good

Chicken Schwarma decent, big

Hummus ok, fair pita bread

King of Falafel roughly the same quality.
author: Ellen H.

description: Amazing service but wish the chicken kabob / falafel wraps had more flavor and more sauce.
author: Sonya Z.

description: When friends and relatives from the Mediterranean and Middle East want comfort food, I take them here. They're always pleased. Service is fantastic every single time. There is some highly addictive and probably illicit substance in the tahini, and the tabouleh and falafels are super fresh.
author: Jess B.

description: Ok so it's not rocket science they hands down have the best HUMMUS I have ever eaten in my life. This place is why I eat garbanzo beans and eggplant. I usually buy a small thing of hummus and take it home to the babays who enjoy it also. The chicken kabob plate with the cucumbers....Can you say YUMMM! I try to budget this into a weekly lunch. Everyone should visit this tiny gem at least once in lifetime. Don't cheat yourself, treat yourself.
author: Jru N.

description:
#97 on the 7x7 Big Eat - Lamb Shawerma at Truly Mediterranean.  I went here on Monday night after an Allegash draft at Monk's Kettle down the street (subsequently knocking off # 50 - Obscure Belgian Beer at Monk's Kettle.)  Truly Med is an unassuming hole in the wall gyro and shawerma spot serving up some seriously good Mediterranean fare.  

While I was eager to try their falafel, I wanted to stick to the list and got with the lamb shawerma.  They serve this bad boy up with thin lamb slices cut right off the spit, soft broiled tomatoes, parsley, onions, and tahini all wrapped up in a Lavash.  I opted out of the onions (bleck!) and added hummus instead (I love hummus!!)  After they wrap everything up in the lavash, they put it on the grill and fire it up for you, leaving these perfect grill marks on the wrap.  

This was really good wrap.  I usually enjoy shawermas and gyros, and this place was no exception. Every bite was packed with flavor; I was in heaven.  The meat was tender and juicy.  Every bite I took oozed out hummus from the bottom.  The hot lavash played will with the cold tahini.  Fantastic!  And thing is huge!  I was so stuffed.  Next time I'm definitely going to try their falafel, and I also noticed they serve up chicken shawermas on Tuesday and Friday.  I'm hitting this place up for sure next time I'm in the mission... which will probably be like tomorrow!
author: Timothy C.

description:
I loved Truly Mediterranean! It was delicious. I had the special, the chicken shawarma, spicy of course. The meat was tender, delicious, and all the fixins were flavorful. It wasn't dry and every bite was heaven! They only have it on Tuesdays and Fridays, so be sure to go then.

I also tried some sides. The hummus and pita were so good... Just the right amount of garlic and spices. I'm a big hummus fan, and this was probably the best I've had. Also, the falafal was cooked to perfection. 

Overall, the whole meal was extremely satisfying and I will definitely go back. It's located in the heart of the mission so easy access from all forms of public transportation. Prices are reasonable, service is fast and friendly, plus, Walid (the owner) is the sweetest! Go check them out!
author: Jasmine S.

description: I've been coming to TM ever since I moved to SF in 1990. Consistently the best falafel on the west coast. (I was raised on taziki drenched, soggy pita sandwiches from the Fairfax district of west LA.). To have a real falafel wrapped in lavash...simply rocked my world.  I love the regular falafel with roasted tomatoes and baba with a little extra red onion!  So delish!
author: Eric S. R.

description:
I often go out of my way to get falafel here.  The staff are very friendly and the kitchen is open for the guests to see.  Watching them make falafel balls is fascinating.  Quick and artful.  The regular falafel is better for me than the deluxe which contains potatoes.  I like the flavor without the filling.  As all the food is made immediately before you, it's incredibly fresh.  Spicy sauce is not overwhelming, so quite recommended.  And they top it off with a yogurt sauce that dribbles goodness all the way down to the last bite.  

There is very little room to dine in the restaurant.  So I like to take it to Dolores Park instead.  

They have a garlic/mint yogurt drink that is peculiar on first try.  It's a savory drink, not sweet.  And if you try it, you will likely find it grows on you.  It must be good for the digestion or something. All my friends find it a bit strange when I make them try it.  But for me, being a huge garlic fan, I can't get enough.
author: Christopher A.

description: I'm by no means an expert on Mediterranean food, but the taste of everything was delicious. I got the Combo plate and the Lamb Shawerma and both were delicious. The Baba Ghannoush and the falafel were my favorites, but everything in the platter was great. I only wish there was more pita to go with the combo plate. I thought the shawerma was perfect. The wrap was crispy on the outside and everything on the inside was evenly distributed and melded together perfectly.
author: Stephen C.

description:
Rather than write a flowery, fluffy review, I'll get right to the point.
There does not exist a better falafel wrap anywhere else and I have searched far and wide. Get the Falafel Deluxe and pay the extra for them to add feta.
The staff is extremely customer friendly and accommodating.
author: Tod T.

description: Very disappointing....the lamb shawerma was flavorless and mushy..... the people were friendly.... but the food was just awful.
author: reed s.

description:
I have only tried the lamb schwarma and it is deeeeelicous. Lavash is thin and slightly crispy (perfection), and the fixings perfectly compliment the juicy meats.

Customer service is not horrible but needs some work. However, since I don't eat there, it's not really an issue for me.
author: Ruth T.

description:
I have no complaints, but really SF Yelpers? 4 stars?

The food was solid--the falafel was above average and the lamb shawerma was spicy and delicious--if a little overpriced ($9.75 for the lamb) given the no-frills atmosphere and extremely limited seating area (4 seats in, 2 small tables outside).   The best word I can think of to describe both the postcard-sized space and the service is efficient. 

If I'm hungry and in a hurry, I'd stop by again, but I wouldn't go out of my way.
author: Alex H.

description:
Bomb Falafel Wrap. 

Crispy, salty, and amazing.
author: Caroline D.

description: Yummmmm. The deluxe falafel is delicious. I esp love the fries that are stuffed in it. My only suggestion is more hot sauce!
author: Margaret R.

description:
This was a good place, but the prices are steep for just a shwarma. I tend to rate on the worth of the food, and I do not think 10 dollars for a lamb shwarma is worth it. The meat was tender and the bread was flaky. It was full body and big but the sauce was not great no real flavor it. What made this good for me was the cucumbers that I paid extra for and the tomatoes. But the price wasn't the thing that gave this place a 3 star for me, it was the service. The workers that were serving me were rude and sarcastic. Yes, I asked what was inside the shwarma, but shit dont give me lip for it.


overall: prolly won't come back.
food: big portions, meat was tender, bread was flaky, but lacked flavor.
price: kinda steep for a lamb shwarma.. 10.25
service: unhelpful and condescending
author: Reiko n.

description: Great, cheap, quick take out.  Love the lamb shawerma!
author: Rob S.

description: Holy shit that chicken shawarma is so damn good .  This wannabe burrito is the truth.  Give it a shot!  Staff will hook it up to your liking
author: Joe B.

description: The guy doesn't wear gloves nor does he wash his hands before he touches the food. Disgusting! He also puts containers of sauce inside the hummus and then argued that, if your food can go inside a To-go container, it's OK for the sauce containers to be inside the hummus. Are you kidding me? Why argue with someone who has no sense of cleanliness and not get it? The food is good, but cleanliness of the owner is awful
author: Niro K.

description: Great place. Friendly people. I go for the Lamb Shawerma and the Mediterranean combo plate.
author: Mark C.

description:
The lamb shawerma is quite good. Service is quick, place is small, and the food is good. What I liked most was that my shawerma didn't fall to pieces at the end of the meal. Normally you'll have quite a mess when those last 4 inches of the sandwich are left (sauce running everywhere, sandwich breaking apart, hands completely soaked, etc...). However, the structural integrity stayed together better than most which is always impressive to see.

This is right off of Mission/16th st so if you're in the area and looking for something to grab and go (and not make a huge mess) then hit it up :)
author: Nick E.

description:
Didn't have Lamb Shwarma available when I went so I grabbed a chicken one. The meat was juicy, well spiced, and hot but the rest of it was sub par. Wasn't grilled enough so the veggies and wrap were still cold. 

Asked for spicy but it wasn't very spicy at all. Might be a good thing for some of you though.
author: William K.

description:
Seriously the best hole in the wall. 

I've been here twice already and am seriously in love. They make the best shawermas I have ever had. They were pretty fast the first time, and since I know what I was getting the second time, I patiently waited the 10 minutes. You HAVE to add the hot sauce to these their food, it makes it that much better. Also, be careful: these cannot be eaten as burritos!!

YUMMMM
author: Ezequiel R.

description: My favorite takeaway Mediterranean in SF. Leaps and bounds tastier than Old Jerusalem. Nobody makes falafel like these guys.
author: daisy s.

description: Food was tasty and filling. The kid behind the register was nice but seemed to still be learning.  I found it a bit  expensive but thats just me. I paid $32 for two deluxe lamb shawarmas and two sodas.
author: Sylvia Z.

description: If we are craving Mediterranean food and want to eat at home or on the run, we prefer Truly Mediterranean. The place looks sketchy but the food is good quality and has great flavors. It doesn't have an extensive menu and they have nights where they only serve chicken OR lamb shawarma so it's best to give them a call if you are particular about that. The hummus is excellent as well.
author: Scott G.

description:
I have been eating here for 15 years!  I like everything on the menu, but I especially crave their chicken schwarma which is only available on Tuesdays and Fridays. (lamb schwarma the other days).
The prices are not totally cheap considering it is a take out joint, but the taste is stupendous and the portions leave me feeling full.  For people who have smaller stomachs, one of their schwarma or falafel deluxe wraps will equal two meals!
author: Karl B.

description: This is hands down one of the best Mediterranean spots in all of SF. The quality is fresh, tasty, and the portions are perfect for people like me - always hungry. Bonus props for carrying my favorite ginger beer brand as well!
author: Ron P.

description: The spicey falafel wrap deluxe with Tabouli is one of the best wraps around. So flavorful and filling. A frequent go to! The Employees here are also very kind.
author: Neil W.

description:
Cheap delicious huge chicken shawarma with a large fresh carrot juice = meal of champions. get the spicy sauce. its not that spicy
small little place. friendly helpful staff.
author: Monika K.

description: Their falafal balls are A-mazing! Very small to go spot but still worth every penny. Cute staff doesn't hurt either. I just can't tell you how TRULy Amazing the falafal balls made me feel :)
author: Candy F.

description:
I haven't lived in SF for over 10 years, but I still think about the lamb shawermas I've had here.   I go back as often as I'm in SF.  

I've been to many places in the middle east and around the Mediterranean, and I'd say this is the best lamb shawerma I've had in the entire world. 

Yes, they are that good.
author: Jason G.

description:
I happened to be in the neighborhood and hungry week before last. When I saw Truly Mediterranean's sign my stomach sent an urgent memo to my brain: Send down a gyro wrap, STAT! I ordered one to go, plus a pint of hummus. As soon as I got home I popped open the hummus and, at the first taste, I experienced a flashback: I know this hummus! I've eaten this hummus!

That's when I remembered that there used to be a Truly Mediterranean in North Beach a few years ago. It was a regular after-work stop where I would buy a tub each of hummus and babaganouj to devour over the next few days. The hummus was one of my all-time favorites, along with Baladie's. I loved its bright, tangy flavor and smooth texture, and was really bummed when that location closed.

Unfortunately, this location is a tad out of the way for me. Knowing that this magical hummus is so close and yet so far has been torturing me over the past week. I can't wait to get back over there to pick up a couple of pints for the road.

Damn it! Why don't they deliver?!
author: Valeria R.

description: I have to been to Truly Mediterranean before and would always get the combo plate but i thought of trying something else from them since it's MY BIRTHDAY today so I got the falafel deluxe and boy I was disappointed. The potatoes were cold and tasteless. The eggplants was tasteless too. The falafel balls were good. I like this place and will return but I won't be getting the falafel deluxe again. I guess I'll be sticking to their combo plate.
author: Shaan M.

description:
Had a falafel delux wrap here and it was very good! The service was friendly and I opted to just drink a cup of water rather than springing for a bottled water which I feel is filled with BPA palooza and not so good for the environment- the cashier didn't act like it was a hassle to dole some cups of water out to me.

One star off for the shaky table outside, small interior to eat if you eat in (we couldn't eat inside because it was so crowded). The tahini is a bit flavorless and the side container of it is crazy small. Also minus some love for not having a restroom when I had to pee like a race horse!

I would come back. Enjoy!
author: M M.

description:
Random Hole in the Wall spot found on yelp when I was looking up places for Mediterranean food. It's a very small restaurant with a walk-up counter to order. There is a small counter opposing from where you order but it only seats about 4 people.  There is also a small table outside that seats 2 so on a beautiful day, it would be nice to eat outside (those are rare in SF).

Fantastic place here found on 16th and Valencia.  I've seen the recommendation for the chicken shawerma but the first time I went, it wasn't a tuesday nor a friday so I ended up going with the lamb shawerma.  It was delicious, especially with the spicy sauce and the yogurt sauce with cucumbers and onions.

I did end up trying the chicken shawerma on a future visit as well as the lamb kabob and I found that the lamb wraps were more enjoyable.  I know much of the population doesn't like the gamey lamb taste but if you do like lamb, you should try out the lamb kabob and shawerma here.  Great mediterranean food. Highly recommend.
author: Keith N.

description: This place is fantastic. Had the feta sandwich and my wife had the deluxe felafel. Usually when you are served gigantic portions there is a loss of quality. Not here.  Gigantic and fantastic throughout. Service was fast and  friendly. In hearing to the Mission district and Truly Mediterranean any time I'm in San Francisco.
author: J S.

description: Canceled my Groupon voucher over a month before it expired. Will now never frequent this restaurant. They clearly don't want my business (I definitely visit restaurants multiple times if I like it and was introduced via Groupon).
author: Rachel F.

description:
Truly Mediterranean is a fantastic establishment - a gem, located in the heart of the Mission, and well worth any trip across town.

Their falafels are extraordinary, so far surpassing ordinary, that I find myself tongue-twisted, when I try to describe what objects of beauty they are. Crisp, chestnuty-burnt-russet-sienna outer spheres encompassing light, earthy-green treasures (sesame seeds, chickpeas, parsley, etc.) of "oh...wow," these perfect-sized nuggets are packed with natural, honest flavor. I love the way they smell and the way they sound a crunch, when I give them a gentle squeeze. A drizzle or dunk in tahini is an absolute must!

Lamb Shawerma - so much could go wrong, but they do it So Right. Spiced, moist, tangy, balanced: it's composed of tender, slow-roasted lamb and beef, broiled tomatoes, seasoned onions, fresh parsley, tahini, and spicy sauce all bundled up and hugged by grilled lavash.

Mediterranean Combo Plate - an assortment of goodies... falafels, dolmas, baba ghannouj, tabouleh, hummus, cucumber salad, feta, seasoned onions, tahini, spicy sauce, and grilled pita. Great to share with a friend!

Kind, personable, unassuming staff.
Fresh, consistent, authentic cuisine.
Reasonable prices (at 15cents/dolma, 40cents/falafel, etc..)

Thank goodness for the law of diminishing marginal utility, because if it weren't for her, I'd go much more often.

Truly Med, you have yet to fail me.
author: Tiff W.

description:
My posse and I were planning on going drinking in the mission and we needed something to eat before the night of raging was to begin. I thought I'd take all my friends here since it's fairly quick, easy and conveniently located on 16th in the mission. 

We all got the lamb schawerma and it didn't disappoint. They smash so much deliciousness into the grilled wrap. The meats are oh so soft tender and juicy. the various sauces and spices and veggies compliment the tastes of the meat. Great price and the staff is awesome. super friendly! A+
author: Alvin P.

description:
Best Schwerma and falafels in SF. Only place I have seen put French fries in their Schwerma since I've come back from Lebanon. I wish they put lift in them as well.

baba ghanouj amazing as well. Waterfront Pizza in foster city is still better overall, and Dish Dash in Sunnyvale beats everything.

My jam.
author: N S.

description:
Last night, I had the pleasure of reuniting with my love, at last we have made peace!

-------

This is my Love story!

Oh, how I've missed you my extra saucy lamb shawerma, DE-to the-LUX!!!

You truly are a blessing in my life, especially when made to my hearts desire!!!

Just one bite is all it took...

As I found myself holding on to you, with both of my hands.  Just trying to keep you in tact. There was only one place you were headed. You had a one way ticket, going on one way street. Directed towards my salivating mouth. Have my teeth showed up for work tonight?! Affirmative! Ready to chop chop chop at my command.  As my heart falls in deep to the ever so loveliness of bursting flavors! Overwhelmed with comfort, I can rest assure, that there is MORE of you to come. So, I had only half of you last night and what a pleasure t'was! I fell asleep with a content heart as the earth continued to turn.  Before waking I dreamed of you, heating you up, to that crisp perfection! (crunch crunch crunch, I heard) So, naturally I awakened in search of you my dear other half, craving your very juicy cylinder shaped self! 3 minutes pass and then... Oh dear! I've eaten the last bite!  One tear has dropped and rolled down my right cheek, in remembrance of you, my dearest.  Why didn't I eat your cylinder shaped self slower? Why'd I have to devour you so quickly? How will I move on? The smell of your half, still resides in my room, as I type this love story... between me and the extra saucy lamb shawerma!

A true love affair never dies, I crave you "Heveryday"  

pssst...yes the "H" is supposed to be there...it represents passion ;)
author: SammyWammy S.

description: First off HUGE shawarmas! The lamb was really tasty - was actually hoping to get chicken shawarma but they only serve that on Tuesday and Friday but I was glad I got the lamb! Definitely get the spicy it's not too hot. In fact ask for extra spicy if you need it to have a kick.
author: Sukanya B.

description: Excellent delivery operation this place has going.   Deluxe falafel w xtra potato & xtra hummus! Yum!
author: toad m.

description: Went here on a Yapsie Pupcrawl and I have to say this is some of the best wraps I've had in a long time.  They're in a location you would never think of for a Mediterranean place.  In the Mission surrounded by burrito joints.  It may look similar to a burrito, but it is so different.  The flavor is great and the smell outside is wonderful!  I got to try a couple, but my favorite was the Lamb.  I'll have to go back and try some of the others.  It's also nice that they have tables outside so you can eat with your dog.  It's a great place to go hang out with a friend (doesn't matter if they have two legs or four) and enjoy an interesting part of the city.  The prices are reasonable too.  I'll definitely be back!
author: Scott L.

description:
This place is tiny as hell, with only like 6 bar stools.  I guess you don't really need a lot of room since it's mainly a wraps place and people are in and out.  I came here with my cousin, and we both thought the food was really good.  

We weren't really in the mood for a wrap, so we ordered the wraps 'unwrapped'.  We ordered the chicken kabob which was flavorfu and came with a side of tomatoes and cucumbers with this tasty yogurt sauce and also some wheat naan. We had also ordered the falafel, which was crispy and yummy and also some hummus, which was really good!  If I'm in the area again, I will probably come by and try one of the wraps,  possibly the lamb shawerma, since so many other reviewers rave about it.
author: Shamina K.

description:
Don't let the hole-in-the-wall ambiance fool you. The food is truly fresh and delicious - they make the best, freshest, falafel I have ever tasted, and I didn't think I was a falafel fan. I live nearby, and their falafel combo plate (Mediterranean Combo Plate) is a takeout staple for me. I actually haven't tried any of the meat because the falafel is so good! 

There is narrow counter to eat in, but I recommend getting take-out for home or the park. As I mentioned, ambiance is not Truly Mediterranean's strength.
author: Nisha P.

description:
The vegetable combo platter was delicious.  The stuffed grape leaves were not fantastic, they tasted like they had been sitting there for some time.  The pitas were nice and warm. 

The chicken schwarma was also alright.  Stuffed with meat, no vegetables unless you count the sauteed onions.  

There were regulars coming in as well as newbies.  Later in the evening the street scene gets a bit sketchy so the people making the food also had to be careful of all the oddlots coming in with strange moods and desires.
author: Di Yin L.

description:
In college I studied abroad in Switzerland and more or less had a great experience.

While there I became intimately acquainted with the following, in chronological order:

1.) Fondue
2.) My expanding ass after eating said fondue
3.) Poverty after spending a lot of my money on fondue and new clothes from awesome Zurich boutiques to accommodate that ass.

After all this, I ditched the cheese and began eating falafel, shawerma, and kebabs because I could afford it, there were FIVE shawerma places to choose from on my block, and, most importantly, I get giddy at the sight of meat spinning in windows.  And thus we became intimately acquainted. (Hi Ömer!)  Upon return to the states, I swore off fondue (still can't do it) but I bemoaned the lack of shawerma in SF until a date introduced me to Truly Med.  

Now I stop by every few weeks, and while I miss my favorite spots in Zurich and Berlin, Truly Med does a fantastic kefta kebab, lamb shawerma, and good ol' falafel for when you want those cute clothes to fit right.  And if you're on a date or plan to go on one within a month, avoid the garlic mint yogurt drink. It's deadly.
author: Joanna M.

description:
This place is an oasis of deliciousness on 16th and Valencia. There are other places that are great in the area as well, and you would think in the burrito infested mission, a similarly shaped food may not work out well?

Think again my burrito loving friend. This place blows burritos out of the water like Steven Seagal did in Under Seige. (Instead he blew up Russians or something. And he is now a musician. And he still blows. http://www.stevenseagal.com/)

I digress. 

This place is cheap, delicious and hilarious. Yes, I said its hilarious. The guys working back there are either aspiring comedians or bored to freakin' death, but their comments, jabs and personality never gets old.

I brought a date there once (it was kind of to test out how she would function in a divey-ish place. She did will. but failed in other areas). 

I digress.

Anyway, brought a date there, she ordered her food. A few minutes later, the guys asks for money. She states she already paid him. He says no. This goes on for a few minutes, he wasn't being mean or anything.. just saying.. No, I don't believe you paid me, I am sure. After 5 minutes, she actually was convinced she didn't pay them. As she was about to, he has a fat grin on his face. Sounds obnoxious (and it was slightly) but he played it off well, I thought it was kind of hilarious. 

Go, grab a fatty Lamb Shwarma (which I think is only available wed or thu) and take it to one of the many bars that allow food in the area. Besides wed or thu, there are other great things to get there. Love this place.
author: Anish B.

description: It's okay..I got the chicken shawarma and didn't like it much.  It was somewhat bland and lacked a good veggie/meat balance and a good sauce.
author: Gary L.

description:
Used to eat here all the tine back when I lived in sf. Still good. I always go fir the fallafel deluxe with hot sauce and eggplant. Then get one of the middle eastern sweet pastries and a rootbeer. Awesome.  Plus: good food, small packed atmosphere, great spot for hipster watching, right in the heart of the Mission. 

Minuses: small and packed
author: Ral S.

description:
Their falafel is the BEST!!!
I even dream about it. :-)
My only gripe is that I wish that they were more generous with the hot sauce. I like my falafel super spicy. Sometimes they give extra hot sauce & other times they don't or put on & then give far too little. I want mine drenched in hot sauce! :-)
When I am in San Francisco I must go here for my FALAFEL FIX. 
Food matters far more to me than the atmosphere. While I enjoy fine dining, I can just as easily eat at a hole in the wall with great food. It's great for a casual lunch or take out. If only they would expand to Los Angeles & New York.
That way I could eat here at least once a week.
author: Christina R.

description: This is a place where you see the falafel / chicken rolls made right in front of you. They check for the spice level and add a spread on the bread.. the crispiness of the falafel and combo meal where you get a salad and pita bread makes it sumptuous.. definetly a place to visit if you are Mediterranean food fan.. donot except any ambience.. its a place for good foood..
author: Yugandhar P.

description:
Best Lamb Shawarma Wrap of my life. The meat is cut off and grilled again, giving it some great flavor. The tomatoes and tahini sauce, as simple as it is, gives the heaviness a nice balance. The lavash bread, for me, is what makes this since the grill the bread, giving it a nice crunch and texture that most shawarma's don't have. 

Definitely worth trying if you're looking for something fast, casual, and affordable.
author: Victor H.

description: I never thought Truly Med was as great as San Franciscans claimed but craved lamb and was in the area. $9.30 for the lamb or chicken shawarma? I haven't been in here in years so my jaw dropped. Since it's Tuesday, they don't even have lamb. I got a sample of the chicken which was already carved and dried out. I thought about trying the kefta kebab or burger for just under $7 but those would take 15 minutes. Falafel balls and even french fries have been pre-fried and sitting out. I just couldn't do it. I walked out... actually jogged a mile to my neighborhood Assyrian place, Palmyra, and got a whole rotisserie chicken for $1 more than the price of the Truly Med wrap plus a smaller chicken shawarma for $5. Was so happy with the decision.
author: Mimi L.

description:
Hole in the wall. Best Mediterranean food I've found in sf. Fantastic falafel. The combo platter with extra hot sauce is more tasty food than I can eat, and I can eat a lot of food.

A word of advice, though - skip out on the cheese+garlic+yogurt drink. It's pretty weird.
author: JR H.

description:
This is my absolute favourite place to get a shawerma. Every bite is like HEAVEN on a bun served by Swedish prostitute with a perfect figure. Yes, it's THAT GOOD. The place is a hole in the wall, just off of 16th st. DON'T YOU DARE pass it up though, or you'll deprive yourself of a truly Mediterranean piece of art wrapped up in aluminum foil.....

 By the way, BE SURE to order a lamb shawerma SPICY. It's the only thing that will let me sleep comfortably at night.
author: CHRISTIAN P.

description:
Found this hole-in-the-wall quite randomly while strolling in the Mission, and was very pleasantly surprised!

I tried the falafel wrap, and it was quite delicious. There were sesame seeds on the falafel, which I've never seen before but it infused the wrap a more unique texture and taste.

The rest of the ingredients were super fresh (cucumbers and onions) and the sauce was also very good. A bit of a wait is required since they make it to order, but lemme tell you, it is definitely worth it!

There are chairs/tables outside (and maybe 3 stools inside) but I'd recommend walking only a block or so to Kidpower Park on Hoff Street Alley, which is a quiet sanctuary with picnic tables where you can enjoy your wrap away from the craziness of the Mission.
author: Elaine W.

description:
Chicken Shawerma for 8.25, tip must have been included.

Good but small, next...
author: vin t.

description:
I wanted to like it. I really really did.... but the chicken shwarma fell a little short for me. It may have been because there was just too much onions in my wrap. So much that every other bite all I tasted was onions!

The pluses: 
- large portions/wrpas... people are not kidding. next time i'll share!
- made to order - but you gotta watch it and make sure they don't put too much on one thing *ahem onions*
- warm, portable and close to Dolores Park for a perfect picnic food

The minuses:
- food flavor is so-so 
- prices are but high (granted it's a huge portion, but still...)
- watch out for the onions!

This place is A-OK... but I'll probably give it another shot and be more mindful of my order and ask for more sauce. I just hope they prices don't go up by then.
author: Dee D.

description: When ppl say this place is tiny they mean if you are a larger person you might not even fit inside, it's a counter with about 5 tiny stools bolted to the floor positioning you with your chest pressed up against the counter, of you're lucky enough to snag a seat that is! The staff here are friendly and warm, the food was good, not anything that's really got me excited but still very good. The combo plate had creamy hummus, firm feta, 2 yummy dolmas, warm pita, tsatziki, tabbouleh, and some of the best babbaganoush I've had. The kefta kebab wrap takes 10 mins to grill up and they notified us of that ahead, so it's fresh but it just wasn't that flavorful. The meat was a little under seasoned and the wrap needed sauce to marry the flavors and bring it all together. The price is decent and I really want to try the lamb shawarma next time so we'll be back! Seating and parking are really tricky though unfortunately.
author: Emma H.

description: Truly Mediterranean has the best falafel that I've ever had.  Their sandwiches are fucking amazing and may just be definitive proof that there's a god after all.  I got the falafel deluxe which had the addition of potatoes and eggplant.  What I liked about the sandwich was that every element had a distinctive flavor and all of the elements complemented one another very well.  Eating it is that complex barrage of flavors and it's just delicious.  My partner got the famous lamb shawerma sandwich with the tomatoes that have been cooked in the lamb drippings and he ate it but he seemed disappointed.  I think he wasn't crazy about the sauce that was on it but that might just be him.  Bottom line:  fabulous.
author: Joseph C.

description: Lamb Shawerma!!!!!!!! The 2013 7x7 Big Eat list brought me here. 100 things to eat in SF before you die so you better get over there and order that. Big portion and don't forget a side of chili sauce. It's really not spicy at all... but who doesn't like extra sauce with their meal? GET IT GET IT GET IT!!!!!
author: Nancy N.

description:
The. Best. Lamb. Shawerma. I've. Ever. Had.

A tiny hole in the wall that packs in so much flavor and punch. I absolutely LOVE mediterranean food and I've had them at the most renowned places in NYC, Boston, and many other cities. But this one left all of them behind.

Reasons: The meat itself. So juicy, not dry at all and tons of it! They don't skimp and I love that. Second, they toast the wrap. I've never seen that done before. After they put all the fillings in, they put it on the grill so that when you bite in, they're hot and slightly crispy and that adds SO much to the presentation and flavor! No sogginess to deal with and everything is packed in so well. Lastly, the rest of the fillings itself - the yogurt, the spicy spread, tomatoes..everything! 

It's not the cheapest thing - $10 for the lamb shawerma. And almost all of the items on the menu are around that price, but the place takes credit cards (even Amex!) if you spend more than $6, which you easily will. 

I want to try the other menu items, but the lamb shawerma was sooo good, I don't know if I want to venture. Plus it's right next to the 16th st bart stop making it easily accessible.

Lastly, the service is awesome. They're really nice people and greet every single person that comes in and leaves. There wasn't a thing I didn't like. Love this place.
author: Aditi R.

description: I tried lamb shawerma and it was awsome, tasted healthy and fresh, he asked me if i want hot sauce before adding it and i said yes but next time i will have it without hot sauce because the lamb was tasty enough without that much pepper, the shawerma was baked on the oven before serving and i liked the baked taste of the bread, there was not so much space to eat inside and there was couple of tables outside; but i will definitely come back for the quality of the food and reasonable price! Good job!
author: Mina N.

description: Eating here for years a hole in the wall Mediterranean place. My fav the chicken shawarma with hot sauce but I also like the lamb. Sometimes I just stop by for a snack and get 3 felafels with Tahiti sauce.
author: Art C.

description: Great service! The guy taking my order was happy to answer my questions (that I myself was getting annoyed by) and the woman at the cash register was pleasant and charming. Together they madey my shawerma taste even better...thanks guys!!
author: Vivek N.

description:
This place is the bomb. Don't come expecting fancy decor or tables to sit down at. In fact, you'll probably have no more than a foot of space to move in any direction. The customer area couldn't be any more than 12 feet by 6 feet total. But bring your appetite for big, bursting with flavor Shawarmas, done right and done cheap. 

A line forms out the door during peak periods, but it usually moves quickly enough to keep from being a problem. The guys who work there are somewhat friendly, but they're all business. Prices are better than decent. They do have a narrow counter that lines the back wall where you can scarf your food down, but you're better off taking it to go.

This is my favorite Shawarma in San Francisco.
author: Don W.

description: Falafel wrap with the spicy sauce to go for a great meal at a park.
author: Diane K.

description:
The falafels here are AMAZING! They are super crisp on the outside and you can literally hear the crunch if you press down on it. The inside is light and flavorful - delish!

I got their mediterranean combo plate which comes with delicious hummus and baba ghannouj. So good with pita and falafels and cucumber salad and tabouleh.

Their lamb shawerma is also very good. It comes with a large amount of juicy, tender meat, creamy hummus and spicy sauce. Just wonderful!
author: Elaine L.

description: Great Middle Eastern food, not a lot of atmosphere (it's all to go, do who cares?) Friendly staff, good prices, delicious shawarma!
author: judah m.

description:
It was meant to be, I had just finished dinner at Andalu (review to come shortly) and I remembered that Truly Med was in the area, Unfortunately my GPS was tripping and I actually got into my car 2 blocks away only to drive back to across the street of Andalu, luckily the parking gods were on my side and I found one immediately.

By far, I have yet to come across another lamb shawarma that's even slightly comparable, I use to frequent their location in North Beach until I worked in the East Bay and they shut their doors.  The ingredients come together in mysterious ways and grilling the wrap makes it even better.  Add the hot sauce and it's....Well pretty damn fantastic even considering I didn't eat this magical thing until the next day (I just had dinner, remember?)

I'm thinking a bad habit is forming; Andalu (tapas) followed immediately with a shawarma.....And a few weeks ago, Fonda (tapas) followed immediately with Gordo (burrito), haha.
author: Jona C.

description:
I strolled into this tiny eatery with its five stools (and outdoor seating), feeling lucky after finding parking nearby (and no line!) and continued my shawerma quest by ordering the chicken shawerma wrap ($7.50).  

They know what they're doing.  He asked me if I wanted it spicy or not.  No one's ever asked me that before when ordering shawerma though some places have given me hot sauce.  Wow, good sign.  They're very quick too - they spread the hot sauce on the lavash, shave off the chicken from the spit, throw on some yogurt sauce, tomatoes and onions, roll and then throw it on the grill.  My wrap was ready in minutes, which gave me some time to look over their press clippings and awards.

The wrap did not disappoint.  There's just the right amount of delicious garlic yogurt sauce, so that wrap doesn't fall apart and sauce doesn't squirt everywhere.  They give you plenty of chicken which is thinly shaved and seasoned well.  The crunchy seasoned onions, juicy broiled tomatoes and taste of fresh parsley all enhance the taste of the wrap.  As for the hot sauce, I wish it were spicier.

The menu is limited to various wraps and some dips and salads but I like limited menu hole in the wall spots.  It's a shame that you can only get the chicken shawerma on Tuesdays and Fridays though - wish they could squeeze in one more spit.  They have some drinks and some fresh desserts (baklava and some others) too.  

Credit cards accepted.
author: Lolia S.

description: Good food, fresh, and fast. The falafel was hot and crunchy, the veggies were cool and crisp. Made fresh to order.
author: Tom A.

description:
Last time I was craving some Mediterranean food, I stopped by Daphne's. big mistake. Since then, I vowed not to eat the crap that they serve, in search of something more authentic and with fewer than a million locations. 

Thanks to yelp, I discovered Truly Mediterranean. What caught my eye was the chicken and lamb shawerma in the pictures that looked more like a burrito. 

I could not believe. How could these hipster DSLRs make a shawerma look like a big burrito? (insert inappropiate dirty jokes here...) True to form, they are very burrito-like. They have a schedule where they serve either chicken or lamb shawermas on certain days. The owners/workers were incredibly patient as I decided which of the 5 menu items to eat.  Make sure to check out the beverages as well. They stock one of my favorite ginger ales.

Parking can be tough in the area and if it's a cold day the only viable seating is the counter which can seat only 5 or 6.
author: Dennis L.

description:
They only have one shawarma machine, thus, they serve only one chicken on Mondays and Fridays, beef and lamb combo the rest of the week. 

Needless to say, and trust me when I say it, it is the best D??M falafel I ever had, and I had quite a lot in different parts of the world. The beef and lamb Shawarma only gets "best-er" every time. 

Recently a group of us did a taste comparison between TM and its competitors on the neighborhood, TM won the vote unanimously without a second guess. 
 
Try my sandwich style and you'd love it even more:

Falafel:

No hot sauce. 
No parsley
NO ONIONS
NO HUMMUS
Only falafel, grilled tomatoes and little cucumber, with the tahini sauce spread over it moderately.  
The falafel to be crushed to tiny pieces across the lavash bread. 
Add fried eggplant and potatoes if desired. 

Beef and Lamb Combo:

In the following sequence: 
NO parsley, none at all. 
Minimum on the hot sauce, none is best. 
Add few slices of onions to maintain a thin layer between the meat and the bread. 
Now add the meat, then grilled tomotoes on top of the meat, drip line of tahini across meat, not much. 

Chicken Shawarma:
You are on your own. Never been there on chicken days; Monday or Friday. 

Good luck with parking.
author: Waleed S.

description:
Woman cannot live on burritos alone.  (Well actually this woman probably could but I like to mix it up - yaknowhatimsayin'?)    

So I'm glad there's a lil' Mediterranean oasis in the Mission.  Truly Mediterranean has truly amazing falafels and truly delish chicken shawarma.  For $6, you'll get a ginormous wrap with a side of friendly from the nice guys that work there.

You'll love it.  Truly.
author: Amy C.

description: Just tried this place and a shawerma for the first time.  I gotta say, it was just okay for me.  It wasn't bad...just nothing to rave about.  The quality of the veggies and meats is good.  But the flavor, to me, was just so-so.  You get a good portion of food for $8 + tax, and they definitely don't skimp on the meat.  But I was still left wanting something more, flavor-wise.  I dunno, maybe Mediterranean food isn't for me.  It was still fun trying it out.
author: Joe M.

description:
Probably the best Shawerma I've ever had, And, if I weren't watching my carbs, I would come here every week. :P

The Lamb Shawerma with spicy sauce is SO FREAKIN' YUMMY! The wrap is always busting out with meat. It will definately leave you satisfied. 

The only problems are parking can be nightmare in the area and there's barely any seating.  So, a good place for take-out!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
I used to be a huge advocate of Truly Med, their falafel wraps, and their employees dancing away behind the counter.  We were even myspace buddies, though this was back in the day when myspace wasn't just for pre-teens and hoochie mama types.

Then I embarked on a trek across the middle east, a life altering journey in more ways than one.  I came home craving hummus, falafel and shawarma, mint tea, and baklava.  Headed straight over to the mission and my Truly Med, and was absolutely horrified to realize- wait a sec- it's not that good!!  

Noooo.  I've been ruined forever!  

I've since ridded myself of Myspace and moved onto greener pastures.  ie. Facebook.  

And as for the falafel?  Still looking.
author: Joanne G.

description: I started eating at this place in the mid-nineties and I always go back every time I am in San Francisco.  It is hands down, the most delicious Mediterranean food I have ever eaten in the United States.
author: Andrea S.

description: Truly delicious Med food. Wonderful shwerma wraps and fallafels in this hole in the wall / dive in the Mission. Meat is well seasoned and juicy. Hot sauce adds a nice zing. Fallafels are fried freshly. Nothing fancy about the place, but it is really a neighborhood staple.
author: Ed L.

description:
The food was alright, and nothing special. I got a plate, though I think you really should be getting a wrap. So if you don't want a wrap, I'd suggest going somewhere else.

The location stumped me for a bit as I was on the opposite side of the street. Just know that it is directly next to the entrance for Sunflower. And it is basically a hole-in-the wall.
author: C S.

description:
Mediocre all around.

We ordered a falafel, lamb shawerma gyros, baklava, and bottled orange cream soda. The orange cream soda was the best part of the meal...

Falafel was okay but not hot temperature wise. Shawerma was flavorful but I didn't like the flavor. I personally don't like the thin lavash bread and prefer pita. There was a lot of cucumbers but I think the wraps needed the creamy yogurt flavor of tzatziki. Hot sauce wasn't hot. Baklava was dry and overpriced.

Soda was good.
author: Cindy W.

description: Two words: lamb shawerma. Amazing. Generous portions, full of flavor all at a great price. My friend had the falafel which he loved as well.  I will definitely be coming back.
author: Navid P.

description: Great lamb and some of the best falafels in the city. I like a Mediterranean restaurant that offers extra tahini. The falafel were not dry, the wraps were big, the tabouli was on-point ad authentic. It's definitely a small place with minimal seating but on a Sunday night at 7:30, there was plenty of room for me and my 3 friends with some seating left over outside in the cold. If you're gonna whine about how small this place is, go take-out. I do wish they had some music.
author: Adrian A.

description: HANDS DOWN the best Middle Eastern establishment in the city! Fallafuls are crispy and fresh daily, and the schawerma's are the real deal.  Family owned for almost 2 decades. Will be going there in about 20 minutes!!!
author: Victor Z.

description:
I came here one night after work with some coworkers. It was a pretty good hole in the wall. The people working there probably have to deal with a bunch of crap so I have to give it to them for being so friendly. I was in a rather talkative mood being a little drunk. I noticed they had lamb shawarma on the menu and even after hearing people in line confirm that they were out of lamb I still had to proceed in ordering the lamb shawarma. And then followed up with a not rude, but acting as if I was misunderstood, pointing at the sign. The people their started laughing and I was just playing it up because I had a strategy. I ended up ordering the chicken (which was good),  and then they asked do you want it spicey (hell yeah) to which at that point they called me a wise guy and proceeded to make an extra spicey. Score I win :)

I would like to try the lamb sometime though. If it was like the chicken then I expect it to be awesome.
author: Greg G.

description:
Do yourself a favor, never ever go to this place.

1) Its expensive ( around $10 for any type of sandwich, you can go to nice sit in restaurant with entres that price)
2) not a place where you can sit and eat, it was really cold and they would refuse to close the door.
3) Cold Food (The meat wasn't even cooked properly)

I was honestly really upset after seeing that this got good reviews. If you want actual great mediterranean food for same price, with beautiful seating and scenery I'd go to waterfront, or theres a nice place in embarcadero. i am so disappointed!
author: Ali G.

description:
For a cafe that's the size and attractiveness of a Muni car, the falafel wraps are phenomenal. Their falafels are crushed, rounded then deep fried in front of you. These wraps are drenched in tahini sauce with strategically placed falafels, juicy eggplant and fried potatoes. Make sure you eat the falafel wrap right-side-up or it will fall apart! Moist would adequately describe the consistent texture and taste of the falafel wrap. 

The cafe is not a good place to dine. Take your food to-go instead! The tables are situated behind the narrow pathway between ordering counter. Expect people to brush back and forth behind your back while eating. The fuming meat torso behind the front window smells especially at the front end of the restaurant. I think it's actually a huge chunk of rotating lamb on a stick. 

Truly Mediterranean is quite an unassuming find.
author: Chris G.

description:
Omg, the LAMB, the LAMMMMMMB.

I was with two others. Collectively we ordered the lamb shawerma, lamb kabob, and the Athens burger. I ate the lamb shawerma, but tried the other two items.

My only complaint is that our order took FOREVER, because of the Athens Burger. I don't fault them though, because the guy told us 15-20 minutes for that item, so we were forewarned. I will not penalize. The cooks were very polite, and seemed to genuinely care about the food and its quality. During my wait, one of them asked me how my day was going and if I wanted something to eat/drink while I waited.

The LaMBBBBbbBBb. It was fantastic, freshly sliced, and not dry. I attribute this to the joint being super busy on a Saturday night. My shawerma was incredible. There was so much meat packed into the perfectly crisp flatbread, accented with awesome tomatoes and an INCREDIBLE tahini sauce. I ate my shawerma outside, and the ground looked like a Jackson Pollock painting - tahini sauce spackling the cement. I devoured it with extreme prejudice.

The Athens burger is not a traditional burger, but ground sirloin stuffed in a pita pocket. It was fantastic.

I am a fan of the Mediterranean burritos served at this fine establishment. I'm glad I came on a lamb night. There was some crazy fighting that happened a bit down the road too, which provided some mid-meal entertainment.

For what it is: Mediterranean-on-the-fly, this place is superb.
author: Brandon N.

description: Best Falafel around.  Been going here since 99 - always consistent.  Thank you Truly Med!
author: David P.

description:
Despite all the high reviews i read. It was my first time trying Mediterranean food and was not a big fan of falafel. I ordered the Lamb schwermas(what they are known for), the two guys at the counter makes it right in front of me. They first place a piece of falafel and they cut the lamb meat right of the grilled stick and put it on the falafel. They then add fresh tomatoes, onions, basil, this creamy sauce and wrapped it all up like a burrito and put it on the grill until all sides are crispy...

When i got it and took my first bite, i liked the flavor that was created by the lamb, the fresh tomatoes and the sauce. As i eat more and more of it, it become really dry due to the falafel. Everything from then on just went down hill, it was becoming tasteless and very dry and i had a hard time chowing it down. I end up only finishing 2/3 of it. I needed something to drink immediately after..

Wouldn't pay a visit to this place again.. Maybe i will try Mediterranean food from other restaurants.
author: Daniel L.

description: The lamb schwerma wasnt all its hyped up to be , my tort was hard , too many onions, warm instead of hot , and slighty missing flavor .... Pretty dry as well
author: Ashana D.

description:
Just had the falafel wrap at lunch.
Very crunchy on the outside. the falafels were mushy and tasted like bread. I cannot imagine eating them alone.
The hot sauce was flavorful and not too hot. The chopped cucumbers didn't taste fresh, nor were they crunchy, the skin of the cucumber was chewy and gave its age away. sorry two stars for now.
