As stated, it was fine.  I have had much better, like when San Carlos had a Lebanese Deli... holy... the Grandma there made some somke'n falafel!  And I had a really good one on Haight street back in the day... not there anymore.   

These days, I don't know where the really good ones are, and I'm hoping they get better than this.  

Still, it was fine.  I just won't be back for it.
author: Dan M.

description: I came here 15 years ago for the first time before catching a movie at the Roxie.  These days the workers with definitive Arabic accent have been replaced with workers with a definitive Spanish accent.  That said, I was happy to find out that the food still retains great flavors and the service is quick and efficient.  I'm glad that this place is still around.  The chicken falafal that I had is only available on Friday and one other day of the week.
author: Lucius M.

description: we're walking down the neighborhood and we see this couple enjoying something that looked pretty scrumptious. what is it? i had to check it out. I've had falafels before but never with a crispy wrap! Wow, what a concept, the sauce was just mouth watering good. one of those hole in wall places that you must try. i promise, you will agree!
author: Sandy P.

description:
I have been to Truly Mediterranean at least 6 times and I have never been disappointed! I have had the falafel, hummus, lamb shawerma (my personal favorite!), and graiybeh (butter cookie). I've tried the lamb shawerma with different combinations on the inside, from eggplant to onions, sometimes with the spicy sauce, sometimes without. Every time I have gotten it, the meat has been tender and flavorful! Portions are a good size (sometimes I eat the shawerma in two sittings, depending on how hungry I am when I get there), Ingredients are fresh (you see them cook the lamb/chicken, and falafel right there!) and the service is fast!

It's a pretty small place right there on 16th and Valencia, right there in the Mission District! There is a 4 or 5-stool bar inside and a few tables outside so you can enjoy the warm weather. The hours are great, and for those who don't eat lamb, they have chicken shawermas on Tuesdays and Fridays. There are so many options for such a small place, and the owners and employees are some of the nicest around!

I've tried other middle eastern places around the city, and Truly Med has proven the best by far! (The only thing better is my grandmother's Arabic food!)

If you haven't tried it already, GO! If you haven't liked it in the past, I suggest you try it again. I honestly always leave happy and full!
author: Jenn J.

description: Plain and simple, the spicy lamb shawerma is about as good as a shawerma gets. This spot is a hole in the wall, but don't let the outward appearance fool you.
author: Grant L.

description:
Consistently delicious!  This is absolutely my go-to place when I'm ravenous and in no mood to wait more than a couple minutes.  I always get the falafel regular, extra spicy, because it's not really that hot.  They wrap it in lavash and then grill it which makes their falafel wrap superior to others.  

Kabobs take a while because they grill them fresh to order.  I always see people in there waiting for kebabs.  The shawerma always looks and smells awesome, whether its chicken or lamb (it depends on the day.) I tried the garlic, yogurt & mint drink last time I was there.  It was great, not salty (I just don't dig the salty ones) but it was pretty garlicy.  Seriously, you would not want to have an important meeting or date later in the day, but it was tasty.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Shawrma = good.  

my sister's bf introduced me to this shawrma and it's damn good, i tell you.  I can't give 5 stars b/c that's the only thing that i tried.  I can't wait to go back and try the rest of the stuff.  

Shawrma is only served tues and fridays.  It has onions, tomatoes, parsley, chicken, chili paste, and their yogurt sauce all wrapped and grilled.  It's sooo yummy!!! All for 7 bucks.  If you are not the rice and bean kind of person, this is a good alternative.
author: AhLin C.

description:
I really like this place for cheap eats. Get the Falafel Deluxe with hot sauce. This isn't a hang-out, this is a place to grab and go. As for quality, it is a cheap place and the falafel is pretty good and a good value. It is not fantastic, but then I've never had fantastic falafel for that price anywhere. 

I actually don't know of great middle eastern in The City, but in Detroit the place to go is La Shish. The hummus there rings with clarity, and you can get it with toasted pine nuts.
author: Art K.

description:
It's the freakin best Mediterranean food I've ever had. I get the veggie combo plate and it's wonderful. The hummus is amazing. 

Only draw back it that it is the tiniest shop with few places to sit.
author: Tina N.

description:
Tasty shawerma and HUGE. Get the hot sauce, it's not too hot, but it's really tasty. They cook the chicken kebab to order so it takes a while, but while it was cooking I got to watch them cook the falafels. I like the little scoop that they use to shape the falafel and drop them in the oil to fry.

It's a little more expensive than your typical mission hole in the wall, but you could totally share or save some for later.
author: Melanie V.

description:
Well I finally made it in on a Friday - thank the moon and the stars
They really need to have chicken more frequently.
Chicken on two days only.......that is un-American

On my most recent trip, I was highly perturbed because when I asked for extra tomatoes in my shawerma, cooking-man tried to charge me $0.85 extra. I had already paid with credit card so I wasn't doing another swipe just for $0.85 .....so he wouldn't throw me any extra tomatoes!
Tomato nazi!!!!!!!!
author: Tianna R.

description: This is my favorite place for a Chicken or Lamb Shawarma. Everything is so fresh with amazing spices. My mouth is watering just thinking about them. I am going tonight! They are totally affordable and the people who work there are awesome!
author: Nicholas H.

description: When you have out of town guests-take them here. Their lamb shawarmas are world-class. The walnut baklava is even better than the pistachio.
author: Jamie B.

description:
My "go-to" falafel spot. I grew up in this neighborhood. Used to walk through here on my way to Everett and later on Mission High. My cousin lived up the block and I must say that it changed alot. Very hipsterish and lightweight yuppie-choads. Ain't my type of hype but can't help noticing shit when I come around for my meal. Truly Mediterranean stay keeping it real! If you dig the music playing you can a cop cd on the spot! What you know about that!!?

Parking's a bitch so walk (exercise is always good) or take the BART or park 2 blocks away coz it's worth it, seeeeeeeeeeeeeen!

It's a healthy kinda full!
author: Ivan F.

description: Everyone writes about the lamb shawerma, I'm not a huge fan of lamb, but I can say their chicken kabob wrap is heavenly. I mean, soooo good. On Tuesday and Fridays they switch out the lamb for chicken shawerma which I like much less than the Kabob, but still good. All in all, really good huge wraps of Mediterranean deliciousness. I always ask for extra spicy but that's just my thing...
author: Lauren B.

description: This review is for the falafel deluxe, which is all I've ever had aside from some lamb thing one time that I didn't love. It's a nice combo of falafel, cucumber, eggplant, onions, and fried potatoes, with some hearty sauces in between. A solid, reliable lunch for those days when you're trying not to eat meat for once. And the guys who work there can be pretty friendly.
author: Marco L.

description: Chicken shawarma on Tuesday & Friday with a side order of 1/2 dozen falafel with tahini sauce. I always walk out of this joint happy.
author: Ayyeng P.

description:
One time Sammy (who had the most spotless station in Aroma Cafe in downtown Oakland) made me a falafel deluxe and charged me for a regular falafel. This event changed my life. Not because the falafel was crispy where it should have been and tender in all the right places, because it was, and then some. Yes: there was the unexpected delight of potatoes merging with hot sauce. But ultimately my fate was sealed when I put the falafel in my pocket when I was on BART and nibbled at it as the tahini slowly seeped into my hoodie's pocket, forever staining it with the rich scents and smells of that deliciously perfect falafel. My friends made me throw that hoodie away.

Note: this is one of those places where you eat at a counter facing a mirror. Try this after a night of drinking and see how large the pores in your nose are and how green your face is...then find someone to love you.
author: Ross G.

description:
This place taste great.  The place is a small so it can get crowded easily and there's hardly anywhere to sit and eat, but that doesn't take away from the food they serve.  They offer kebabs with different meats like lamb and chicken.  They also have vegetarian dishes with eggplant in them as well.

Shawerma - delish!!!!
author: Qyon G.

description:
Came here on a Friday, and they didn't have the lamb shawarma. Too bad. So, instead, we ordered Original Falafel- it was very very good close to awesome; lamb kebab- was okay to good; and Kefta Kebab- it was very very good close to awesome. 

We didn't know how big the portion was... so, we ordered those three. The portions are pretty big, they even cut the wrap into two. The wrap (lavash) is pretty crunchy, so it added to the "yumminess" of my order. 

And it's pretty cheap, that is my highlight. Good and cheap food. All of the order plus drink came out to $23. Not too shabby!! 

I just have to make sure that next time I avoid Tuesdays and Fridays, so I could taste their famous lamb shawarma.
author: Daisy S.

description:
I love the food here.  Especially when they have Lamb.  You get your food really quick and it always tastes fantastic.

I recommend the Mediterranean plate.  You get a ton of food for 9.00
author: Shawn L.

description: I give FIVE stars to the lamb AND chicken shawarma! And everything else is pretty darn good, too. The Mission Truly Mediterranean is definitely better than the Berkeley version -- always was (not that the Berkeley one is there anymore :(...).   If you are craving really solidly executed Greek, please don't slow down to look around.  Just go here.  Definitely try whatever shawarma they're serving that day...and get a few other things.  You'll have enough food to feed probably 2 other people...but who cares?  The price is right...
author: Sue W.

description:
This place makes a great f'ing Shawarma.  

Trust me, I grew up in Dearborn, Michigan, so I know my shawarma.  Truly Mediterranean also offers other well crafted favorites: kefta, falafel, lamb kababs, as well as your usual array of mediterranean sides.

The food is made quickly, so it's a great place to drop into for quick take-out.  As another yelper mentioned, the tabouli is kind of expensive for what it is.  However, it's fresh w/o much oil, which I tend to like, so I end up ordering it anyway.

The place is not really meant for dining in; there are a few stools, but they're rarely in use.  The cooks and staff are friendly, quick, and courteous.

I whole-heartedly recommend this place.
author: Mike F.

description: Mediterranean is some of my favorite food and this place did not disappoint! Tiny little hole in the wall so I called in an order to go. Girl who took my order was sweet and answered all my questions. I ordered Lamb Kabob, which ended up being done like a burrito. Wasn't what I expected, but was freakin' delish. A little too much tahini sauce though which made it slightly messy. Also, I asked for it to be extra spicy and it definitely wasn't up to my spice par, but I always take an extra side of chili sauce at Mediterranean restaurants because it usually is never spicy enough for me. I also ordered some hummus which was amazing! No complaints about that. A little more pita bread would've been nice, but I can just pick some up at the store and have a midnight snack later. Food was awesome and to go service was decent. Only complaint about service was I asked for to-go silverware on the way out to which she assured me there was some in the bag already. There wasn't :( only a spoon. BUT, the burrito stayed together really well for how much tahini was on there so I didn't really need the spoon that badly in the long run. Definitely can't wait to go back though!
author: Nick M.

description: I miss this place! My friend, George introduced me to Truly Mediterranean a couple of years ago. They have the best Chicken Schwarmas in town!
author: Thu L.

description:
How do they make chick peas taste so good? At truly mediterranean, you can watch them make these delicious balls called falafels. The falafel deluxe is awesome. The salad, tahini, onions, eggplant and potatoes provide multiple layers of flavor to compliment the delicious falafel. I can't think of a better falafel sandwich.
     The lamb shawerma is also great. The lamb/beef combo is bold, well-seasoned, and moist. The tomato, onion, and tahini really bring out the flavor of the meat.
     For a "truly mediterranean" dining experience, you can't go wrong with the combo plate. Love the hummus and baba. The feta cheese and cucumber salad were very fresh. I'm not a huge fan of taboleh or dolmas but they seam to be on par with the other items on the plate.
     Overall, this place rocks. The only negative is the price. 9 dollars for a wrap is a bit much to spend. You do get a lot of bang, but you will have to spend a lot of bucks.
author: Siao W.

description: Recommended through a friend so I tried it for the first time. Didn't feel much of the hype that's been going around. Price was reasonable, I tried the Chicken Shwerma which was aight. Thought the veggies undercooked, I like them a lil' softer to where they don't crunch in your mouth. Sauce was decent but honestly, I'd rather have a burrito elsewhere anyday. The place is about the size of a shack with only a few stools to sit on and a mirror in front of you so you can check out the cooks i guess. Really, just a sort of swing through spot if you're in the area.
author: Aaron F.

description:
I've had two things here--the Chicken Shawarma and that Chicken Kabob. Both were amazing, usually with a side of hummus. 

The only, one thing holding this place back from having to make yelp add another star? No seating, at least, only barely. I realize the space is teeny, so it can't detract realistically from the place's rating, but it would be nice to be able to sit indoors, look out onto 16th, and scarf on one of their pita wraps.
author: Chad G.

description:
Quick, yummy Mediterranean sandwiches including falafel, kebabs, and shawerma. Their hot sauce is unique and tasty--not just hot. Get your sandwich with babganoush or hummus for a little extra and it makes your sandwich all the better. I often get a shawerma deluxe which is lamb or chicken (only served on weekends) shawerma with eggplant, cucumber salad, potatoes, tomatoes, and babaganoush and it's around $9. 

Ask for a couple of falafel while you wait--they're usually free!
author: Mario T.

description:
Lamb & Beef Shawarma : **** (4) (way too meaty/gamy, but thats what I like)
Chicken Shawarma : * (1) (horrible, once you try Yumma's Shawarmas these don't stand a chance. Also, they only have Chicken Shawarmas only certain days, I want to say Tuesdays and Fridays but I could be wrong)
Falafels : ***** (5) 

This place defines the term "hole in the wall". The food is moderately priced, and most of it tastes pretty good.

"ai"
author: Anand I.

description:
Good place to pick up an office lunch. Good  cheap and Fast.
I couldn't decide on what I wanted to I order, so I had the platter with everything on it.($7.00ish). It's not gourmet but it is a deal.
author: Rory V.

description:
I second the last reviewer and would be interested in participating in said gang fight with those ali baba morons.  (note: yelp censors and removed the previous post.  did ya'll know YELP CENSORS?  I did not.  kinda disappointed to hear it.  What is this? Citysearch?)

I spent 6 weeks in the middle east.  This place is as close to the real shit as anywhere I've found.  

Delicious. 

Shwarma (chicken and lamb) are both fantastic.  Falafel is also superb - spring for the eggplant and potatoes - it adds a whole other dimension.
author: Melissa Y.

description:
Whoever said this place was cheap was wrong...I spent $11 on a Chicken Schwarma, piece of Baklava and a drink.  OUCH!

Food was great though! 

Just dinging it a star because for $11 I got what I used to get in my hometown for $6.
author: Matt V.

description:
One night in the mission when the music was loud and spirits were high. I might have been aloud to make my own falafel. But since I'm sure that violates some health code I won't be confirming.

You should know Truly Mediterranean will supply you with fresh hummus, spicy shawarma  and my favorite, a generous vegetarian plate. It's a tight squeeze in there though so don't be those folks that clog up the works. Keep moving and remember to smile, it's only dinner.
author: Angela K.

description:
The chicken wrap was good, they serve only chicken (no lamb) on tuesdays and fridays. extra charge for eggplant and fries in the wrap.  no place to sit, friendly staff, and clean.
I prefer Ali Baba's Cave also in the mission.
author: Cooter Z.

description:
All I can say is go eat here before this location closes like the others!  It's strange - they're the best mediterranean deli around, but their locations keep closing.

A pal o'mine turned me on to them years ago when they had a location in the Haight.  I went there all the time, then one day I show up and it was gone.  Another one opened in North Beach, but then it closed too.

Glad to see there's still one open in the Mission...
author: Loren E.

description:
You want falafel? best ever

I hear the other stuff is good, but I go for the falafel

falafel deluxe with feta please...to go.
author: Ken p.

description:
Best Falafal! 
So Good!
Slightlyt sketchy and limited
author: Adrienne G.

description:
I ordered the Lamb skewers here and they gave me a lamb shwarma.  The guy at the counter mentioned something like, the lamb skewers will take 10 minutes.  I told him that's fine.  

Eventually the group behind the counter decided that the shwarma would be best in my situation.  -2 for not getting me what I ordered.  Otherwise 3.5-4 stars.  Taste was good, but I've had better.
author: Jonathan T.

description:
We love this place! It was my first shawerma and it definitely won't be my last. Great selection, fresh, and fast. It is a small place with counter/stools inside and a couple of patio tables outside.
It is really good for take out. I have tried the lamb and chicken shawerma and also the falafel wrap. Very good indeed!
Always say Yes for the hot sauce. It actually isn't that spicy.
author: Mauling W.

description:
I love places like Truly Mediterranean. Small place with only a few seats, friendly people behind the counter and tasty foods. 
The Chicken or Lamb Shawermas are cool, and the hot sauce gives it a little bit of Oomph. 
Having never trying anything like the Garlic-Mint Yogurt, it was pretty good and tasty.
The only negatives is there is no parking whatsoever. So i only go if i'm in the area or for pick up. Order in advance, it takes a little bit of time for them to create these tasty products but you'll know it's fresh off the grill.
author: ToAsTy T.

description:
I used to frequent the Truly Mediterranean on Haight Street, across from Amoeba Music. When it moved to Berkeley, I started going there. Now this one is the only one left, and as much as I dislike trips to the Mission District of San Francisco, I now make regular pilgrimages for the schwarma. It's the best schwarma I've ever had, anywhere.

IMPORTANT-- the chicken schwarma is the tasty thing to get, and you can only get it on Tuesday or Friday, so go on those days or miss out.

Another plus-- the staff is always very kind and friendly, and willing to do just about anything you ask them to do to your schwarma. A real plus. Go!
author: Greg G.

description:
I was told about this place from some fellow friends because they always know I complain about the quality of Arabic food in this city considering that I am lebanese - I am a little picky especially when they try to Americanize it - it just doesn't taste the same.  

However, I walked down to this place and ordered a falafel sandwich and they put friend potatoes in there for me - which is how we used to eat it as kids so it was perfect.  The friend the falafel just right and it was crispy and warm and you could tell it was fresh and not made from a mix.  The sandwich was perfect and it was priced just right.  I can't wait to go back.
author: Rod S.

description: My go-to Greek/Mediterranean place in the city. Everything I've tried, from the hummus to the dolmas and the shwarma, were all excellent. I highly recommend any of their wraps. Reasonably priced, quick, and so so good!
author: Bass T.

description:
Yummy yummy.  My boyfriend and I were visiting friends in SF, as well as scouting it out as a potential place to live (we're from Indiana).  We were searching for falafel, as there's only one place to get it anywhere near our home.

The falafel here was HUGE.  I preferred it over Ali Baba's Cave.  I ordered the deluxe spicy, and my dude ordered the regular.  The spicy spread was awesome, with just a little bite to it.  Also, I'm an eggplant junkie, so I had to spring for the deluxe.  I could have done without the fries built into the wrap, but they weren't bad.  Also, our friend ordered a side of hummus, and he got a nice-sized tub with enough to take home and share a snack with his girlfriend later.  The staff was super-nice.  

The only thing I'm wondering is this:  what on earth is the "garlic-yogurt drink"?!  Is this good?  I couldn't bring myself to buy one, even out of curiosity.
author: Amber W.

description: The catering food was pretty good, but uninspired. Hummus was unremarkable, and the falafel was so-so. The dolmas were really good, but overall I was underwhelmed (admittedly, I had pretty high expectations).
author: Kevin A.

description:
I've been looking for a great gyro, but have yet to find one in SF...so I decided to try a shawarma at this place after reading reviews on yelp.  I wanted the mixture of meats, but on Tues & Friday they only have chicken shawarma - which actually turned out to be quite tasty.  

Not very much to this place, and I noticed that they do NOT use gloves while preparing your food... :(.  I'll keep looking for my good gyro and a place that uses gloves to put your shawarma together or at least utensils...
author: DC B.

description: This place was good. Had the Chicken Kabab and a taste of the Lamb Shawerma. Both delicious. Uber friendly staff.
author: Jenny X.

description: I eat here about once a week! The restaurant is pretty small and it often gets crowded. They are quick with getting your order to you. Lots of vegan and vegetarian options. I recommend the falafel deluxe wrap!
author: Philip R.

description:
I wanted to eat at a hole in the wall and I found it. The place is tiny and there's a line which is always a good sign. Service is fast!

My friend and I went inside, we ordered chicken shawerma (they didn't serve lamb on certain days) and deluxe falafel.

What we should have done was order just one item. But you know girls, our eyes are bigger than our stomach. 

The chicken shawerma was good. Falafel was lacking in flavor and we had to asked for more hot sauce. All the ingredients  are fresh.

I will come back and try the lamb shawerma next time around.
author: K L.

description:
I really wanted to like this place, I'd kill for a good shawerma. I kept going back and trying different things - lamb shawerma, kefta kabab, falafel - none were bad, they were just all boring and tasteless. After a few tries I'm giving up.

I don't know where all these good reviews are coming from. I guess everyone is eating here drunk? If I'd been drunk I probably would have liked it too.
author: Gordon B.

description:
I love their shawarma and falafel.
They simply have yet to fail me.

Eat here or be forced to live with tacos.
author: Tom S.

description:
Pretty solid shawarma, I'll confess I've never had it anywhere else. A bit dry on some bites but overall quite good. An alternative to pizza or burritos in the area

There's not a lot of room to eat there (counter or patio tables outside), I guess these are ok on the go. Could be cheaper, $7.50 before tax
author: xo x.

description:
Love this place.

The chicken schwarma is to die for. I'm almost happy that they have it only two days a week because otherwise I would be there every day. Originally I would have left out one star  because the food is ridiculously messy and there are no plates. Bad combo.

The trick (which put it back up to 5 stars) is to carefully tear off the tin foil 3/4ths of the way down to create your very own aluminum foil plate. At this point, with the aid of some disciplined eating and a handful of napkins, you should be good to go.
author: Alex E.

description:
really really good!  maybe the best in the city.

i had the lamb schwarma with potatoes (costs extra) and the meat was minced small, but still very juicy and tender.  the ingredients taste really fresh and it takes awhile for the schwarma to get soggy, which is a big plus.

i ate the entire thing, and this says alot cause i usually only eat half of any schwarma or burrito.

the guys behind the counter are super nice too.
author: Josie M.

description: So the last time I went to Truly M. was when it was still open in the Haight, yes! there was one in the Haight, do you folks remember that?? NO actually the last time I went to Truly M was when it was in Northbeach! YES! I was craving it nad hiked down there from the outer sunset, FAR hike! I tried to convince them to please open one back in the Haight but I guess they didn't take my great advice. Last one standig in the mission, SOO good but what bugs me, NO SEATS! So I never ate there yet. From what I remember the chicken shawarma was BOMB! I added cucumber salad in mine, one of the best things that will go in your mouth. Great alternative to a burrito and I think it would be a little healthier than one.
author: Karen T.

description: Love the felafal deluxe, but dismayed that the prices are higher than in years past, even after adjusting for inflation, for the atmosphere doesn't justify the higher prices. The blue-eyed manager seems creepy, mean, like there is something sinister going on beyond Truly Med, though the rest of the staff is great. (Alright, I was also irritated that he sent me to the poor Vietnamese restaurant next door to use their bathroom, despite having ordered a lot of Truly Med food, and having to desperately go.) My husband, a voracious carnivore, prefers the felafal to the various meat schwarma, and notes that it's a more balanced flavor (I don't eat meat so can't comment).
author: Eliza S.

description:
The Store:
I was brought here by a friend who described the Shawerma served here simply as a "Mediterranean burrito". Being a hole in the wall, don't expect too much sitting space, but it is still worth it. Overall, the place is very clean, organized and well lit.

The Food:
I ordered the standard Shawerma (a.k.a. the "Mediterranean burrito") with the spicy spread, which was absolutely delicious! A friendly heads up, make sure to cover the bottom of the wrap with a napkin as it tends to leak. Lathering the hummus on the wrap was very good too.

The Service:
The staff initially seemed gruff as we ordered, but were very helpful when it came to getting us more napkins and some bags for out togo items.

Overall:
Good service, great food and pretty quick as well. I will definitely be back if I am in the area.

-Aaron
author: Aaron C.

description: Beware of this place. It will draw you in with the idea of some yummy mediterranean far. But be warned. Last time I ate at this place my schwarma smelled like ass! Literally...ass. It was one of the grossest things I've ever experienced. And we used to eat here all the time, at least once a week. They have the best hummus. But I can't bring myself to go back and try it again. I seriously want to hurl every time I think about it. Plus I've seen them mix sauces and hummus in those big plastic ice buckets. Who knows what other health code violations are going on here. It might taste good while you're eating it...but you'll regret this one. SICK!
author: Marianne s.

description:
Delicious chicken schwerma, will be back to try the lamb.

Awesome!
author: Andrew Y.

description: I'm "Truly" a fan of the chicken shawarma, which they only serve on Tuesdays and Fridays.  For all you lamb fans, they serve it on the other days.  Although I haven't tried the lamb, I've heard it's excellent.  Also, the staff is very courteous and friendly.  Hey, today is Tuesday.  I think I'll have a chicken shawarma today for lunch.  Yum!
author: Ricky M.

description: This place was OK until I saw one of the employees there playing with the falafel balls and pretending to use them as a weapon.
author: Fifteen F.

description:
its been quite the interval time since i wrote anything (like, 4 days dude) so i know there are a grip of lemmings crouching behind  some zip drive in yelp world salivating and festering spasmodically upon my return, and here it is Armando, pulling all the stops, skirting the lines between genius and pretension, bombast and restraint.......

Falafel: yeah. Veggie plate: Awesome. Prices: too much. paid extra for falafel lavash, does not come with baba or hummus. Ingredients kinda get lost. "WAA WAA"! 


SATIATED, PLEASED, EMOTIONAL BLISS CANNON ON SOME SORT OF NEVERENDING PROJECTILE CYCLE?   ARE THE NEURONS BETWIXT AND SMOOTH FORMING? im now going to go sit on my throne, blink a few times, then weep all over my seiten (recycled!).
author: Christopher J.

description:
This place is excellent as long as you are not expecting to sit down and eat in. I had the lamb Shawerma with extra hot sauce and it is GREAT! I like this place better than Ali Baba's Cave, if you are at 19th I say walk the extra blocks for the best!

Plus the place scored a 99 from the dept of health!  a clean hole in the wall is hard to find.
author: Ashley T.

description:
Best falafel in the city. 
FOOD: Fresh, hot, neatly wrapped up.
SERVICE: Friendly and fast
PRICE: Cheep
PLACE: Clean, Seating is very limited. 

Why does this place has a myspace page ?
author: Puffy P.

description:
The best falafel in SF. These guys are always patient and willing to customize.
Tip: the difference between the regular falafel and the deluxe is that the deluxe has potato wedges and eggplant (15+ years, but still no sign). Love eggplant, but the regular is better. Keep it simple.
Critical: No onions! I love onions, but these are nuclear. By the end you'll wish you hadn't.
Interesting: Why do they alternate chicken days and lamb days? Not enough space for two rotisseries.
author: Mehul P.

description:
Consistently delicious!  This is absolutely my go-to place when I'm ravenous and in no mood to wait more than a couple minutes.  I get the falafel regular, extra spicy, because it's really not that hot.  They wrap it in lavash and then grill it which, in my opinion, is the mark of a quality med wrap.

Kabobs take a while because they grill them fresh to order.  I always see people in there waiting for kebabs.  They serve either chicken or lamb shawerma depending on the day (I'll report back on which days are which.)  I tried the garlic, yogurt & mint drink last time I was there.  It was great, not salty (I just don't dig the salty ones) but it was pretty garlicy.  Seriously, you would not want to have an important meeting or date later in the day, but it was tasty.
author: Tina D.

description:
My attempt to write a review about here has made me realize that I know how to spell neither "Truly" or "Mediterranean". So much for being from the country which invented our fair language :(

Anyways, on to the review :)

I eat here far too much. "Far too much" because I'm in a weightloss bet at the moment and the food here is both appetizing, and filling and unhealthy (in a good good way!).

I've had, and recommend, the falafel shawarma and the lamb shawarma. Both are delicious. Price wise its adequate - its about $8. It completely fills you up. I guess the only issues I have with it are that the chilly isn't hot enough and the garlic yoghurt sauce is too garlicy. Then again, im less of a garlic aficiendo (another word I cannot spell!!!) than most of you californian's!

Greatest thing is it is open late, so great for drunken food :)
author: mike o.

description: I've been here before, and the falaffel are good. Last night, I tried to go again, and the door was locked and they were cleaning up the kitchen inside. Yet, according to the menu on the door, they were open for another hour. Not impressed at the mismatch between posted opening hours and actual opening hours.
author: owen o.

description: Best falafel in recent memory.  I had the "Deluxe Falafel" which adds fried potatoes and eggplant.  The combination may sound weird, but it's very delicious.   Fast, courteous service and always good Middle Eastern music playing. Grab a walnut baklava for dessert, which are highly addictive.   Including a Snapple and tip, I spent about $12.  A great bargain bite, with quality way beyond the price.  Well worth a walk through the Mission.
author: Catherine A.

description: Lamb Shawarma. I love you. Hot damn was this good. And huge!! For eight bucks you get a giant wrap. It could very easily feed two. They have grilled veggies (love the onion!), lamb, hot sauce, and hummus. And then they roll it up and throw it on the grill until it's nice and crispy, wrap it in foil and then hand it to you. It's heaven in a roll. Seriously, what are you doing still reading this? Go get yourself one now.
author: Cathy T.

description: this place is good but not great. i think it's because there's a lack of good shwarma places in the city that this place is highly raved about. i expected the lamb shwarma to be amazing but i think it's just ok. also, it's like $10..
author: Joyce B.

description:
Their wraps are amazing - just one will feed you for at least two meals.  The quality of their ingredients (tahini, yogurt, etc.) seems above and beyond that of other mediterranean wrap shops in the city.  And they actually listen to you when you say "not spicy, please."

4 stars just because there's not much seating which is a drag if you're on foot, but parking's a crapshoot if you're in the car.
author: Samantha J.

description: All I get here is the falafel deluxe. It's the best I've had in this city, or anywhere, so far. It's not the cheapest falafel, and it's not the closest to me, but it's worth the money and the walk.
author: Nik G.

description: I used to live around the corner from Truly Med. I only go on Tuesdays or Fridays, when they have chicken shawerma. The staff is great and friendly, and even though there's no place to sit, there are a ton of bars nearby where you can take your wrap and enjoy with the beverage of your choice. I would eat here more often if it weren't so pricey--$8 for a chicken shawerma.
author: stephanie l.

description:
i have been going to TM for years to get my falafel fix. the falafels are good/OK, but the lamb shwarma...not so much. 

tonight i was too lazy to walk to Ali Babas on valencia and i immediately regretted it  while he was preparing the food. the lamb looks great on the  wheel while its cooking, but after they chop it up it has the consistency of ground beef. skip this place for lamb and head over to Ali Babas Cave and try their lamb plate. and everything else they have is amazing.

i do love the sugar/pistachio cookies at TM!

and i really miss the swarthy guy with the crazy mullet, who used to work there. he looked like he could impregnate your sister  by just looking at her.
author: midas r.

description:
Yum! Yum! Yum!

I remember when I first found Truly Med a few months ago...an accidental find on the way for a little late night drinking in the Mish.

The chicken shewarma is amazing.  It's too bad they only have it on Tuesday and Friday.  Also, be sure to get it with the hot sauce.

My ultimate favorite though is the Athens Burgers - loaded with lightly marinated onions, tomatoes and cucumbers and some taziki type sauce - the burger itself is full of flavors too.  For whatever reason this burger always makes me feel happy, comfort and pretty full when I am done.  It's cheap and yummy!! (Under $6.50)

Can't get much better than that!!

With all the rave reviews about the falafel I want to try it, but it's hard to pull me away from the shawerma and Athen burger!  ;)
author: DJ N.

description: OMG! There shawarma is sooo good. I never really like lamb but how the way do it  makes me love it even more. It may be a little expensive but it's all worth it.
author: Leila D.

description: The owner of this place was in my food safety class.  I was his instructor so I know that this is not only a delicious place to eat at, it is clean!  I go there to get the Chicken Shawerma wrap every chance that I get.  You definitely get your money's worth.  It's mouth-watering food!  Even though I'm full, I'll keep eating because it's so tasty!  Try the hummus as well.  The price of their hummus is comparable to the grocery store hummus and at Truly Mediterranean, you'll get hummus that is fresh with no preservatives.  It tastes soooooo much better!
author: She Ra L.

description: This is the best Falafel/Shawerma place I have found in SF so far. I had a falafel and a lamb shawerma. The spices that were with/in the lamb were amazing. The meat itself was a little bit on the muttony side, but it still tasted delicious. And while I have had better falafel, that was not in the US, so I won't hold it against them. Also do try the yogurt drink, it sounds weird (garlic and all), but it's refreshing.
author: Martin W.

description: Falafel review only - not terrible but Ali Baba's at 19th and Valencia has a slightly better tasting falafel with better atmosphere and tables.
author: Tim H.

description: The only good thing about my falafel regular was the thin lavash wrap.  The interior had flavorless & not-recently-prepped cucumbers, a sauce that I basically couldn't taste, & worst of all, precooked & flavorless falafel.  I was begrudgingly handed hot sauce which didn't improve the situation.   The service was off-putting & the space not terribly clean.  Many foodstuffs sitting around in bins.   No option for getting a small amount of hummus to hopefully pep up the sad falafel.   I sure would like to find some good falafel around here.
author: Sarah S.

description: Best falafel wrap I've ever had! I wanna go back and get another one! I recommend the falafel deluxe wrap, with the hot sauce.  So good!
author: Marvella W.

description: I needed to move within walking distance after trying their "Greek burritos."  I LOVE the chicken kebob with feta, hot sauce, and two falafels.  Call ahead and you won't have to wait the ten minutes it takes for the chicken to cook.  Mmmm!
author: Alisha F.

description: I grew up where great shawarma is easy to find.  Obviously, that's not the case in the Bay Area.  This place however is awesome, by far the best that I've come across in 5 years of searching.
author: Marc L.

description: Ah crap!  Now I have to BART out to the mission for lunch once a week or so.  The Lamb Shawarma ("spicy") lives up to the hype.  Huge portions of lamb too.  Super nice guys that work here.
author: Dave H.

description: Not much room to sit and eat, but if you grab to go, or eat quickly, this is an awesome place. One of the best falafels I've had in the city, and it's cheap. Meat and hummus are good too.
author: O K.

description: Big fan of this little hole-in-the-wall. Is there anything more perfect than ordering falafal/kebab/hummus/gyros to go and walking up to Delores Park?  In think not!  The wait sometimes is annoying but you completely forget about that once you have the deliciousness in hand.  I read some of the reviews below about the conversations of the cooks.  Who cares. Sit outside and wait for your food.  A great local find.
author: Jasmine B.

description: Raucously delicious! Take it with you next door to Dalva for a beer and keep on smiling.
author: Heirloom Z.

description:
Great food!!!

Had the Falafel and was quite pleased, flavor and size were exceptional.  My friend had the Gyro and that was delicious as well.

You should give it a try!
author: Robert G.

description:
If there was six stars I would give it to this place. Since there is now only one location left (WTF?!?!) I'm always on the hunt for another falafel spot that can even come close to Truly Med, and frankly no one has. Don't get me wrong, a place like Le Mediterranean in Rockridge is great but that is more for dolmas, quiches, and for sitting down.

And ever since I figured I can make a phone order, pick it up, and ditch the 30 minute wait to find parking, which by the way is worth it, I've been making sure to pick one up whenever I can. Shoot, sometimes when I have a gig in that neighborhood I even come a few hour(s) early to grab a falafel; it is that good.

And in typical YELP fashion there's dudes and dudettes on here acting all butt-hurt and opening up their "YELP" review with some "HEY! I REALLY DON'T LIKE MEDITERRANEAN FOOD BUT I WENT TO THIS PLACE ANYWAY" or "THE BEST PLACE EVER......HERE IS 2 STARS BECAUSE THERE THE PLACE IS 'GHETTO/DIRTY' THEY DON'T HAVE A VALET" or something. GTFOOHWTBS!
author: Tobias F.

description:
Sharif R. has hit the nail on the head, a perfect Saturday, or any nice day in the city:

Eat the falafel deluxe and walk  to Delores Park
author: Lucian J.

description:
I walk from SOMA every Saturday to get my lamb shawarma because parking is horrific and weird people take MUNI on the weekends. But...that little piece of wrapped heaven is worth every mile and every blister. Seriously, if you haven't had one maybe you should hold off until you are willing to go to such extremes to get it. 
I do have to take away one star because the guy that makes 'em gets pissed when I ask for no onions.
author: Ash S.

description: Falafel here is amazing. I've had better lamb Shawarma, but overall good experience.
author: Emmanuel P.

description: falafel deluxe.  yum, my kind of sandwich.  it's the little things that count.  like freshly fried falafel with nice cucumber/eggplant/potato, excellent red base sauce and white sauce and the grilled wrap, the perfect touch at the end.  will be back for the shawerma (chicken on Tue/Fri)
author: Rob C.

description: If I lived near here, I'd be here all the time.  It reminds me of Little Cafe - this place that would deliver yummy Mediterranean food to campus at AU.  The falafel was good, cheap, and prepared me for a couple strong drinks at Elixir.
author: Gracie B.

description:
lamb schwarma, 4 stars.  
chicken kabob schwarma, 4.25 stars.

man, im not sure how to describe it.  
there's so few ingredients in there, but the result is very very delicious!  
service is down to earth friendly too.
author: Ethan L.

description:
Lamb Shawerma?  If you dont know, well now you know....eat that! I have only been once, and im sure that i will try the other items on the menu, but for now just eat that! 
I LOVE YELP, it is a tried and true way to find great food! After reading some of the reviews, i had to once again see what the hype was all about. This place is inexpensive, fast, and probably one of the best bangs for your buck in this city or ANYWHERE!! Make sure what ever you get you get it SPICY, and if your lucky to find a seat in the cramped and busy location take it, you don't want walking to distract you from the Shawerma, or rather you don't want to be distracted by the Shawerma while walking....dangerous! I will be a long time customer, and thank you Yelpers for the recommendations, you rock!
author: Leonard P.

description: I was there last night before bar hopping, grabbing a quick bite to eat. My two girlfriends and I all got the regular falafel, which was phenomenal. What was even more awesome was that we were the only three people eating inside at one point, and some crazy drunk dude was screaming profanities at/about us from outside, and all three chefs walked out and stood at the doorway like they were guarding us. Great late-night snack AND bouncer service? A+
author: Rosa C.

description:
definitely worth your money. 
mediterranean combo plate for $8.50? yes please.
easy in, easy out? yes please.
crunchy hot falafel with sesame seeds? yes, and yes please!

on a more detailed note, their baba ganoush was quite flavorful. i know a lot of mediterranean places can have a very bland baba ganoush. really delicious dolmas too :)

i'm definitely making this a regular take out spot.
author: Michelle K.

description:
Shawerma has been a huge part of my diet for the two months since I discovered this place.  Think of it like the In-N-Out for mediterranean food; simple but with its own style.  I also love the staff, as they seem like decent people and like they enjoy their work.

The shawerma is done burrito style with onions, amazing roasted tomatoes, lamb (or chicken depending on the day), garlic-mint yogurt, a "hot" sauce that is very mild, even when you respond to the "hot?" question affirmatively.  

I love this place like I love puppies.
author: Andrew M.

description:
i havent ate in.. but ordered here for work multiple times.. its affordable (non profit budget) and its only a block away

the food is always pretty good.. not amazing.. but good. 

they make a big bin of falafal and its ingredients and we kinda put them together.. so thats all ive tried 

its fal(awful).. jk.. i just wanted to make the joke.. we'll keep ordering from there.. but hope they spice it up.. hook a brotha up!
author: Art A.

description:
2 stars for the food. food was great. 
but i just dont think it was worth that much. $10 for one.
two lame
two drinks
total 28+tips

so my friend and i brought two lame favor
1st of all they dont put enough hot sauce and im a hot sauce lover. when my friend went to ask for extra hot sauce they only gave him one TINY to-go hot sauce. wasnt even enough for one person. this time I went inside to ask them for more hot sauce and the cashier didnt want to give it to me and wanted to charge me for it. he charged me for a dollar for hot sauce. i got piss i didnt even care i just gave them that one dollar SO I CAN ENJOY THE FOOD MORE. 
i was asking for alot of hot sauce PLUS UR HOT SAUCE CONTAINER WAS WAYYY WAYY WAYY TOOOO SMALL!!!!!!!!! 

if i knew they dont put enough hot sauce n only give tiny togo hot sauce i wouldnt have tip them. I WOULD GIVE THE TIPs TO BUY THEIR HOT SAUCE. 
$30 for two meals. i dont think it was worth it. 

TO THE OWNER OR MANAGER! YOU GUYS SURE DO NOT KNOW WHAT IS GOOD CUSTOMER SERVICE. EVEN WHEN PEOPLE GAVE YOU A TIPS U CANT EVEN SIMPLY TREAT THEM BETTER. 
i would not come back to your place even though your food was good. the reason y i would not come back because your customer service skill SUCKS. there are plenty other places that i could go too and i am sure they will appreciate their customers

so hot sauce lovers! prepare to be charge more for extra hot sauce
author: Jess I.

description:
a nice & friendly little place, but has only enough room for 5 people with a narrow counter inside and one outside table

the Lamb shawerma was very good and the service was excellent and very fast, I can tell this place gets lots of business, they even have home made yogurt drinks.

the menu is kind of small, not too many items, mostly wraps & salads
author: Mr Bolo B.

description: 4 words. CHICKEN SCHWARMA WITH EGGLPLANT. [only on Tuesdays & Fridays though]
author: Steph C.

description: the meat gyros are dericious here, never had a falafel, i need meat when i eat.  warrior hungry!
author: Pickle R.

description: On Tuesdays and Fridays you can have the chicken shawerma, which is the most fabulous meal you can find at this price anywhere. We love this place. Great fallafels as well.
author: margot b.

description: Best Falafel's in SF, hands down.  Definitely get it with the hot sauce.  Would be 5 stars but the place is soooo small (4 spots at a small counter) and very little seating outside.  I used this place 2x to cater for parties that I've had.  Great platters and always tasty.  The owner is nice also.
author: Mitch A.

description: Probably the best falafel in the city, and as good as any I had in Israel. Order the deluxe with added egglant and potatoes, and definitely say yes to the hot sauce, unless you're a fan of bland. The lamb kebab is worth the wait. This is a great place for vegetarians and/or night owls, because they have plenty of non-meat options and are open until 11:00pm Monday through Thursday, midnight on Friday and Saturday.
author: Gourmet G.

description: I really don't get what the hype is about here.  The falafel was really bland.  Ali Baba's on 19th and Valencia is way better.
author: Andrea S.

description: I think this is where I ate at the end of Happy Hour yesterday - It's all a bit fuzzy. If it is indeed where I procured my snack of some sort of random shwarma with hummus it was fan-dam-tastic...
author: Todd E.

description: It's all about the chicken shawerma.  But only if you are there on Tuesdays or Fridays cuz it's only available those two days.  Thankfully Nez and I fell into this place for lunch on a Friday.  Chicken shawermas eaten in Dolores Park were perfect.  Washed down with Diet Cokes and chased with some of their delicious homemade halvah and I'm in heaven.
author: Jill D.

description: Even food snobs like me can appreciate dives.  Fluorescent lighting, no-frills-everything, who cares?  The spicy lamb shwarma and falafel were damn good.  I think it was the yogurt sauce that really did it for me --- they've got that down.  And these wraps are huge.  Not huge enough to prevent BF and I from drilling the above two, but huge.  Why can't my yuppie neighborhood have a Truly Med?
author: Melissa B.

description: Here is a suggested method:  get your chicken shawerma or falafel-- add eggplant.  Then go over to dalva (bar next door) and grab a beer and eat there, they don't care and around dinner time the bar is empty.  Plus Dalva is a cool place, dark, good music, back room, rustically mission dist.
author: Brent H.

description:
When I was a youngster, I used to go to the Truly Med on Haight.  I remember standing in line, ogling the shawarma, when one of the guys behind the counter would yell, "NEXT!!!"  I'd tell him what I wanted and then about halfway through shawarma assembly he'd yell, "hot SAUCE!!" with just the slightest hint of a question mark at the end of the interjection.  To which I would say, "YES."  (Because I love hot sauce.)  It was a magical experience...

The Truly Med on Valencia is every bit as good, although I kind of miss hearing, "hot SAUCE!!!" while the dude's putting my wrap together.  Great falafel as well, although I think I prefer AliBaba on Lower Haight for that.
author: Alice T.

description: Get your Chicken Shawerma on today....MMmmmmm good stuff, and healthy too!
author: Arlene C.

description: Ali Baba's Cave is better. Just sayin'.
author: Maria D.

description: They kick out a very good vegetarian Mediterranean plate here. Also they do a very respectable shawerma. Reasonable prices for this small shop. The chili sauce is most likely homemade and is very good.
author: Brendan R.

description: One of the better falafels I've had in SF. Nicely spiced and crisp without being greasy, and I love the cucumber salad they throw in there. Very friendly service and super affordable prices, too!
author: Beth T.

description:
best falafel i've ever had. it was so moist and the tahini sauce is perfection atop it. 

i got the lamb kebab wrap which was a bad idea. the lamb came in big chunks and was really hard to bite off. i ended up having some bites of just cucumber and then some bites of just lamb. and by the end of the wrap i had tahini sauce all over my jeans.

i'll be sure to get the lamb schawerma and more falafels next time around.
author: Regina C.

description: Food is very good, best mediterranean Ive had in years.  This is a small hole in the wall with 6 bar stools and a table outside, best for takeout.
author: jonathan s.

description:
their generously sized falafels are the reason i keep coming back. 
i only wish their "spicy" sauce was kicked up about 1000 notches. i need FIRE hot sauce. 
 
it's a great place to get a quick lunch and the people are friendly too.
author: Mayson J.

description: The best chicken schwarma I've had since I moved here from LA.  Giant and cheap and juicy and flavorful (though, sadly, only served on tues and fri).  As an added bonus, the folks running the place were super nice and patient with all the crackheads coming in.  The only down side is that there isn't one closer to where I live or work-- though totally worth the BART trip from downtown when you need a real lunch time escape.
author: Samantha W.

description: My goodness, this place is heaven. The best falafel I have ever laid lips on. The sandwich is monstrous, packed with that perfect balance of spicy, salty, and savory. The wrap is grilled to seal in that mass of goodness and within minutes you are on your way to food heaven. This is a small, honest establishment that serves great food at incredibly reasonable price. Come hungry because the foot long (not exaggerating!)  falafel sandwich needs a fair amount of space to rest in your belly.
author: Nick K.

description:
goooooooooooooooood stuff.

please don't be afraid of the Athens Burger in a Pocket. It's f*ckin RAD!

Another Mission/Valencia place that's decently priced in an overpriced, overhyped neighborhood. 

Thank you [insert correct deity here] for Truly Mediterranean!
author: Tomas V.

description: I'd pass through a Hezbollah road block to get to one of their chicken shwarmas. There have been days that I've gone and not been able to get a chicken shwarma for some reason not explained to me. On those days I've resorted to the falafel. I usually tell myself  "I got to remember the chicken shwarma days" but have forgotten to do so for the past 13 years. I guess the falafel is so good that I never remember the chicken shwarma days, and when I DO get a shwarma it's like those fu@kin guys gave me a gift.  Walkin in from 16th St. with all the hipsters, or any of the "sters" or "istas" then into here is a nice trip. It's small,  not the cleanest, but not rank, with dope music out the a.m. radio type sh!t. You might think you found yourself in Lebanon  somehow, until you hear Spanish in the kitchen and remember you're in the good ol' U.S.A.!
author: santiago g.

description: Best Shawerma I've had in California hands down.  About 10 years ago, my buddy and I would drive an hour just to eat here.  The falafel is pretty impressive as well.  Nice and crisp on the outside and green on the inside.  Wish there was more seating though...
author: Jaweed B.

description: First time in years that I eat lamb. I usually don't like it, but this guys managed to serve it so good in the Shawerma that I enjoyed every single bite of it. The place is small, get it and go. I don't give 5 starts because the price is slightly ... I don't know. Could be $7 and I would eat here every day. Although the $8 for the Shawerma are justified. I guess that my limit for sandwiches these days is $7.
author: Javi V.

description: Hmmmm that place is good! I stopped there late at night after some pretty heavy drinking at Zeitgeist down the street, and we had deluxe falafel sandwiches. At first I was a little surprised by the price: $6.50 (falafel sandwiches go for $2 in NYC!), but when I saw the size of the thing and all the yummy ingredients they stuffed in there I quickly forgot about the price: the sandwich was the size of a big burrito, and tasted pretty amazing (but then again... what doesn't when you're drunk?!). The warm bread was especially delicious, and it was almost too big to finish. Great spot for a late night snack!
author: David S.

description: Yeah, you move to Texas and try and find a decent falafel. I triple dog dare you. Truly Mediterranean completely ruined my ability to enjoy falafel at most other places. Screw you, pita bread. You are just a dry, crumbling excuse for lavash, and not worthy of holding the delicious falafel, eggplant, onion and potato found in the falafel deluxe. I try to avoid eating things that are not deluxe.
author: Steven C.

description: I always use Truly Mediterranean as my prototypical example of 'good food' in the city.  I love diverse and good food, regardless of price.  I am willing to drop big bucks for good food at a good value just as much as I am willing to try some small, inexpensive place or (everything in between).  Truly Med is my example of one of the best inexpensive restaurants in the city.  It has a good selection within its genre (although I always seem to wend back to a regular falafel with hot sauce).  I always take out of town visitors to Truly Med as an example of great food at a reasonable price with a good flavor of San Francisco.
author: Mark M.

description: The best Shawerma I've had. Ever. The only bummer (not enough to dock a star) is that you can only get chicken on Tuesday and Friday and can't have lamb on those nights. I prefer lamb but my boyfriend won't eat it, so I have to come on chicken night or leave him at home to fend for himself.
author: Amber B.

description: Best damn chicken shawerma I have ever had.  Be sure to get it with the spicy sauce.  Drunk and crazy people provide free entertainment while you wait.  Awesome!
author: Leslie L.

description: This review is mostly for the lamb shawarma 'cause I've ordered that 99% of the time I've been there.   Everything has been said that there is to say about this place.  Since I moved out of SF, about 6 years ago, my mouth still watered at the thought of biting into the delicious shawarma. Well, I'm back.  I think I know what I'm having for lunch tomorrow...
author: N H.

description: Like truly mediterranean really needs another review. But I love this place, so why not. A little whole in the wall, no real place to sit aside from a few counter seats facing a mirror so you can watch yourself eat. But when it comes to flavor and authenticity Truly med is the place to go. My boyfriend and I have tried several other mediterranean places in the mission, but none compare to this one. We keep on wanting to try other places but it always ends up with us sayin "We should've gone to truly mediterranean". I recommend it to both meat and veggie eaters.
author: Aurore N.

description:
I have visited this place on many occasions and always wondered why there is such a confrontational attitude from the staff, including the owner.   I always feels like I'm being rushed or the person taking my order has something better to do.  I guess when the falafel craving hit, I forget everything else.  

Last night was no exception.  Not only was there no one being helped before me, there was no one after me and I still got the abrupt treatment.  

Furthermore, until wearing gloves becomes a Health Department requirement, dirt lodged under fingernails should be a no-no.  Is the  health and safety of your customers not important?  

Lastly, after my falafel wrap was put on the grill, the owner, who made my wrap, put his hand to his hair, ruffled it, and then put it back on the counter.  Then, he proceeded to break off part of a french fry and eat it...all right in front of me.  I only wonder what happens in the back.

My bug-eyed look didn't even solicit a trip to the hand sink.   The 2 wraps I bought went straight into the trash.   I will have to satisfy  my falafel craving elsewhere.
author: Raven N.

description: Their falafel wraps are better than their meat wraps.  But can't complain when I'm happily full for just $7-8.  Plus they take card. Tuesday and Friday are the days they serve chicken shwarma, but I'd rather just get the falafel.
author: Mercutio k.

description: I'm torn. I really liked the falafel roll. The falafels were crispy and the sauce and veggies in it were refreshing. But I didn't care for the lamb shwarma which is usually my fav. The lamb was very gamey and the spices were too overpowering for me. The size of the shwarma's are a great deal. I would come back again to try the other shwarmas.
author: Juju F.

description: The goodness of the lamb shawerma is indescribable. The lightly toasted wrap with the juicy lamb and the sauce...I only wished I lived in SF! 5 stars hands down, must try this place.
author: Sophie S.

description: Fabulous falafel and shawerma. Possibly the best lamb shawerma I have ever had. A good price considering the quality and quantity of food.
author: Dana L.

description: This place was soooooo yummy, and so cheap to boot! We got a little bit of everything, they have an entree that has a little piece of every kind of pie and whatnot. Extremely filling after a long day of walking around San Fran! Sad that we only discovered it on our last day, but I'll be back, muahahahahah!
author: Irene F.

description: its a tough world out there- esepcially a tough world when your tasty bite hsop is at the corner of 16 and valencia- I mean the competition is FIERCE. You've got pancho villa, Arinells Pizza, Pakwan, Gestalt Haus and lets not forget the bacon wrapped hot dog guy- all in a block! Well, Truyl med definately stands up to the challenge- their lamb schwarma was crazy good- and the owner was super friendly. The spicy sauce was spicy and damn, I can't complain about the portion size. Although I got a all blue-balled from thinking they were going to stick fries in my wrap- only to find out at zeitgeist there were none. Damn you frize! but hell yeah to everything else.
author: Tim V.

description:
seriously...the falafel deluxe (regular falafel wrap with grilled eggplant AND potatoes) is the best permutation of falafel ive ever had. 

however...the service here is kinda brusque though, and the FD comes out to almost $8. eh. that ingenuity of putting potatoes in falafel TOTALLY excuses it. TOTALLY.
author: sarah i.

description: Great service, awesome location- just up the block from the 16th and mission bart station, and terrific food!!  Yogurt mint garlic drink was super weird, but my boyfriend put it on the skwerma and it was great!
author: Crystal M.

description: This place has amazing shawerma, I actually drive up from Santa Cruz just to eat it.  And I know my shawerma, I've spent more time than I care to remember in the Middle East.  Plus, one time when I was there a middle-aged hooker flashed her breasts at me in broad daylight.  The guys behind the counter were laughing harder than I was.  If you want great shawerma, and fun, Truly Mediterranean is your place.
author: Jeffrey C.

description: I shared a chicken shwarma sandwich and a falafel sandwich. Both were OK. Very cheap, and tons of food.
author: Joshua S.

description:
Go for the specialties that Walid provides, this place is not a one trick pony. The yogurt garlic drink is awesome with the lamb shawerma, which turns on a spit. The desserts include walnut or pistachio baklava, never stale.

This place really is Mediterranean, unafraid to offer strong hearty flavors without dumbing them down for patrons from out of town of for the sake of adding in "Euro" blends, so it's not for the faint of heart. It's also a family operation and has been here for years. 

They do a good job catering also and pastries are made fresh for you. I got pastries made for my graduation and they were all eaten. Check it out!
author: Nan L.

description: Love this place.  I walk a long way just to get their dolma sandwich.  [I went to ali baba recently (was desperate for some falafel and don't recommend them) and there they said they couldn't put dolmas on my sandwich...even though they have them right there...?!!).  Love the tiny space.  Folks are always nice.  Food is always great!
author: Lisa A.

description: Just so so.  This isn't a restaurant, it's a mediterranean on the go place.  The chicken shwarma was a little low on the garlic and the hummus was just ok.  They take credit cards, and for hummus, a shwarma, and carrot juice, I paid about $15.  I guess that with so many amazing mediterranean places (see Sunrise Deli) I'm just not up for settling.
author: Jared F.

description: So even though I live in LA, I find that I've actually written a good number of reviews for restaurants in SF.  Maybe I'm spending way too much time in SF.  But I digress.  I thought Truly Med was quite tasty.  I just happened to hear of the place in a friend's passing conversation.  So, of course, I set out to try it.  The falafels were quite good...and the sandwich/wrap portions were great!!!  My only gripe was that the chicken shawerma is only available on certain days (Mondays and Fridays if memory serves).  Otherwise, it would have been a perfect experience!
author: Jason L.

description: Amazing lamb shawerma and falafel sandwich. Very filling . Good price . Will definitely be back .
author: Vibhore S.

description: The best chicken shwarma ever to be found is at this Truly Mediterranean hole-in-the-wall.  But be warned, if it is chicken shwarma you crave, you will not be satisfied unless you visit this establishment on a Tuesday or Friday.  The chicken shwarma is so the bee's knees, that one Friday when I tried to order it they had already run out.  Well they had almost run out, and only had enough for half of a shwarma.  I was so desperado for my chicken shwarma, that I told them it didn't matter, I would take the shwarma with half as much meat and extra fixings.
author: Sharon R.

description: I'm a fan of their deluxe falafel wrap.  It is composed of falafel, cucumbers, hot sauce, home cut french fries, fried eggplant, and tahini sauce.  It isn't the usual or standard Mediterranean fair; rather, its more like a falafel burrito but it does the trick!  The flavor is a nice mix of falafel, with a hint of heat, and cooled by the cucumber and tahini.  It is one of my favorite Mission treats.
author: Ron S.

description: i'm not a fan of lamb.  i've gone to this place several times and always order their chicken shawerma.  i believe they only serve it on fridays (unless that changed).  but it's very good.  2 thumbs up!
author: Kae B.

description:
no doubt the best falafels and schwarmas EVER. i've been to many places, SF, LA, NY, st. louis (yeah, don't ask), but nothing compares to those large, crispy, crunchy balls (dude, that sounds nasty). 

they used to have a location on haight and that's where i used to go, but it closed down a few years ago so when i'm back in the bay, it's off to the mission for either a kafta kabob, lamb schwarma, or falafel deluxe. the freshest ingredients, the tastiest hummus and sauces, and the right amount of hot sauce.

go there, get a quick, cheap meal and eat it while you check out the mission area.
author: Charles K.

description: Great for take out not a dine in kinda place! The shawermas are awesome although a lot for one person, sharing is a must!!
author: Viola A.

description: Great Falafel sandwiches, better than their meat ones. If it was not a bit too salty I would have given them 5 stars.
author: John D.

description:
Do you know how it is when you go to a highly rated place and expect too much and get a lil' disappointed for no reason at all? Well, that was my experience. I have no complains other than maybe that chicken is not served often and takes time to prepare while other dishes are ready all the time. 

We tried the lamb shwarma and chicken kabob wrap - the lamb is definitely better. The service is quick and they have counter space for maybe 4 people to eat but its better to take out.
author: sonali p.

description: Went here after reading the reviews think it would be great. eh. Portions are OK, but $8 for a shwarma...not as cheap as I was expecting. Very little flavour, bland would be a good description. Would not go back. There must be a better Falafel place in the city than this.
author: A S.

description: This is one of my go-to places for a falafel sandwich because it's got a great location and the sandwiches are very good.  The sandwich fillings are a little unusual -- I've never seen another place that puts cucumbers inside -- but tasty nonetheless, and *very* filling (I rarely finish my whole sandwich).
author: Suzanne K.

description:
Rating something 3-stars, according to Yelp, means 'A-ok'.  I think the 'Meh, I've experienced better' is more accurate for Truly Mediterranean, but I'll give it 3 stars because to me, that means more like 'so-so' or 'It'll do'.  I really wanted to like this place. Hole-in-the-wall, local, etc.  I was looking for gyros, but this place doesn't have them so I ordered the lamb kabab.  It just didn't satisfy.  The lamb was too chewy and tough, the wrap broke apart as I was eating it and it took about 20 minutes for my order to be up.
Maybe I'll try it again, but I'll steer clear of the kabab and try the Mediterannean combo instead.
author: J M.

description: I would cross rivers, valleys and climb the highest mountains for these Shawerma. Luckily I live in SF and have to do none of those things to get one. I do have to wait in line while they make them and drool my last bit of saliva that didn't escape knowing I was on my way to enjoy one of these middle eastern treats. The falafel rocks too, but I think the Bluefront on Haight tops them on the falafel scene. Hands down the best of the best Shawerma's. Chicken Tuesdays, but Lamb is good everyday. If parking were the slightest bit reasonable I would invent the Shawerma only diet, making me rich or really fat - one of the two.
author: Mike C.

description: I find myself making excuses to come here once a week for the shwarma. I crave the roasted meat, toasted shwarma...mmm...Do I have an addiction problem?
author: Sirima S.

description: These guys have the best shawerma in SF, probably in the world.  I'm a big shawerma fan to begin with, but since I've discovered this place I go miles out of my way about once a week just to get one of these.  Their hummous is also top notch.  I don't know about anything else on their menu as it would be impossible for me to go there and resist the lamb shawerma.  Anyway, if you like shawermas, this place can't be beat.
author: Sam N.

description: I totally agree with Maiko - the only thing that's missing at Truly Mediterranean is all the fantastic extras you can put on the falafel at Maoz in Holland.  Depsite that though, if you're the Mission and have got a craving, skip Cable Car Pizza and get over to TM.  Then take that falafel to one of your favorite bars where you can sit comfortably with a beer and a full belly.
author: kerry l.

description: I love the deluxe falafel! It has eggplant! Yummy hummus and tahini, too.
author: Ray D.

description: The feta pita, the baba ganoush, the hot sauce. It's fast, hot, and cheap. Seating's a little lacking, but the diverse staff makes the counter experience worthwhile.
author: Seiji C.

description: They got some fine shwarma at Truly Med.  I love the spice and the sauce.  They do it up good.  I sure wish the upper Haight location was still there.  I'd be eating it even more.
author: Chard M.

description: I came here for dinner on Tuesday night. Lucky for me there was chicken on the spit that night. They let the chicken drippings fall on chunks of tomatoes that they use in your shawerma. It made the tomatoes awesome. This is a great deal for such a low price. It lasted me for two meals!
author: stephanie l.

description: BANG! Best shawarma I've had... seriously. The food is tremendous. Stopped here with some friends last night on the way to pub. Very small place, only a few seats... grab your food and take it on a walk with you.
author: tyrus s.

description: The best for what it is. Staff is cool, service is as quick as it can be (not unusual for a line out the door). My favorite is the chicken shwarma (only available on Tuesdays and Fridays).
author: Raf Z.

description: i can never get enough of this place, and share it with everyone I know to spread the delicious love!!!
author: Bill L.

description: This is the best falafel I have ever had. I can't wait to go back for another wrap. It was clean, fast and totally authentic. The Baklava, was PERFECT! YUMMMY!!!!!
author: Erica C.

description: Falafel ball with Tahini sauce is excellent & the Chicken Shawerma is great I'm stuck on these two items that I haven't tried anything else.
author: monica f.

description: I wanted to give it five, but they weren't exactly nice to me.  I went in and asked for the kefta and they said it would take too much time...essentially, no.  As-a-matter-of-fact, as I went down the list of items, the only thing they said they could do easily was their specialty, which I ordered and was awsome...it just wasn't what I wanted.  the place was failry affordable and the flavors were awesome...a med. burrito!!
author: Jake H.

description: Lamb shawarma with eggplant and potatoes= Heaven after my hellish experience with T Mobile.
author: k f.

description:
sure its not a cheap shawarma, but its good.  big, hot, and juicy.  thats what she said.

whenever i'm around, i come here.
author: Jason J.

description: Hayes & Kabob is better for a few extra dollars.
author: LT B.

description:
It was good, but for the price, it was just ok.  $8 for a chicken shawarma lavash wrap is a bit much.  The shawarma was tender and juicy, but not as flavorful as I'm used to.  Maybe I'm just spoiled after eating the chicken shawarma plate for 5 years at Mediterranean Cafe in Pasadena before moving up here.  The same $8 would've gotten me a plate full of juicy, tender, super flavorful chicken served over rice pilaf, accompanied by greek salad, humus, and pita bread.  Of course, I'm sure their rent is cheaper too, this place being in the middle of Mission, so the $8 price tag is understandable.

I will be back to try the falafel and vegetarian offerings.  According to the other reviews, those seem to be the standouts.
author: Chris C.

description:
The lamb shawarma is huge and pretty tasty. No complaints. 

I ordered a side of hummus and it was underwhelming. Bland hummus and bland pita -- the dry floppy kind that you can get in any corner store.

That said, it's a tasty hole-in-the-wall with good portions. Recommended when you want to fill your stomach on the go.
author: Ilya S.

description: While I do love the food here, I refuse to be regularly subjected to the staff's dumbass mediterranean indifference. It's as if everything you ask for creates a terrible hardship for them and they'd much rather just sit back and listen to the terrible arabic techno music they seem to be blasting all the time. Sometimes good food is worth sacrificing one's dignity, but there are many other places in the city with food that may not be as tasty, but leave a better taste in my mouth.
author: Tal K.

description: love is a battlefield, but lamb schwaerma is not. I add feta and potatos and make it spicy and im in love and it does not hurt this love I feel inside
author: Lauren V.

description:
OK all you fellow falafephiles, I have to say that Truly Mediterranean is really growing on me......that's not really doing it justice, I'm actually starting to love this place.  

So a little background:  Before I moved to San Francisco, I felt pretty familiar with the Middle Eastern culinary arts, particularly Lebanese and Syrian cuisine.  I went to college in Montreal, Canadia where you're literally tripping over Lebanese fast food joints.  All you Habitants know what I'm talking about.  Falafel, shish taouk, shawarma, kafta kebabs with rice pilaf and roasted potatoes and creamy garlic mayo and delicate, flaky baklava oozing with honey and pistachios and................ excuse me, I'm having a moment..............

........... talk amongst yourselves.

............OK, I'm done.  Anyway all of these wonderful things were our lunches, our dinners and our late-night, post-clubbing, drunken food orgies (along with Madonna Pizza but that's another story:).  So I have a very clear picture of what a falafel sandwich for example should look like, smell like and  taste like, i.e. deep fried nuggets of delicious chickpea meal, with humus, fresh lettuce, tomato, pickled turnip (dyed an ungodly hot pink for some reason) and garlic mayo, all wrapped up in a pita and grilled on a sandwich press.  That's how we kicked it La Metropole style.

So imagine my skepticism going to Truly Mediterranean for the first time and ordering a falafel and seeing the guy whip out a giant sheet of lavash, smear it with hot sauce (hot sauce??), onions, and diced cucumber salad (the humanity!!), falafel balls and yogurt sauce???  I wanted to say "Dude, you're doing it wrong!!  Haven't you ever been to Montreal?"  Well despite my consternation at having my falafel world-view turned on it's ass (we can say ass on Yelp right?) it turned out that it was actually DELICIOUS!  I continued investigating this newly discovered bizzaro world of Middle Eastern food with the lamb shawarma (equally delicious, with tender morsels of lamb shaved off the rotating meat thingy, marinated onions, parsley, roasted tomatoes, and hot sauce (tastes like harissa) and wrapped in lavash bread).  I'm totally sold.  I now crave this stuff on a daily basis.  I'm looking forward to venturing further and sampling the "deluxe" falafel (which adds pickled eggplant and fried potatoes into the mix) and some of the chicken and lamb kebabs.  The garlic and mint yogurt drink is also intriguing.

Turns out that the owners of the restaurant are Jordanian and not Lebanese or Syrian. Perhaps there are regional differences in some of these dishes? 

In any event, I've come around and am now a very big fan of Truly Mediterranean despite my preconceived notions of what "real" Middle Eastern cuisine should be. Can't we all just get along?
author: Alexander J.

description: Lamb schwarma with extra hot sauce and onions is the way to go.  The chicken schwarma is decent but doesn't compare to the lamb. Very filling.
author: Mike A.

description: So I was craving hummus and babaganoush (sp?) so we decided to check Truly out because of the reviews it got (granted most of the great reviews were for their shwarma) and there's a reason for that...BECAUSE the hummus et-al was not very good...IF you're going for the shwarma then it's good and that's why I gave 3 stars (my hubby had that) I had the combo plate and my experience was as follows: tabouleh - bland; cucumber salad - bland; hummus -meh; babaganoush- meh...dolmas were ok and their falafel was pretty good...SO will I come back...probably only to try the shwarma but next time I want Hummus and babaganoush I'll take the trip to Sunnyvale and go to DishDash....
author: Karen B.

description: Not sure why people love this place. It's pretty average. It's got a great location, that's for sure. Just go three blocks down to Ali Baba's Cave. It's cheaper and better.
author: Paul W.
