description: The food here is very good, although I was disappointed that I couldn't get a Shawarma plate.  Not the best (fast) Mediterranean food in the city, but very good.
author: Lucas M.

description: Oh how I miss our Truly Mediterranean in North Beach!  I was around 16th yesterday and I was thrilled to be able to enjoy those fantastic falafels again.  There is actually a little ache in my heart, I miss them so much. Sigh.
author: Hayley W.

description:
The spicy sauce "dries out" the shawerma a bit, because it is more pasty than a thick chili liquid, which on the plus side doesn't soak through the wrap and therefore holds well when taking out, but I think next time I'll ask for extra yogurt sauce, which was divine. The meat was succulent--you can see them carve it out of a heaping mound on their rotating spit; just watching it and absorbing all the aroma... mouth watering! The rest of the filling is standard and very complementary; I love what they use for the wrap. Versus a pita or tortilla-esque wrap like some other places, they put it on lavash, a first for me. Awesome, perfect wrapping material.
Reasonable pricing for dinner fare, about $8 for a lamb shawerma; service is speedy and very friendly, and the place is immaculate for an over-the-counter eatery.
I agree with Giedon K. that this is a Take-Out only place; the stool and bar for "seating" are far too few and cramped to be able to truly enjoy your meal (plus it's a little weird to stare into a mirror and watch yourself scarf down food... it's almost like you're having an eating contest with yourself?).
Food a-plenty, I will be back for sure, especially to try out the chicken shawerma which is only served twice a week and therefore, makes it mysterious and worthy of my curiosity.
author: Jessica L.

description: I have had shawirma all over the states and the world.  LA, NY, DC, TX, FL, Dubai, Jordan...etc etc etc   This is hands down the best, ok except for Shawirma Reem in Jordan.  But definitely the best in the US!!!!!!!!   It is sad that they had to close their other locations but everytime I come to San Fran my first stop from the airport is Truly Mediterranean!!!!!  Truly the best!!!!!
author: Saleem M.

description: Perfect for a dine and dash, since there aren't too many seats.  Food is great, and the service...if you have a good sense of humor...is really good.
author: Mark D.

description: This is my favorite falafel in the U.S.of A. Order the deluxe with the eggplant and fries inside. Chicken schwarma available on special days is also good. Call me crazy but I'm way into the yogurt garlic drink. Yum!
author: Thanya S.

description: If you're a big fan of the Shawerma this is the place to go. The meat is perfectly seasoned and whatever goes in the Shawerma is yum! I always get the hummus as well, it's mild and creamy and most important fresh.
author: Monica S.

description: Truly Mediterranean has never let me down.  In fact, they seem to be getting better!  Newly remodeled interior makes it much less intimidating for the uninitiated, and the food is as good if not better than before.  Don't let it's appearance fool you.  This place has the single best Shawarma (Chicken or Lamb), Mediterranean combo plate, and some of the best falafel I have ever had.  I eat here at least twice a month, so look for me cutting in line to order since you probably don't know exactly what you want.
author: Chris P.

description: The only place that has falafel I like better than Truly Med is Maoz in Holland.  Since getting a Maoz falafel would cost me hundreds of dollars and some vacation time, I'll gladly take Truly Med's falafel deluxe with its holy trinity of falafel, fried eggplant, and french fries.  I love watching the guys skillfully assemble everything at lightning speed--from spreading the harissa and smooshing the falafels to the final drizzling of tahini and wrapping everything up, each person has his own flourishes.  Then, the whole shebang gets some time on the grill so it comes to you hot, with the edges of the lavosh a little crisp.  I love the Middle Eastern dance music they play, too.  Just make sure you stick to this location because the others are not as good.
author: maiko h.

description: Awesome shawerma, probably the best in the bay area.
author: Ossama A.

description: Goddamn the falafel rules!  So does the shawerma!
author: Larry A.

description: I enjoyed the lamb shawarma. The falafel from the combo plate was really good too. Service was fast.
author: Bill K.

description: People are going to hate me for this review.  I'm going to hate myself for this review.  I've only been here once - I think I've found out that I'm not a big fan of flafels nor am I a big fan schwarmas.  Feels like a Greek burrito to me and I'm probably not far off from the truth but I prefer to stay Mexican.  At first you might think I can't handle the spicy - but that's definitely not it as I eat damn spicy kimchi with a passion.  All my classmates who've been here seem to genuinely love it  so I'm all for recommending it, but I would probably walk down a block to Pancho Villas while they're getting their lamb scharmas...
author: Sokokyu K.

description:
i came here before going to watch a movie at the roxie which is right next door and ordered myself a lamb shwarma and fell in love. the place is small with a row of bar seats at a small counter but otherwise, this is definitely more of a take out place or to hop in for a quick bite to eat.

its cheap and and best of all, they wrap it nicely in foil for you so its easy to eat while walking. i definitely want to come back.
author: georgette y.

description:
After discovering last week what a total sham Ali Baba's Cave was, I found myself still in need of satisfying my falafel craving . . . so I went to the good ol' faithful of Mission falafel, Truly Med.
Did they disappoint?
Oh, hoho, no.
The deluxe falafel is basically the most amazing falafel wrap ever. I don't know how to describe it beyond that, 'cause I immediately start thinking, "Mmmm, eggplant and potatoes . . ." *drool* It's also enough to feed me for two meals, so I get to revisit my amazing wrap for lunch again today, and my stomach is totally growling with anticipation already.
The service isn't the most amazing in the world, but the food is fast and fresh, and if you ask them to make it extra spicy, they'll line that lavash with chili sauce, so no points lost, there.
Also, this is definitely not a great eat-in place, but it's a hole-in-the wall falafel joint, so you kinda pay for what you get, there. Besides, getting amazing food for the price of just a little bit of exercise never hurt anyone. :)
author: Erin P.

description: Oh man I love this place. Whether I just got off the 16th/mission bart, or blacked out wandering the mission, my salivating mouth always brings me back. Ok, it does wreck my digestive system, but I can usually blame that on all the tecate that I pair with it. Maybe keep a 2x week limit.
author: Charles W.

description:
the lamb shawarma was as every bit as good as fellow yelpers were saying. the lamb was well seasoned and the tahini sauce was fantastic. 

don't let the $8 price tag fool you. from other comments, i was expecting a measly portion of food. definitely not the case though. the $8 gets you full and satisfied. i just got back to work from lunch and am totally feeling the food coma.
author: Maveric V.

description: I'd been telling my girlfriend about this place since we were craving some good Mediterranean food. Hadn't been here in awhile. So prior to a show we swung by for a quick bite. Forgot how good the Lamb Schwarma is. Love the "Soup Nazi'ish" guy taking orders. It's super quick but one of the best Schwarmas. So good we went back this Saturday for lunch.
author: Hyung L.

description: Boy oh boy oh boy. The deluxe falafel here rocked my world, and my gut later on but that is another story. The fellas here take a pita and slab hot sauce, hummus, lettuce, tomato, falafel, roasted eggplant, and spuds into it. The sandwich is then grilled on both sides and is rushed into a waiting layer of tinfoil which keeps it hot. Do I have your attention? The only drawback to coming here are the absurd prices.....$7 plus tax for a falafel sandwich is simply greedy and $10 for a combination plate is asinine. Those are fine dining prices and this is a spot with a grill, employees, and a bench with four or so seats......c'mon now. Hence, there are plenty of other similar eateries in this area serving the same product for nearly $2 less. You're beter off hitting up Ali Baba's Cave a couple blocks up on Valencia.
author: Kenny G.

description:
i dunno, i had the falafel deluxe last night and was not blown away.  the "potatoes" looked more like french fries to me (who puts french fries in a falafel???).  and although the top half was piping hot, it got progressively colder the further down i went.  oasis grill in the financial district (extra hot sauce, please!) is still tops in my book.

extra star for using lavash instead of pita...

...may go back for the chicken shawerma...
author: Kenji K.

description: The chicken schwarma deluxe makes this one of my favorite restaurants.  You have to go on Tuesday or Friday.  Of course, if you eat lamb, you can go any day of the week (well, except Tues/Fri).  The people that work here couldn't be nicer.  They always make me feel welcome.  There really isn't any seating and that is sad, BUT you can go right next door to Dalva and eat your schwarma there.  This place is reasonably cheap and they make your food right there while you are watching.
author: Jenn M.

description: Honestly the best Shwarma's and Falafel's!!! My mouth is watering just thinking about them....mmmmmm!!! Awesome place...i just wish they had a llittle more room to sit...
author: Steph S.

description: Even though the guys that work there look me up and down in smarmy ways, they make that falafel deluxe so fast that I can deal and get out the door.  I wonder if it's a good thing that I live so close to this place!
author: Rhea S.

description: I go here for the falafel. It's a serious feast. Add hot sauce if your heart desires. You know I will.
author: Sommer N.

description: The food is ok. The falafel is good but little spicy. Shawerma is not recommended. It is very greasy. The worst thing about this place is it's employees. They have very bad attitude and It looks like they just do not care and miserable.
author: steve r.

description: I went to get a Lamb & Beef shawerma, and it was delicious. Good quick service.
author: G G.

description: I've always enjoyed the food here... especially the Lamb Shwarma deluxe... but now that they've actually remodeled the place and added some nice counters and prep area, this place has come up from good to GREAT... ergo the 5 star rating, cause the food speaks for itself, and the place is now more appetizing to order at... and the food is great!
author: Vlad C.

description: Pretty darn tasty.  Disclaimer: I was under the influence while eating and writing this. I tried to dougie while holding my half of the lamb shwarma wrap...spilled all over. Not cool.
author: Jo W.

description: A San Francisco classic. Been going here since the early 90s. Great, big falafels, stuffed with all the expected flavors and some unexpected ones too -- french fries inside? Okay, great.
author: Stephan C.

description: Love their chicken schwarma sandwiches! My office was addicted to these and used to go to the North Beach location all the time before they closed that store. Looks like we have to head down to the Mission now.
author: Stephanie I.

description: The falafels at Truly Mediterranean are truly fantastic.  I think falafel is the perfect food (there's nothing like fried ground chick peas with herbs and spices), and Truly Mediterranean makes them to perfection.  The Mission location is quite small; there's some counter seating inside and couple of tables outside so if you go there prepare to get food to go.  But don't let the size fool you. Good things come in small packages, and Truly Mediterranean is no exception.
author: Rick K.

description: Simple spinning meat wraps that were so mouth-watering, juicy and in pretty big portions. Super busy and lots of takeouts but you can still squeeze a seat or two and enjoy the aroma while you are already indulging the food.
author: T L.

description: This is where you get the best falafel sandwich in San Francisco.  It just rocks with it's hummus.  The only thing is there really isn't much space to sit down there.  But take it to go and you won't be sorry.
author: Jonny G.

description: Good food, fast service.  Not much in the way of seating though.  The comparrison to Moaz in Holland is perfect.
author: Nelson A.

description: I used to live two blocks away from this place years ago. My thing was to avoid the line. So, I would call ahead and surpass the line and pick up my order. Especially on Tuesday and Friday which is Chicken Shawerma day. I went here the other day and it is still great food,fast and friendly service. They always play the best music too. I love their lamb.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
kokkari minus the bill minus the ambiance plus a little mission charm equals truly mediterranean. 

combo platter and a diet coke? done and done
author: Laura A.

description: I saw this place I believe on Bay Cafe and decided to give it a shot. I waited until Friday because that's when they serve chicken and I'm not a big fan of lamb or beef. It honestly was just OK. It looks better than it tastes. I would not go out of my way to eat there again but if I happened to be in the area in search of a quick bite I would stop by.
author: Diane M.

description: One of those cheap, but awesome hole-in-the-wall places.  I had a tasty Shawerma... Jeremy had a falafel deluxe that looked pretty good, too.
author: Brandon B.

description: I just tried this place. I got falafel with no onions and no hot sauce, added in some hummus. So deeelish! After an hour I almost wanted to go back and get another. The falafel deluxe has FRENCH FRIES! and eggplant. Must try soon...
author: Alyssa C.

description:
the Chicken Shawerma on tuesday and friday is worth the trip alone.  in fact, everything i've had here has been excellent.

limited seating, and it gets crowded, so you might want to call ahead and take it to go
author: Steve S.

description:
greek meets mexican... sort-of.  

good spot for a quick, tasty and cheap eat before you head to the bart...

i especially like the falafel and kefta kabob!  the kefta takes a bit longer than the other entrees, but i think it's well worth it.
author: Jill k.

description: Really good, dependable, affordable food...the falafel wraps are delicious.  It's a great hole-in-the-wall type of place that doesn't sacrifice any authenticity.
author: Debbie Y.

description: The best god dam falafel wrap. I get the deluxe with hummus and no eggplant and just a touch of that deadly hot red paste.
author: Scott M.

description:
the epitome of 5 minute food. get the schwarma, it's a medi-take on the burrito and sooo good. spicy sauce, yogurt sauce, grilled chicken. lettuce and tomato. get extra sauce. 

this is the perfect place to run in and grab a shwarma when you're too busy drinking in the mission to wait for a table. it's fast and cheap and so unbelievably yummy. the guys behind the counter are super friendly and nice and know what they're doing. plus you get a lot of meat in that thing. it's worth the $7.
author: rachel p.

description: Their falafel is great for vegetarians... I usually get it light on tahini and heavy on spicy sauce.  I used to eat here almost every night (kind of sad) when I first moved to the Mish, and I never got tired of it.  The place is small but that's part of the Truly Med experience :-)
author: Braden T.

description: I've loved this place since the early 90's.  You can't go wrong with the Fallafel Deluxe with extra Hummus or the Chicken Shwerma!
author: Carlos W.

description: Definitely eat here!  Falafel Delux!  The guys behind the counter are always in good spirits and the food has never treated me wrong.  I've been eating there for years and should have posted this sooner.
author: Thump T.

description: I don't give a perfect rating often and I can only speak for the falafel sandwich w/o potatoes and w/hot sauce. One of my all-time favorite meals in the world. I have driven with my knees to scarf down this meal. It's an SF staple at this point and if you haven't indulged, brave the parking demons and find your way home...
author: Phil M.

description: I miss their upper Haight location.
author: Philip M.

description: I hate to disagree with T-Bone as it might get me pounded but I think TM is utterly ordinary. A few dishes are above par but I tend to imagine most the food as what a really good cafeteria in Lebanon would serve.
author: patrick g.

description: Oh my God is this place good. If you like spicy, you have a food orgasm ahead of you. If you don't like spicy... I really can't say what you'll think of it.  More free advice (which is the point of yelping, isn't it?):  go to the Truly Med on 16th & Valencia, it's actually A LOT better than the other locations.  Also, get the chicken shwarma rather than the lamb - but it's only available Tuesdays and Fridays.
author: Debbie A.

description: One of the few mediterranean restaurants that I can trust.  Their prices are resonable and the food is good.  Too bad they closed their north beach location that had seating.   Besides the plastic chairs out side, you need to eat your food somewhere else.  Try the super falafel extra spicy and add chicken schwarma to it.  It will cost you about 8-9 bucks, but its worth it.
author: Jason A.

description:
had some pretty tasty lamb shawermas, but you have to pay 75 cents extra for the eggplant... 
pretty tasty stuff
author: charlotte s.

description: Cheap and yummy.  But ali baba's cave is MUCH better,  and you can sit down to eat (truly med. dosent have any seating to speak of).  This place is great for a quick to-go tho...
author: Matt G.

description: Excellent quality and service.  Ordered a large platter over the phone for party snacks.  Platter was ready when I arrived.  Everything on the platter was delicious from the hummus to the dolmas to the baba ganoush to the chunks of feta.  Highly recommend.
author: David C.

description: Great tasting falafels from a relatively tiny establishment.
author: ITesh J.

description: I don't eat the baa or the moo, but I go to Truly Med for the bak bak and the feelawful. I can say those are two of my favorite wraps and they're always ass kickin' spicy, delicious and cheap! Plus my favorite ass hat wearing buddy works here on Fridays so I pop in just to harass her while I get my stomach ready for the debauchery to follow.
author: Colleen B.

description: My hunt for the best falafel has ended here. Very inexpensive, quick, and the hot sauce is amazing.  It's very small, and the seating is limited, but you can  take your falafel next door to Dalva and order a cocktail.
author: Crystal R.

description: I've read most of the reviews, and I have had falafel and shawerma in many locales across this great globe.  Yes they don't season they're tabouleh, or cuc salad, however they're baba and hummus are quite tasty.  They cook there shawerma a bit too long for my taste but when the tomatoes are cooked down in the dripping juices and the falafel are fresh . . . oh boy!  I eat here twice a week, the rest, I cook for myself or eat at Tokyo Go Go or Oyaji.
author: Greg M.

description: Truly Med is pretty dope, but even if you're feeling adventurous, don't bother with the garlic yogurt drink.
author: David K.

description: I'd never even heard of a shawarma, let alone tried one, until my brother recomended this little hole in the wall place. Turns out, shawarma's are delicious! I can't vouch for anything else but I've had me at least 5 or 6 of those lamb shwarma's and they're consistantly good. If you want something to fill you up before a night of heavy drinking or otherwsie, but you're getting sick of the usual burrito fare, then try a variation on a standard theme and give it a shot. The prices are decent and the service quick. I should also note I don't really like lamb but these get an A!
author: Jeff S.

description: Amazing simplicity that is both amazingly tasty and satisfying to the extreme!  Truly Mediterranean is the definition of a hole in the wall and basically designed as a walk-in, get-out type of establishment (if you can call it an establishment) without seating as such, but it serves up tasty falafel wraps.  Truly Mediterranean may be a hole-in-the-wall, but the food is fast, tasty, and, yes, truly Mediterranean.
author: Matt P.

description: There are just some times when you feel like shwarma. Every now and then my friend will text me with, "mmmm shwarma..." And for a split second, I am green with envy. And when ever I am in the Mission, I try to stop at Truly Mediterranean for some good ol' fashion lamb shwarma. On Tuesday and Fridays, they have chicken chwarma too, but I think the lamb is the best. There are huge pieces of lamb, onions, tomatoes, hummas, and tahini sauce all wrapped up in flatbread heaven. There is also a few options for sweet desserts too. MMMM Shwarma...
author: Jan Z.

description: Best shawarma I ever had.  A fantastic place, should be a frigging chain!
author: david s.

description: one of my favorite mediterranean restaurants in the city. love the lamb shawerma as well as the babaganoush.
author: Helen T.

description: Oh MY God. This place was so yummyyyyy. I went here with some friends and we got our food to go and ate it in Dolores Park which was the perfect way to enjoy such delicious food. Now its 2:30 in the morning and I'm craving some falafel and hummus. Mmmmmmmmm.
author: Katie A.

description: Very tasty lamb and chicken Shawerma wraps!
author: Ryan C.

description: It's mediterranean, not pure greek - but darn good (cheap and fast).
author: Brian P.

description: Delicious, cheap, fast, and friendly service.  My favorite spot for a lunch break!
author: Lindsey W.

description: As already written, good fare for low prices.  The shawarma is better, though, at Good Frikin Chicken.
author: Helen C.

description: Falafel Deluxe: best...falafel...ever... The chicken shawerma doesn't exactly live up to the hype, but it IS pretty damn tasty.
author: Maximillian M.

description: I got some food from Truly Mediterranean for my birthday party -- the appetizer platters, filafels and lamb shawerma. EVERYTHING was sooooo good, my mouth is watering even when I just think about it. I know everyone else already commented about it, but I agree -- noone else makes shawerma like this one. The food was very cheap too -- about $130 for 30 people and we couldn't finish it. And they let me  place my order just a day in advance, which is totally awesome, because you know, planning in advance is hard ;)
author: Mira S.

description: I've gotten the falafel deluxe every time I've been there, and it is delicious. Every component is perfect. I also love the inclusion of eggplant and potatoes in the wrap, and they give you as much or as little sauce as you want so that the kick you get from it is to your taste. It's a hole-in-the-wall, but it provides yummy, cheap eats.
author: Jenny O.

description: Good food + Beautiful day to sit outside + No space inside + Hunger = Match made in heaven
author: Audrey N.

description: The falafels at Truly Mediterranean are truly fantastic.   (there's nothing like fried ground chick peas with herbs and spices), and Truly Mediterranean makes them to perfection.  The Mission location is quite small; there's some counter seating inside and couple of tables outside so if you go there prepare to get food to go.  But don't let the size fool you. Good things come in small packages, and Truly Mediterranean is no exception.
author: Joe M.

description: My KINGDOM for a TM Chicken Shawarma!  We used to live around the corner from Truly Mediterranean's Haight Street shop.  My husband and I ate Chicken Shawarma, Double Meat, Double Hot Sauce, at least twice a week.  We live on the East Coast now (wrong turn after 16 years in San Francisco), and I have to say, THIS is the one thing that I have not found a suitable replacement for.  There is nothing that comes close, in San Francisco, NYC, Boston, DC, anywhere.  Be glad you have Truly Med and eat there often.
author: Malia O.

description: Now that I'm on a tight budget I can't eat here anymore, but if your able and willing to pay $8 for a lamb shawarma, Do It!  Soooo, good.
author: Stephnie K.

description: Great lamb shawarmas. The falafels are are awesome to bad they closed the Berkeley restaurant. But overall one of the best eateries around.
author: Adrienne H.

description: Probably one of the best falafel wraps that I've ever had.  I wanted to order everything.  Beware:  Shawerma's sell out.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
another great place not everyone knows about ... so far.

the chicken shawerma is out of this world !  as mentioned below, it's good to ask for items spicy ... it's surprisingly not too spicy but it does gives each dish a nice depth.

also delicious is the falafel deluxe.  

at lunchtime, there are usually a few people in line ... don't let that discourage you from going ... the staff is very attentive and will keep things moving quickly.

LOVE truly med!
author: Noah C.

description: I thought the falafel at the Haight one, when it was still there, was better, but it's still awesome at this location too....I crave this place regularly.
author: Laura S.

description: I have been going to this place since my college years in the '90s.  They are really as good as it gets for falafel.  I always have the Falafel Deluxe and my husband the Lamb Shawerma and it just tasty and delicious.  There are only maybe 6 seats inside the place but we still enjoy eating it there while still fresh from the grill.  But with the foil wrap, they stay warm and toasty still when we take it to Ocean Beach, Marina or the Golden Gate Park.  This place has never failed.
author: Mavis G.

description: the best chicken shwarma i've ever had in my LIFE....no joke....they only make it on tues and fri....put it in your calandar!
author: Ulysses B.

description: I took a girl from Israel here and she said it was the best falafel she'd ever had.  This place is thoroughly enjoyable and delicious.  Two days a week they have chicken shawerma that is not as good as the lamb, but still pretty good.
author: matthew w.

description: I love their dolmas and feta (they must make this fresh, moist cheese homemade - nothing like it).  Unique (and delicious) falafel, strong use of sesame seeds, gives a nice crispiness and flavor.
author: babsie g.

description: This tiny little place makes monstrous falafel! It's on the way home from BART, and it's quick, and it's cheap. And it's really yummy. As a result, my husband and I have been eating them all the freaking time. Seriously, we've both been working mad hours lately, and I pick them up about once a week, and he often has them 2-3 times a week (especially when I grab dinner at the office). And there's no getting sick of these great little meals wrapped in foil, they're that good. They put nice hot sauce in the mix to spice it up. And the guys who work there are always so nice, even when they're busy.
author: Amy K.

description: I love falafel and it's really good here.  I don't mess with the deluxe business.  Just a regular spicy falafel.
author: Scott W.

description: For about $6 you'll get the best falafel you've ever tasted: every bite is perfectly balanced with falafel, tahini sauce, and chopped cucumbers, all perfectly grilled together so it won't fall apart (it's big, so if you're not in the mood for a burrito, this is the perfect replacement). This is definitely a "grab and go" type of place (there's little to no seating), which makes sense given it's location: it's a tiny spot  (easy to miss)next door to the Roxie and is convenient to all of the 16th street and Valencia bars. Clean, open late, and takes credit cards in case you dropped all your cash on alcohol. Great for a quick, healthy, and cheap meal.
author: Y H.

description: Juicy, consistent, authentic falafels and shawarmas.  Great place for a quick bite while on the run.
author: V C.

description: we shared a falafel wrap, which was huge.  the people who worked there were friendly and happy to cut the wrap into thirds for us.  i liked that they grill the wrap for a minute to give it a nice texture and flavor.  the wrap was jammed full of tahini, cucumber, tomato, and, of course, falafel.  a lot of food for a pretty good price.  we also shared the tabouleh salad which had a citrus flavor.  this was a good place for a quick bite when we were in a bit of a hurry, and everything nearby was more of a sit-down situation.
author: micaela r.

description: Best falafel in SF in cool Mission digs.
author: Patrick B.

description: Consitant and delicious. Friday's chicken shwarma is a mainstay for me.
author: H. Joseph E.

description: Not your ordinary falafel!!!  WOW!  This is the best falafel I've ever had.  Nuff said.  With perfection comes one minor problem... your breath will be ruined for an entire day.  Go eat one and then jump on a crowded BART train and start quietly burping.  Soon you will have plenty of space on the train and a happy stomach too!
author: Doug A.

description: Are you kidding me? Best in the city, on the coast, in the country, you name it. This place is consistency personified. I've never, ever been disappointed here and have probably eaten it 100 times over the last 12 years. Fuh-gedd-about-it, TM is a must.
author: Andrew L.

description: Either Schwarma or Falafel are awesome, and are a full meal in and of themselves.  No-frills decor.  Always-friendly service.  Eat on stool at counter or takeout.
author: Tyler H.

description: Good food, but no Ali Baba's.  Clean & neat though.
author: Heidi P.

description: I had the chicken shwerma last night and it was very good.  I think it's about $1 too expensive and the seating situation is no good.
author: Val U.

description: Shawerma is the only thing I order from here because it is so delicious.  It's wrapped up in foil and perfect for eating as you saunter down Valencia.  It's HUGE and I usually save half of it for later.  Shawerma never tastes as good anywhere else.
author: katie e.

description: This place is very good and prices are fair. I've been eating here since the location on upper Haight went away. If you haven't been give it a shot. The lamb shewarma is fantastic.
author: Kfir L.

description:
Shawermas - lamb and chicken are excelente - great for a snack or meal anytime of the day - This is what fast food should really be.

Falafels - so so - not exactly a ton of flavor but still pretty good - make sure you get the hot sauce it make a huge difference
author: Jaime A.

description: I love the chicken kabob here.  A bit pricey, but very tasty with marinated chicken breast chunks cooked to order.  Can't speak much for the other stuff, since I always get sucked into the usual ... except I don't really recommend the yogurt garlic drink.
author: Jason W.

description: Falaphel...really good. Best I have had in SF.I haven't tried their other dishes but falaphel was very good.
author: Rk K.

description:
Hmm, i'm in the hunt for a good donner kebab replacement, and the lamb shawerma was going to be it.  It was good, though, I must admit it didn't bowl me over for a five star rating.  and didn't hit the donner kebab spot. The 3.5- 4 star partly for the food, esp that they ask you if you want it spicy, and also that they're quick and no fuss.  Actually, I think i would have been perfectly happy if they cut my lamb off the skewer (false advertising!), instead of using the precut stuff, and if my lamb was a little less fatty...

The place is really more of a quick stop sort of place, but I see huge potential for late night drunk food.  I bet the chicken shawerma is better than the lamb, but apparently they only serve it on Tues and Fri.  That's silly, i'm sure they could buy another machine and have both...

Next time i'll have to give the falafels a try, maybe that'll give it another star...
author: Jay S.

description: Good shawarma and fast service. Price a little on the steep side.
author: steve a.

description: The chicken shwarma was just alright.. It needed A LOT more flavor. I didnt really think that this place can be considered one of the best's for this type of cuisine in SF.
author: Retired B.

description: Best chicken shawarma I've ever had!  The meat was tender, not dry, the sauces flavorful, but not runny. Also had the freshly made carrot juice. Delicious!  Parking can be a challenge.  Best to take the BART and walk over.  Get carry out unless you like cozy restaurant spaces.  Spicy is mild or go non-spicy, if you like.
author: Cindy M.

description: truly delicous. get the combo plate, an amazing deal, less than $10 and easily two meals for any normal human. if it's a nice day, enjoy it out on the sidewalk and take the leftovers home. one o the best take-out options in the area.
author: Daryl F.

description: the lamb shawerma was tasty but probably not one of the 100 things i need to have eaten in sf before i died-- also it dripped grease onto a favorite jacket of mine and i do hold that against it
author: m t.

description: i have had the lamb and chicken shawerma sandwiches. the lamb can be fatty for my taste but isn't bad but the chicken really floats my boat. i asked the wife if we can make tuesday or friday a weekly chicken shawerma date. i think i got the nod of approval. we both love the chicken. i also get 6 falafel to go for about $1.50 give or take. great chicken shawerma and i wish they would make them another day or two each week. the guy behind me in line was telling his friend that he lives 45 minutes from the truly mediterranean and is a frequent visitor. so he must really like them too.
author: roger b.

description: This place is great!  The guys in there are great too!  My friends always laugh at me when I go there because I get a Shawarma Deluxe with out the onions and potatoes, with some humus and then 2 falafel.  Does this sandwich really exist?  Well it does when I ask them for it.  Some restaurants would be irritated, but the guys there just smile.
author: Lana L.

description: i came here for the 1st time yesterday and really enjoyed it, i will definitely be returning next time i want grab and go food in this area! the lamb shawerma was amazing!! a great sauce, good lamb, onions and tomatoes what else could i ask for.. and it was huge/$8. everyone working there was so nice and i enjoyed watching them make all the food. try it out, you will be very pleased!
author: Barbara C.

description: Hands down, best falafel in San Francisco.
author: Dre D.

description: my first time at TM they were blasting 'Aicha.' i freakin love that song, so emotional. anyhow...as a warning never, ever try to split a falafel or shwarma here. the manager refused to half our order on the basis that it was friday and we should eat more! in my multitudes of visits i have not yet finished a falafel deluxe, my scrumptious moiety is the perfect size for me. i love the hot sauce, eggplant and potato, but if you're in the mood for  meat, the options are there.
author: Ligaya T.

description: This lil gem really gets a 3.5, being in the heart of the Mission it's a regular spot for my girlfriend and I, we often get the combo platter but you can order their falafels by the piece which are fresh moist and steamy on the inside yet crispy on the outside.  Each time we go she insists we get half a dozen drizzled with their hot sauce, tahini and a pile of parsley sprigs.  On Tuesdays and Fridays they have the chicken and lamb shawarmas available Tues/Fri straight off that vertical rotating grill (that i'm sure has a proper name).  I like the fact that they use the thinner pita wraps and pop them on the grill for a light toasting after the wrap is made. Fresh squeezed carrot juice and their signature garlic yogurt drinks are great in the summer!  I have yet to try their desserts (baklava assortments) but for $1-2 it's hard to go wrong.  Great value and a quick stop option when you're in a hurry or even suffering that late night snack attack after a few drinks at the bar.  The staff are super friendly and they always have the best 80's and dance beats blasting in their hardly 120 square ft establishment. In/Outside seating for 6-10, great for take out! Caution, the wraps tend to be loaded with tahini watch for the spill.
author: Akash D.

description: every time i go into truly med for a felafel or a shwarma i get hit on by the guys behind the counter. as flattering as that may be i think to myself...'here i am buying a monstrous sandwich that has two days of food in it and they think this is hot? okee dokee, as long as they don't follow me home thats fine by me....now, how about workin' it for extra cucumbers on that, eh?...oh baby, now thats the stuff!'
author: Bad Ass Chic K.

description: i haven't experimented much with the menu, but that's b/c if it ain't broke, why fix it?!  the shawerma is magnificent!!!  tuesdays and thursdays they only make chicken shawerma (of which i'm not so much a fan), but other days it's lamb.  sure it's a hole in the wall, but it's also dirt cheap (for the quantity of food you get)...and it's sooooooooo good!!
author: Roshni R.

description: the lamb shawarma is to die for. Greasy as hell but so good. And I agree, the hot sauce is delicious!
author: Alana L.

description: This is the absolute best falafel i have ever had. without a doubt. other falafels, at other restaurants, in san francisco and elsewhere cause me to shed a private little tear (or two) for the Real Falafel, the One I Really Want. no wasteful globs of hummus, wonderful seasoned onions, and the right level of heat in the slightly tangy hot sauce (you should always ask for extra) combine with their beautifully homemade falafel balls to make my favorite carb load before drinking my brains out at delirium, or really.. whenever. whenever, falafel. always falafel. if you are a regular, they might just hook you up. stop in around closing time, you faithful regulars, and youll see what i mean. i even prefer to suck it up and eat at the outside table - hustlers, be damned! - because there is no way i am going to wait five or ten minutes to eat my falafel. and thats a resounding recommendation if i ever heard (made?) one.
author: Andrea H.

description: This must be a weak-ass city for middle eastern / lucky sephardi food.  I gotta call weak sauce.  The big problem here was the blandness of the falafel in the wrap I got (original, not deluxe), coupled with how scattered the hot sauce was throughout the wrap.  If I'm getting something with so many rich ingredents I need some acidity to cut through things, and the hot sauce, while tasty, was inadequately distributed.
author: Srikanth S.

description: chicken shwarma (tuesday & friday only) is the bomb!  this place was my meal plan for a long time.  they have great falafels, excellent baklavah(sp?) and friendly staff.  mediterranean music blares in the backgorund making it feel truly med.
author: Kevin J.

description: I'd been going here for many years and had always been happy with the food. But something happened the other night that made me decide to never go back. A bunch of us went and got our falafels and schwarmas and took them back to a friend's house. Towards the end of our meal someone found a TOENAIL CLIPPING in his falafel (he had to take it out of his mouth, so gross). Some things are deal breakers in a relationship and this ended mine with Truly Med.
author: dissipatedfog ..

description: The best falafels and shawermas in the bay area. Great for vegetarians and carnivores!
author: robert d.

description: Best chicken shwarma in the Bay Area.  They do it right, ordered it spicy and definitely was not disappointed in the least.  Their garlic yogurt drink is also right on, I am use to a little more garlic and mint in mine, but the consistency and flavor is again better than other spots I have tried in the area.
author: Tim G.

description: Truly Med is a great cheap eats place. Friendly people, decent food, not too expensive... I guess I can't complain, but the flavor didn't WOW me. I think I like Taboun's better...mm lentil rice. Anyways, the FALAFEL here is VERY VERY good, I like how they put sesame seeds on the outside so it doesn't lose that crispy texture even when it's been sitting there for a little bit (as we all know Falafel is best eaten fresh out of the fryer). The babaghanoush was good, hummus was good, but wasn't that huge of a fan of their tabbouleh or dolma. I got the chicken shawerma - the hot sauce was great, but the chicken wasn't that strong on their seasonings (I just wanted to put more & more & more hot sauce on). I liked how they grilled their pita, but if I was going to force rank this mediterranean cheap eats, I'd say it wasn't the top of my list.
author: Jeannette L.

description: not a fan. the wrap i got was lacking flavor and the chicken was dry and overcooked. my husband got the falafel wrap and he said they were bland too. i saw this place on Bay Cafe and it made me want to try it, then i went and was so disappointed. i'd rather go to Ali Baba's Cafe on Valencia & 19th - they have waaaaay better falafels there and i love their chicken shawarma.
author: Pumakat K.

description: this place is great, small hole in the wall, but friendly staff and great food. wish i could go right now. being a vegetarian i cant recommend any of the meat stuff, I usually get vegetarian fare, which here is sooooo good. the falafel, all I can say is get extra!
author: Kay L.

description: Holy God, the chicken shawerma, available only on Tuesdays and Fridays is one of the best food products ever made. For those of you not familiar with this culinary masterpiece, it's kind of like the burrito of the Mediterranean, but you don't feel completely gross after eating it. Filled with cooked tomatoes, onions, cucumbers, yogurt sauce and spicy, but not hot, chicken, for fast food, this may be the best option in town.
author: Brian B.

description: Yuk, yuk, yuk!  Lousy place with gents behind the counter that are too busy arguing with eachother.  I must of visited on a night when the boss was away as the employees could care less about the customers.  Very slow service and really icky food.  Meat was ok......everything else covered in parsley.....YUK!   Ordered a feta burger and when I got home I found no feta.....anyone seen my feta?   I asked the dude taking the cash if I could add one more item, he says...."you need to ask the other guy"......ummmm you mean the dude RIGHT NEXT TO YOU?    What a joke...no thanks.....keep on walking bye.....ba bye!
author: Demetri A.

description: for $6, i got a falafel sandwich (comes with hummus, cucumber salad, fried potatoes and eggplant wrapped in a huge sheet of flatbread) that could have sustained an entire asian family for a week!  okay, . .so i exaggerate, but it was definitely more food than i could eat despite eating it in two intervals (pre-clubbing noshing, stashed in fridge and then post-club munchies) ;P  the falafel was quite good (thought it doesn't quite hold a candle to the famous san jose falafel drive-in) and at such a bargain price, makes a great alternative to cheap mexican or burgers in the mission :-)  i went on a friday night, so they were quite busy, but the guy behind the counter assembling the food was very nice and even apologized to each customer for the wait . .all while making 6 falafel sandwiches at a time!
author: tiffany t.

description: i always get the falafel deluxe and split it with my girl, and it's enough. the french fries are a bit dry, but the dressing they put make up for it. it's a tiny place with a lot to offer. too bad they hardly have any place to sit around. the eggplants are a bit greasy, but all in all...it's quite yummy
author: Jen R.

description: this place was allright.  i picked up some lamb shwarma, chicken kebab, and the mediterranean plate.  the shwarma was good, though not as good as hyped.  the prices are ok for the amount of food, though i'm not sure it would be worth it to brave the parking issues of the mission to get it again.
author: Molly C.

description: Awesome falafels!!  And the baba gahnoush is to die for.  Love the guys that work here, always friendly and funny.  The food is fresh and delish!
author: Brenna K.

description: perhaps the best falafel in the city, its as fresh as it comes. Their bread is not good though (that lavash whatever), but they manage to cover that fact by grilling the sandwich for a minute. I would recommend sticking to the basics there, order a falafel wrap, with only hummus and tahini, maybe some fries and tomatoes, but that's it, their other salads kinda ruin the experience
author: Ron F.

description: Mostly a take out place although there is a counter and two grungy tables out front.  Order a lamb schwerma --- make sure to ask for hot sauce and extra crispy (they leave it on the grill for a bit longer and the bread wrap gets crispy.)  The falafel schwerma is good too but not quite as satisfying as chomping on grilled lamb flesh.  Baahhhhahhaa...
author: David M.

description:
best shawerma in the city of those i've tried! the meat shawerma is either chicken or lamb and both are wonderful.  also the baklava was excellent. good price for a good lunch. i go here at least once a month.  

the setup is simple, order at the counter and take your food to go.  there are a few bar seats, but nothing too comfortable and the interior is small.  if there's a line, you'll have 0 space.  of course parking is usually rough in this area, but not impossible- and its close to BART and MUNI.  

i've been eating this food since they were at their previous location on haight street and am always looking forward to my next visit. and i can use my credit card (which isn't a given everywhere and definitely adds to the convenience factor)!
author: Jay J.

description: I kind of remembered but forgot their Schwarma is so good!  Last night I was in the neighborhood and decided to stop and I practically inhaled lamb schwarma.  Not because I was hungry but I couldn't stop "Wow! Wow! this is so goooood!!!"  I love good and cheap food.
author: Su Kyeong K.

description:
I dropped by before a movie at the Roxie and ordered a Lamb Shwerma and my girlfriend order a Falafel Deluxe wrap. The guy behind the counter asked her how hot she wanted it and she told him. I then ordered mine and told the guy medium hot and no onions. When we got our food, we sat outside and after 1 bite I realized that mine had onions. I went inside and nicely  told them that I had asked for no onions. Instead of apologizing and offering to make it correct, they argued with me repeatedly and refused to offer a replacement. I threw mine in the garbage (the lamb sucked anyways...) My girlfriend ate hers and even though she is fine with onions, by the end of the movie, she was pretty ill from the overwhelming portion of onions.
These guys are super rude and the food is "low-grade gog food". If you want a good gyro, falafel or shwerma, try Balladie on Kearny near downtown. Ali Baba's cave in lower Haight is also a big thumbs up! Oh yeah, the food here is about $1 over priced compared to other places.
author: Eric D.

description: their main business is in schwarma and falafel. lamb kebab is much better! but takes 10 min to make. it costs the same as schwarma - 7.62. good place to people watch.
author: alec m.

description: i can't believe i have been living a few blocks away from this place for so long without ever having experienced it's tasty goodness.  as soon as i was done with my falafel i was ready for more.  and seriously... falafel with french fries... how could you go wrong?!
author: amanda w.

description: yum!  yum!  yum!!  when i don't want to eat yet another burrito in san diego i can't help but miss the yummy and super affordable schwarma that lived down the street from me and my lovely apartment at 16th and guerrero.  YUM!!
author: becky k.

description: it's oo-kaay. nothing special.
author: Angela N.

description: it's alright. then again, i've only had the falafel and the lamb shawarma (which was a little too greasy and fatty for my liking). what's the deal with them only serving chicken twice a week? maybe i'll up them one star when i try their chicken shawarma. so far, the chicken shawarma at oasis gril in the fidi is tops on my list.
author: James J.

description: Well parking's a bitch and the place is ideal for take out since there's hardly any seating in this small joint.  There are also lots of weirdo's hanging outside as well but they still have good food.  Lamb Shwerma was $7.85 and the chicken shwerma is not bad either.
author: Maryanne D.

description: Does not live up to the hype.  The mediterranean food is mediocre at best; there is much better mediterranean food available in the bay area.  The meat was bland, the veggies were bland, the selection was limited, and, very importantly, the bread was sad.  Just a plain old lavash bread.  The mediterranean / babalous in SF / concord / walnut creek runs circles around this place and it's just good, not great.  If the food were good, then I could forgive the rest, but since the food is sad, then the fact that it's dirty (filthy actually), seating is poor just add to the disappointment.  Who is rating this place high???!!!   Something just doesn't add up.  And the Mission just bristles with much better places around every corner!
author: Fred G.

description: Probably the best shawarma I've ever had, and the toasted pita is a really nice touch.  The only downside is that it is a bit price (about $7.50 for my shawarma sandwich).
author: Saikat C.

description: The chicken shawarma, which I believe is only served on Tuesdays and Fridays, is superb.  The lamb shawarma is pretty good, and the falafel is just ok.  After reading all the positive reviews about the falafel, I must admit that I was somewhat disappointed since it was bland.  Yes, even with hot sauce.
author: C H.

description: The best schwerma I've ever head. I like the Lamb best, but the chicken is very good too.  The falafels are great too, try it with some of the options like feta or eggplant or potato.  My only complaint is that there is no where to sit really; you basically have to get stuff to go.  Still the food is so good that its' worth the hassle.  Slightly pricey for fast food, budget $10 for food and a drink.
author: Rusty H.

description: I visit this place at least once a week, either on Tuesdays or Fridays when they have chicken shawarma. I always get a wrap with hot sauce and no yogurt or tahini sauce. Can't beat the taste of shredded morsels of perfectly cooked chicken, encased in a wrap with spicy sauce, onions and tomatoes -- I am addicted!
author: girish p.

description: I have been going to Truly Mediterranean for nearly ten years.  Every time I would visit the city I would insist on dining there.  Now that I live in San Francisco, I plan on frequenting it.  Best falafel ever.  The portions are generous and the price is reasonable.  The falafel is scrumptious and I have been told that the shawarmas are great.
author: Sheeva G.

description: clearly, what this place needs is another glowing review to convince people to go here.  but i just can't resist, and they deserve the props.  i usually get their hummus sandwich with hot sauce and it is simply devine.  the falafel and lamb schwerma are delicious as well, but also quite large, so be ready!  its definitely a hole-in-the-wall, but so far nothing else compares.
author: Erin C.

description: I go here every time I'm in the city.  The falafel deluxe with hummus instead of potatoes is my favorite.  It's fast, cheap, and delicious.
author: Haylee W.

description:
12/16/2006 
ahh.. TRULY med (well, not actually having been anywhere near the mediterranean, that's really just my taste-buds benchmarking against some fantastical place in my mind where the food is really good).
author: Trystero T.

description: Not great to eat inside obviously but the babaganoush was the best ever and i love lamb so my wrap was excellent and it came w/ this awesome sauce-duno what it was or if it was authentic but it was frakin great! If someone knows a better place tell me please-or if its of equal caliber sit down restaurant =) we yelpers need some rules.... stop bringin ur drama into ur critique i don't care if it didn't taste nearly as good as ur mamas falafels-wtf- am i gona make a reservation at ur house! be reasonable
author: Monica M.

description: My only complaint is my falafel deluxe is sometimes not quite hot enough. Otherwise, the best falafel sandwich I have had in the city.
author: Neil D.

description: so, i eat here more often than i would admit in conversation. not because so great, but because i like to eat baby lambs. and there's so where else in the mission that serve baby lambs at night, when i'm smashes.  the mediterranean plate is legit also. (never would have spelt that right if yelp didn't have a checker) the place on Divis. and bush is more better, but far away, and only open during suit hours.
author: Kiyoshi F.

description: the best falafel ever.... i actually ordered a chicken kabob and while i waiting the 10 minutes it takes to cook it they offered me a little basket of falafel...for FREE...needless to say i never went back for the kabob...the falafel is amazing...the chicken shawerma is good too but they only have it on tues and thurs....i dream about truly mediterraneans falafel...and the staff there is always really nice
author: Windy M.

description: My first schwarma and I have to say the best.  I first started going to the one in the Haight (closed) and then to the one in the Mission and like some dope sick junkie will follow if and when they leave there. Tuesday and Fridays are chicken schwarma night--absolutely the best!
author: Ken P.

description: The best Middle Eastern food in da Bay.  I would know,  I have ate at almost all of them.  The chicken sharawma is really good and I hate wraps.  They have the best falafel. I usually get the combo plate minus dolma, extra falafel.  Too bad there is very little seating and I don't come to the Mission too often.
author: Will M.

description:
yummy...came here on a sunday afternoon for a late lunch/snack. read many reviews about the place and since i've been craving mediterranean quick eats, this was the perfect place. tiny hole in the wall with cheap, decent prices..great for something on the go or to snack on right there. 
my bf and i ordered the combo plate (dolmas, hummus, babaganoush, pitas, tabouli salad, and cucumber salad)...it's a great combo plate for vegetarians and non-vegetarians as well! all the flavors were crisp, clean, and just damn plain GOOD!!
we also ordered a chicken kebab & shwarma....it was like a cross between a gyro/burrito...huge!! a great meal just by itself...after sharing the combo plate and munching on my chicken kebab gyro, i was too stuffed to finish it & took home the other half of my gyro thingy.
my bf had the shwaerma which was a mix of lamb and beef (sirloin i think?) and he ate the whole thing b/c it was soooo good. there was broiled tomatoes, tabouli salad, onions, tahini sauce & the meat all wrapped on lavash bread & then grilled again--wonderful crunchy, chewy pita type bread texture!!

and of course, a piece of pistachio baklava to go for the late nite snacking...that was good but a little too sweet for my taste (then again, i'm not much of a sweets person)

would i come back again? hell yes!!
author: Yolanda L.
